title: Common Market Plan for Consulting U.S. Expected
description: BONN, May 31  The nine European Common Market foreign ministers are expected to agree formally on a proposal to improve consultations with the United States at a meeting here June 10 and 11, according to a highranking German diplomat. The meeting is regarded as a significant one.

title: H.I.P. PAID FEES TO OWN OFFICIAL
description: An investigation by the State Insurance Department has determined that the Health Insurance Plan (H.I.P.) paid more than $80,000 in the last 18 months to a Queens abortion center operated by Dr. Martin Gold, a member of the health plan's board of directors.

title: ROTHKO PAINTING TRAVELED ABROAD
description: Untitled, 1954, a Mark Rothko painting that rose in price from $18,000 to $180,000 within six months after it was acquired here by a Marlbor ough Gallery, went through the hands of two Liechtenstein corporations and traveled to Toronto and back within three weeks after Marlborough's initial acquisition, according to testimony yesterday.

title: LORD ROSEBERY DIES; RACED DERBY HORSES
description: CHEDDINGTON, England, May 31 (UPI)Lord Rosebery, whose love of horse racing won him the title of the grand old gentleman of the turf, died last evening at his home here, He was 92 years old.

title: Endangered Species
description: The Ninth Avenue Festival is over, but more than the memory lingers on. The weekend that offered a cornucopia of neighborhood delicacies and delights was only a wellpublicized sampling of what is still there: a modest avenue lined with small stores providing a treasury fresh meats, fish, produce, baked goods and ethnic food specialties of the highest quality and most tantalizing variety. This is the stuff, and staff, of life, not to be found in the standardized, prepackaged precincts of any Supermarket.

title: ETHIOPIAN REBELS SET RANSOM TERM
description: The Ethiopian guerrilla group that abducted an American missionary nurse from a village hospital in the northern province of Eritrea on Monday has demanded an undisclosed quantity of medical supplies in return for the safe release of the pregnant, 24yearold New Jersey womail.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 31

title: Wilbur Wood Back in Winning Channel
description: Since discovering what he was doing wrong by watching himself on videotape earlier this year, Wilbur Wood has been almost unbeatable. Last night the Chicago White Sox southpaw knuckleballer survived The Wall a disaster area for lefthanders in Boston, to defeat the Red Sox, 32.

title: WILSON SIGNS BILL OR ELECTION FUNDS
description: ALBANY, May 31Governor Wilson announced today that he had signed into law the comprehensive electioncampaign reform measure, which limits campaign spending, restricts campaign contributions, tightens campaign financereporting requirements and creates a new Board of Elections with overall administration and enforcement authority.

title: OVERHAUL OF REVIEW OF INSURERS SOUGHT
description: A major overhaul in the manner in which state regulators review the financial condition of insurance companies will go to a vote of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners when it opens its annual meeting on Monday in San Francisco.

title: New Leader Exhorts Portugal To Build a Truly Free Nation
description: COIMBRA, Portugal, May 31 President Antnio de Spnola, addressing an enthusiastic crowd here, called on the nation today to build a democratic Portugal, truly free and with more social justice.

title: NOW Expands the List of What It's For and What It's Against
description: The Houston conference of the National Organization for Women, which ended with a board meeting this week, committed NOW's 700 chapters to increased action on behalf of personhooda word newly prominent in the feminist vocabularyor older women, homemakers, nurses, volunteer workers, women in sports, aggrieved women and children of divorce, women in poverty and even women in foreign countries.

title: PACT TALKS RESUME IN CLOTHING TRADE
description: Negotiators for 110,000 clothing workers and about 700 manufacturers of men's and boy's clothing across the country resumed contract talks here late yesterday in an effort to avert what Federal mediators said would be the first industrywide strike in 50 years.

title: China and Malaysia Establish Relations
description: HONG KONG, May 31China scored a major breakthrough in Southeast Asia today with the signing of an agreement establishing full diplomatic relations with Malaysia.

title: SUPREME COURT AGREES TO DECIDE NOW IF NIXON CAN WITHHOLD EVIDENCE
description: WASHINGTON, May 31The Supreme Court agreed today to decide quickly whether President Nixon can withhold evidence of possible crimes from the Watergate special prosecutor, Leon Jaworski.

title: Harassment Reported at U.S. Embassy in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, May 31  Soviet policemen have reportedly tightened controls and stepped up harassment around the American Embassy, intercepting and sometimes holding and interrogating Soviet citizens, Americans and even diplomats trying to enter the embassy.

title: Chris Evert And Nastase Gain at Net
description: ROME, May 31 (AP)Ilie Nastase rallied for a 36, 61, 63 triumph over Roscoe Tanner today in the third round of the Italian open tennis championships. Nastase is the defender and the topseeded player.

title: NIXON SIGNS 2 BILLS ON VETERANS FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (UPI) President Nixon signed today two measures increasing benefits for Vietnam era veterans and their families.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: BUILDERS ACCUSED OF $500,000 BRIBE
description: NEWARK, May 31A Federal grand jury indicted two men today on charges of conspiring to bribe Mayor Burt Ross of Fort Lee with $500,000 to use his influence in getting the borough to approve a $250million commercial development complex overlooking the George Washington Bridge.

title: Lockheed Deal Would Release U.S. From Big Loan Guarantee
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation and Textron, Inc., have agreed in principle on massive deal that would release the Government from its guarantee of $200million in loans to Lockheed and revitalize the ailing giant with at least $75million in Textron funds.

title: Frederic R. Colie Is Dead; Former New Jersey Judge
description: Frederic R. Colie, a former judge of the New Jersey State Supreme Court, died yesterday at St. Barnabas Medical Center in Livingston, N. J. He was 79 years old and lived in Short Hills, N. J.

title: ARGENTINE REBELS HOLD TOWN AN HOUR
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 31More than 40 Marxist guerrillas briefly took control late last night of a small town about 650 miles northwest of Buenos Aires, according to police sources and news reports from the area.

title: Ashland Oil Price Rise
description: Ashland Oil, Inc., announced yesterday that it would raise its gasoline prices by 2 cents a gallon, beginning today.

title: Market Place: New Issues: Opportunities?
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 31 The newissues market is dead and some believe it will never be resurrected. Hardly anybody these days is able to take a promising new company public and thus obtain the necessary permanent capital required for growth. Things have been so bad that many underwriters have gone out of existence or have been combined with other firms.

title: Mrs. Ford Urges Commitment by Westminster Choir College's Seniors
description: PRINCETON, May 31The art revolution is with us, and this is a good time for your talents whether you are a teacher, director or performer, Mrs. Gerald R. Ford, wife of the Vice President, told 100 members of the 45th graduating class of Westminster Choir College here today.

title: Classroom in the Sky
description: A remarkable experiment in public service broadcasting is ready to make real the dream of a classroom in the, sky. Hanging 22,300 miles above the Galapagos Islands in the Pacific is a tonandahalf satellite aimed at remote regions from Appalachia to Alaska.

title: SYRIA REPORTED IN PLEDGE TO BAR GUERRILLA RAIDS
description: GENEVA, May 31  Syria's President gave secret assurances to Israel through Secretary of State Kissinger that Palestinian guerrillas would not infiltrate into Israel across the Syrian border, Middle East Peace Conference sources here said today.

title: A 64 Puts Trevino a Shot Ahead at 134
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., May 31Scores continued to dive today in the $250,000 Kemper open, much like the stock market on a panic day. A oneunderpar total was not good enough to make the 36hole cut.

title: Chris Evert And Nastase Gain at Net
description: ROME, May 31 (AP)Ilie Nastase rallied for a 36, 6.1, 63 triumph over Roscoe Tanner today in the third round of the Italian open tennis championships. Nastase is the defender and the topseeded player.

title: Big Republican Names Avoiding Election Contests in California
description: LOS ANGELES, May 31In California, as in many states, it is not necessary to wait for the election results to know that it is a bad year for Republican.

title: New Cancer Cases Widen Fears on Vinyl Chloride
description: Four new cases of angiosarcoma of the liver have just been uncovered. They raise for the first time the possibility in the minds of public health officials that this fatal cancer hazard that has been linked to vinyl chloride may extend to hundreds of thousands of workers and to members of the general public.

title: Plumbers Case Dismissal Opposed
description: WASHINGTON, May 31The special Watergate prosecutor's office, in effect joining forces with the White House, asked a Federal judge today to force a showdownand perhaps dismissalIn plumbers case because of White House rerusal to turn over subpoenaed documents.

title: India to Buy Wheat
description: Official sources in New Delhi said yesterday the India Supply Mission in Washington had been directed to buy as much wheat as it can to offset food shortages expected this year. Details on Page 37.

title: Two Found Guilty at RaceFixing Trial
description: Forrest Gerry Jr., the former horse trainer who bragged of having various harness drivers in my pocket, was convicted in Brooklyn Federal Court yesterday on both counts of a sportsbriberyconspiracy charge.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Asians Picket Building Site, Charging Bias
description: Several hundred pickets, from schoolgirls carrying their books to wizened members of the Chinese Golden Age Club, marched and chanted outside the Confucius Plaza construction site in Chinatown yesterday in continuing protest against alleged discrimination against AsianAmerican workers.

title: Back Dividends to Be Paid By Allstate Insurance Co.
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 31 (UPI) The Allstate Insurance Company agreed today to pay $4million in back dividends to about 350,000 Texas policyholders rather than fight a state insurance board order in the courts.

title: Art: At National Gallery
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 For anyone who responds to the special felicities of the art of drawingand anyone who doesn't had better resign himself to a fundamental lark of interest in the visual artsthe exhibition opening Sunday at the National Gallery of Art is a compelling event. Under the benign but accurate title of Recent Acquisitions and Promised Gifts: Sculpture, Drawings, Prints, the museum has assembled ed a survey of some of the greatest draftsmen in the history of Western art. Drawings by Dtirer, da Vinci, Raphael, Bernini, Poussin, Prud'hon, Seurat, Van Gogh and Degas are included, and even some of the lesser or anonymous talents are represented by works of exceptional quality.

title: MAHEU SAYS NIXON ANGERED HUGHES
description: LOS ANGELES, May 31In 1969 and 1970 Howard R. Hughes was offered and turned down four avenues for expressing directly to President Nixon his objection to nuclear weapons testing, Robert A. Maheu testified in Federal court here today.

title: New Jersey Sports Clearing a Hurdle
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., May 31.Bill Duren, the outstanding highhurdler in New Jersey high school track this season, remembers vividly his first attempt at hurdling.

title: Arab Turn to the West
description: WASHINGTON, May 31American officials have refrained from talking about it publicly, but many of them say privately that Secretary of State Kissinger's persistence in bringing about the Syrianlsraeli disengagement agreement will open the way for the United States to displace the Soviet Union as the major foreign influence in the Arab world.

title: Syracuse Newhouse Unit Adds School of Broadcast Journalism
description: SYRACUSE, May 31A new building devoted to teaching broadcast journalism was added today to the 10yearold Newhouse Communications Center of Syracuse University, where newspaper and magazine courses are taught.

title: SALES RISE 133% AT RETAIL CHAINS
description: April sales among 35 of the country's largest retail chains selling a diversity of merchandise rose an average 13.3 per cent over the yearearlier month, while sales for the year so far through April rose 12.7 per cent.

title: KENNEDY ARGUES HIS CASE IN COURT
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP)Personally arguing his own case, Senator Edward M Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, told the United States Court of Appeals for the Dis trict of Columbia today that President Nixon's veto of health bill four years ago we: clearly invalid.

title: Cedeno Gets 4 Hits  Scherman Bails Out Wilson in 7th
description: Not long ago, the Houston Astros were going through a 16game losing streak. Now they are going through a fivegame winning streak, the fifth victim being the New York Mets last night.

title: BigCity Problems Peril San Francisco's Charming Image
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 31 The City, San Franciscans call it. And there's no need to ask which city they mean.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A juror's derogatory comment about Joseph M, McCrane Jr., former Treasurer of New Jersey, apparently convinced a judge in Superior Court to declare a mistrial Thursday in the conspiracy trial of Mr. McCrane and two Republican fundraisers. Judge George Y. Schoch and lawyers in the case have refused to discuss the reason for the mistrial, but jurors questioned said that one juror had made a disparaging remark about Mr. McCrane in the jury room with other members of the panel present before trial started Thursday.

title: Portuguese Talks With Rebels Hit Snags
description: LONDON, May 31Talks between Portugal and the independence movement in Guinea, the smallest of the three Portuguese African territories, were suspended today after encountering several obstacles.

title: EXAMINER BACKS A RISE FOR LILCO
description: ALBANY, May 31A Public Service Commission examiner today recommended an interim electric rate increase of $28,739,000 for the Long Island Lighting Company, saying that the company needs the added revenue to be able to issue bonds to finance new construction.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 31 (UPI)The New Orleans Whatchamacallits, newest team in the National. Basketball Association, will get a name late next week. Officials of the franchise say they have narrowed over 6,500 entries in a name contest down to eight suggestions. They said today that they would announce the name and display the team's purple, green and gold uniforms late next week. The colors are the official colors of Mardi Gras.

title: ITALY INVESTIGATES RIGHTISTS IN BLAST
description: ROME, May 31The police today investigated rightwing extremist groups throughout Italy in an attempt to identify persons responsible for the bomb attack in Brescia Tuesday in which six persons were killed.

title: Cordero Is Set Down for 7 Days
description: Angel Cordero, who less than a month ago won the Kentucky Derby aboard Cannonade, learned yesterday that he won't get the chance to repeat his achievement in the Belmont Stakes. Cordero was handed a sevenday suspension that will start Monday and include Saturday, the day of the Triple Crown finale.

title: WATERGATE JURY GETS EXTENSION
description: WASHINGTON, May 31The original Watergate grand jury, which will be two years old on June 5, was extended today for another six months by Chief Judge George L. Hart Jr., in Federal District Court here.

title: OVERHAUL OF REVIEW OF INSURERS SOUGH
description: A major overhaul in the manner in which state regulators review the financial condition of insurance companies will go to a vote of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners when it opens its annual meeting on Monday in San Francisco.

title: Mrs. Chapot Takes Title On Sharrar
description: DEVON, Pa., May 31It has been about four years since Mrs. Frank Chapot has had a jumper capable of winning on the big summer horse show circuit.

title: POINTER SISTERS BURST INTO TOWN
description: The Pointer Sistersall four of them; June, the youngest, was sick for the, team's March 13 date at Avery Fisher Hall settled into the WaldorfAstoria's Empire Room on Thursday night and will be there through June 15.

title: People and Business
description: While real income is expected to increase about 50 per cent during the next 10 years, discretionary income will grow five times as fast, according to Fabian Linden, director of consumer research for the Conference Board.

title: Became to Sign RentRise Repeal; Landlords Threaten Retaliation
description: Mayor Beame said yesterday that he would sign City Council legislation to repeal and roll back rent increases of up to 4 per cent a year in many of the one million rentcontrolled apartments here.

title: Antiques: Indian Figures
description: Tobacco, one of the first industries in America, became linked with Indians, this country's first inhabitants, by British shopsign carvers and painters as early as the 17th century. Shortly before the outbreak here of the War for Independence, American artisans also began sculpturing sturdy, fierceeyed Indian figures and gilding their tobaccoleaf headdresses, all as a sideline to their main pursuitcarving figureheads of ships.

title: Horses & Equipment
description: REGISTERED QUARTER HORSES: SELLING AA Staillons, broodmares with foals, yearlings, gelding. Carry the bloodlines of The Haymaker AAA, Bold Lightening AAA, Depth Charge, Zantanon. Phone evenings 6075472263.

title: Adelle Davis, Nutritionist, Bestselling Author, Dies
description: PALOS VERDES ESTATES, Calif., May 31 (UPI)Adelle Davis, one of the nation's bestknown authorities on nutrition, who contended that almost any disease could be prevented by proper diet, died at her home today of bone cancer. She was 70 years old.

title: Prices of Stocks Decline in Dull Trading
description: The stock market finished slightly lower in lethargic trading yesterday after an expected reduction in the prime lending rate did not materialize.

title: Statement by Truce Chief
description: GENEVA, May 31 (AP)Following is the text of statement made by Gen. Ensio Siilasvuo, Finnish commander of the United Nations peacekeeping force in the Middle East, before the signing of the IsraeliSyrian disengagement accord today:

title: Thailand Feels Her Way Toward Democracy
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 31  Thailand's sevenmonthold civilian order has weathered one minor political crisis set off by the resignation of a Premier many Thais call too democratic.

title: Beyond Politics
description: To an extraordinary degree, the question of President Nixon's possible impeachment has been kept outside the boundaries of politics. Increasingly, however, the question is: how long can this situation continue?

title: Dave Anderson
description: After 11 weeks, the harnessracing superfecta conspiracy trial has produced the conviction of two gamblers. Seven other defendants, including one driver, have been acquitted. The jury will resume its deliberations today on seven other drivers. No matter what the verdict, the rulers of Roosevelt Raceway, with exquisite timing, have assured the perpetuation of suspicion in harness racingif not suspicion of larceny in the past, then suspicion of a gangup on Herve Filion, the Canadian driver who is quickly approaching 5,000 victories in extending his career record. On the premise that blood is thicker than integrity, Roosevelt Raceway has invoked a rule prohibiting brothers, or father and sons, from driving in the same race, except for stakes events. Herve Filion and his younger brother, Henri, were the leading drivers at the recent Yonkers Raceway meeting, with 86 and 62 victories, respectively. Appearing in more than 50 per cent of the races there, but not always together, they wan 25 per cent. Ever since the current Roosevelt meeting opened last The Blood Rule has been in effect.

title: Business Briefs
description: The New York Bank for Savings, in the midst of major campaign to introduce checking accounts, disclosed yesterday that it had suspended its program temporarily so that it can comply with new state operational and clearing procedures. Arthur J. Quinn, president, said the bank expected to be offering the service again very soon.

title: DePailler Car Crashes
description: SALZBURG, Austria, May 31 (AP)  Patrick DePailler of France, driving a Mach 742, crashed into the guard rail of the Salzburg race course today during trials for a Formula Two auto race. DePailler was uninjured, but trials were canceled so workmen could replace a section of railing sheared off in the mishap. The race, scheduled for Sunday, counts toward the European championship.

title: Rail Freight Traffic Off
description: WASHINGTON, May 31The Association of American Railroads reported today that freight traffic on United States railroads during the latest week totaled an estimated 17.5 billion, tonmiles, 0.6 per cent below the corresponding week a year ago. Loadings in the same week totaled 550,442 cars, 2.4 per cent below last year.

title: Staff of Watergate Links Milk Prices to Nixon Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Mar. 31Donations by dairy cooperatives to President Nixon's 1972 reelection campaign were apparently linked directly to Mr. Nixon's order to raise milk price supports in 1971, according to the staff of the senate Watergate committee.

title: Democrats Hail G.O.P. Split on Rents
description: State Democrats have emerged from this year's legislative session with predictions that the Republican split between Governor Wilson and Assembly Speaker Perry B. Duryea will carry over into the state campaigns that formally begin in the next two weeks.

title: Sutton's Reappointment of Robinson Completes the New Board of Education
description: Borough President Percy E. Sutton of Manhattan reappointed Isaiah E. Robinson to the new Board of Education yesterday, completing the selection of the expanded sevenmember body that will oversee the decentralized city school system starting July 1.

title: Scarsdale, Readers Tell Mr. Allan, Is Far More Than Crabgrass
description: To the Editor: James Allan's article was among the most empty and meaningless I have read in a long time. It seems to me that the poor man is confusing his own failure as a husband and father with that of the community in which he lives: what the younger generation would call a copout. Mr. Allan's use of a pseudonym was a wise decision indeed.

title: Business Briefs
description: The New York Bank for Savings, in the midst of a major campaign to introduce checking accounts, disclosed yesterday that it had suspended its program temporarily so that it can comply with new state operational and clearing procedures. Arthur J. Quinn, president, said the bank expected to be offering the service again very soon.

title: SECURITY COUNCIL SETS GOLAN FORCE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. May 31The Security Counci approved today a joint Soviet United States resolution estab lishing a United Nations force to supervise the new Syrian. Israeli disengagement agreement.

title: Stir Crazy
description: WASHINGTON, May 31After Art Buchwald's exclusive interview with the White, House, I rushed out to get an interview of my own, but the White House was nowhere to be seen. This is what happened:

title: Percy Would Vote to Convict Nixon if He Flouts Court
description: BOSTON, May 31 (UPI) Senator Charles H. Percy, Republican of Illinois, said today he would vote to convict President Nixon in an impeachment trial if he places himself clearly above the law and the Supreme Court.

title: U.S. IN TRADE PACT WITH EUROPEANS
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 The United States and the European Common Market announced today a major trade agreement that will reduce European tariffs on more than 20 products of which the United States is a big exporter. The cuts will compensate the United States for damage to American imports resulting from the enlargements of the Common Market.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 31

title: At Last, All Quiet on the Golan Front
description: TEL SHAMS, IsraeliOccupied Syria, May 31After a final crescendo of shelling, the firing died away on the IsraeliSyrian front early this afternoon.

title: NEW DANCES GIVEN BY POMARE TROUPE
description: Eleo Pomare has successfully turned anger, generated by racial injustice, into a series of telling dances, but his latest work in this vein, Hushed Voices, lacks his previous vigor. It was presented for the first time Thursday evening at Hunter College Playhouse.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices finished mixed in slightly decreased trading on the American Stock Exchange yesterday. They also were mixed in the overthecounter market.

title: Ball in Museum Aids the Opera
description: NEWARK, May 31About 350 persons gathered tonight in an elegantly decorated room in the Newark Museum to dance to Strauss waltzes at a $100aperson dinner to benefit the Opera Theater of New Jersey's next season.

title: Freeing the P.A.
description: Governor Wilson's delay in signing a bill that would free the Port Authority to assume the responsibility helping develop metropolitan mass transit is disturbing. It is also puzzling in view of the sensitivity to urban transportation needs that Mr. Wilson displayed earlier supporting emergency aid to help save the 35cent fare on buses and subways.

title: WALTER P. HELMSLEY
description: Walter P. Helmsley, who retired in 1966 as vice president and treasurer of HelmsleySpear, Inc., of which his brother, Harry B. Helmsley, one of the largest realestate operators in the country, is president, died Wednesday in Delray Beach, Fla., where he lived, His age was 59.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE AMERICAN PEOPLE. The Findings of the 1970 Census. By E. J. Kahn Jr. 340 pages. Weybright and Talley. $8.95.

title: Henry Hercules and Hats
description: PARISIf Henry Kissinger hadn't already received the Nobel Peace Prize (or its better half) he would merit it this year as a result of his remarkable Middle East negotiations. In fact, there isn't any regulation governing that award which should prevent it going twice to the same man if he twice makes peace.

title: Syria and Israel sign Separation Pact in Geneva and Guns Fall Silent in Golan
description: GENEVA, May 31  Syria and Israel today signed an agreement here for separation of their military forces, and shortly thereafter their guns fell silent along the Golan Heights.

title: Way of Producing and Storing Cold Patented
description: WASHINGTON, May 31A pioneer in the solar heating of houses now offers summer cooling. Harry E. Thomason of Washington was granted Patent 3,812,903 this week for method of producing cold at night and storing it for daytime. use. In his Solaris houses, such as the one he lives in, the basement contains a large water tank that is warmed during the winter by water draining from the sunny roof. The tank is surrounded by stones that also collect the warmth. When warm air is needed in the house, a blower circulates it.

title: THOMAS N. HAIR
description: Thomas N. Hair, retired chief auditor of United Press International, died early yesterday. He was 62 years old.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Sources at the Middle East conference in Geneva said that President Hafez alAssad of Syria gave secret assurances that Palestinian guerrillas would not be permitted to infiltrate across the Syrian border into Israel. Although the assurances were spoken not written, they were accepted by Israel and were vital to the conclusion of the troop disengagement agreement. [1:5.] Representatives of Syria and Israel signed the agreement in the Palais des Nations in Geneva. [10:16.] With the signing of the agreement, the firing died away on the IsraeliSyrian front early yesterday afternoon, but throughout the morning artillery shells had exploded over wide areas of the Golan Heights and the Damascus Plateau, the final crescendo of the strange war of attrition begun by Syria 11 weeks [11:13.]

title: C.I.A. SAID TO FIND LUMBERS DATA
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 The Central Intelligence Agency has reportedly discovered a partial stenographic record of a telephone conversation in 1971 that may represent a crucial piece of evidence in the Government's upcoming prose cution of the White House plumbers.

title: 4 KEY DEMOCRATS BACKING SAMUELS IN GOVERNOR RACE
description: The state's key Democratic leaders have tentatively settled on Howard J. Samuels as their choice for the Democratic nomination for Governor, a decision that would assure his designation by the Democratic State Committee and very possibly foreclose a primary fight.

title: Local China Chief Criticized, As He Escorts Heath on Visit
description: KUNMING, China, May, 31A leading member of the Yunnan provincial administration was under public political attack here today as he accompanied Edward Heath, the former British Prime Minister, on an excursion.

title: BEAME WILL SIGN RENT RISE REPEAL
description: Mayor Beame said yesterday that he would sign City Council legislation to repeal and roll back rent increases of up to 4 per cent a year in many of the one million rentcontrolled apartments here.

title: City Stores Deficit Deepened in Quarter
Miss Maureen R. Boscarelli Is Married to Shane T. O'Neil
description: The Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More was the setting here yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Miss Maureen Regina Boscarelli, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. I. Frank Boscarelli of New York, to Shane Thomas O'Neil, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas F. O'Neil of Greenwich, Conn.

title: 4 FurUnion Leaders Sentenced to Prison On PayOff Charges
description: Four leaders of a furriers' union were sentenced in Fedral District Court yesterday to prison terms of up to three years and fined a total $37,000 for conspiracy, extortion, incometax evasion and labor racketeering.

title: Notes on People
description: The Pentagon disclosed yesterday that Gen. Creighton W. Abrams, the Army Chief of Staff, has lung, cancer. Further tests will be performed to determine the extent of the malignancy, a spokesman said. Medical authorities will then determine the appropriate treatment. The 59yearold general was admitted to Walter Reed Army Hospital in Washington last week, after he cut short a twoweek tour of American bases in Europe. When it was first disclosed this week that he had been hospitalized, the official announcement said General Abrams was suffering from a mild case of pneumonia. His aides said the general was a cigar smoker, but that his tobacco use has been moderate.

title: Nixon to Go to Moscow June 27
description: WASHINGTON, May 31President Nixon and Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, will meet in the Soviet Union for a week beginning June 27, it was announced today in Washington and Moscow.

title: Oh's 600 Homers Drawing Ahs in Japan
description: TOKYO, May 31The next player to break Babe Ruth's old record of 714 home runs will probably be the son of a Chinese, cook who learned to hit by swinging bamboo. svciords in the manner of a Samurai warrior.

title: Boat Off Connecticut Tips; One of 4 Aboard Is Rescued
description: One man was rescued but three were still missing late last night after their 17foot boat capsized about a mile and a half from shore in Branford Harbor, Conn., near New Haven, authorities reported.

title: Two Youths Receive $1Million Ransom For 17 and Give Up
description: RANCHO CORDOVA, Calif., May 31 (AP)Two teenaged gunmen, who demanded and got $1million in ransom, surrendered today after holding 17 persons hostage in a suburban bank for nearly seven hours.

title: A Pact That Could Reshape the Arab World
description: CAIRO, May 31The SyrianIsraeli disengagement agreement will have longrange repercussions throughout the Arab world, affecting the domestic and foreign policies of almost every country and deciding the shape of changing alliances.

title: LONG BEACH SUES 3 STATE AGENCIES
description: MINEOLA, L. I., May 31Contending that a serious crisis, had developed in Long Reach in relation to the placingr of an estimated 700 discharged mental patients, the city today announced the filing of suits against three state agencies for their alleged failure to provide proper medical care for the patients.

title: India Stepping Up Grain Buying
description: NEW DELHI, May 31The India Supply Mission in Washington has been directed to buy as much wheat as it can to offset food shortages expected here this year, official sources said today.

title: Little League Teams May Face Tax Fight
description: The Little Leagues in New Jersey, fresh from a battle in which they were ordered by the courts to admit girls on baseball teams, may soon be in for a fight of another type  taxes.

title: Seasoned Infielder 10th to DepartTwins Win, 52
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 31  For years some critics said if the Yankees got rid of Horace Clarke, they would instantly improve themselves, Well, the Yankees got rid of Clarke today but didn't show any improvement tonight as they lost to the Minnesota Twins, 52.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A Superior Court judge in Paterson denied a request for a special runoff mayoral election and ruled that Mayor Thomas C. Rooney would not be allowed to remain in office beyond July 1. In a decision highly critical of the commission that recommended Paterson change its form of government, the judge, Charles S. Joelson, ruled that leav ing Mr. Rooney in office would mean the people of Paterson would ... only be required to endure further uncertaintly.

title: Wilbur Wood Back in Winning Channel
description: Since discovering what he was doing wrong by watching himself on videotape earlier this year, Wilbur Wood has been almost unbeatable, Last night the Chicago White Sox southpaw knuckleballer survived The Wall, a disaster area for lefthanders in Boston, to defeat the Red Sox, 32.

title: Democrats Hail G.O.P. Split on Rents
description: State Democrats have emerged from this year's legislative session with predictions that the Republican split between Governor Wilson and Assembly Speaker Perry B. Duryea will carry over into the state campaigns that formally begin in the next two weeks.

title: Thursday's Fights
description: Los AngelesShin Yamabe, 135 pounds, Tokyo, outpointed Lino Cardero, 133, Venezuela, 10 rounds.

title: Canada Faces Decline Of 20% in Wheat Crop
description: CHICAGO, May 31 (Reuters)  Canada is facing at least a 20 per cent cut in her wheat crop this year because of wet cold weather that has stopped many farmers from sowing wheat in recent weeks.

title: They Stepped Off the Corporate Ladder, Into Their Own Shops
description: A year ago, 31yearold Barbara Ohrbach was a vice president of the Butterick fashion Marketing Company. She had a designerdecorated office, a secretary, a generous expense account, and calendar crammed with fashion shows, business luncheons, and trips to Paris. Her salary, she said, was over $30,000.

title: High School Notes
description: It's finalexamination time at the Dalton School, where Arthur Rosenfeld, a 16yearold junior, divides his days between studying for exams and evaluating papers by his studentsthis own classbates.

title: Filion Wins With World Pace Record
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 31 The fastest 11/16 miles over a halfmile track in the history of harness racing ended tonight with the winning driver claiming foul against the driver of the horse that finished second.

title: China Rejects Soviet Assertion On 2 Rivers in Border Dispute
description: HONG KONG, May 31China has rejected as blackmail an assertion by the Soviet Union last week that it has the right to obstruct Chinese shipping on two rivers that figure in the bitter border dispute between the former allies.

title: Lockheed Deal Would Release U.S. From Big Loan Guarantee
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation and Textron, Inc., have agreed in principle on a massive deal that would release the Government from its guarantee of $200million in loans to Lockheed and revitalize the ailing giant with at least $75million in Textron funds.

title: Top British Official in Ulster Cites Sentiment for Independence
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 31Britain's chief representative here said today that there was both a growing British feeling in favor of disengagement from Northern Ireland and a swell of Protestant opinion here favoring independence.

title: BURLINGTON ROAD ENDS MERGER PLAN
description: The Burlington Northern Railroad announced yesterday that it had terminated merger discussions with the Chicago, Milwaukee, St. Paul & Pacific Railroad that have been under way since March.

title: Top Economic Role Is Claimed by Rush
description: WASHINGTON, May 31Kenneth Rush, the new counselor to the President, said today that he would be Mr. Nixon's primary adviser on economic policy and would have more access to the President than other top official.

title: E.K. GAYLORD, 101, PUBLISHER, DIES
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, May 31 (UPI)  Edward K. Gaylord, publisher of The Daily Oklahoman, died last evening, apparently of a heart attack. He was 101 years old.

title: FOULED PENICILLINV RECALLED BY MAKER
description: GROTON, Conn., May 31 (AP)Qualitycontrol experts are studying procedures at Pfizer, Inc., plant here following the company's recall of about 21,000 pounds of contaminated penicillinV, Dwight Norris, manager of the plant, said today

title: Textron: Father of the Conglomerates
description: Textron, Inc., which reportedly has reached an agreement in principle to aid the ailing Lockheed Aircraft Corporation with $75million, was known at one time as the father of the conglomerates.

title: A 64 Puts Trevino a Shot Ahead at 134
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., May 31Scores continued to dive today in the $250,000 Kemper open, much like the stock market on a panic day. A oneunderpar total was not good enough to make the 36hole cut.

title: Bridge: American Experts Finish 2d in 2 Places in the Week
description: This was a week in which many American experts finished an unhappy second, in Venice, New York and intermediate points.

title: MAN, 21, IS KILLED IN DEPOT ARGUMENT
description: A 21yearold man from Camden, N. J., was stabbed to death early yesterday during an argument in a men's room at the Port Authority Bus Terminal.

title: Cedeno Gets 4 Hits  Scherman Bails Out Wilson in 7th
description: Not long ago, the Houston Astros were going through a 10game losing streak. Now they are going through a fivegame winning streak, the fifth victim being the New York Mets last night.

title: TALKS EXAMINING COMMON MARKET
description: PARIS, May 31Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany and President Valery Giscard d'Estaing began two days of discussions today on ways to reanimate the European Common Market and strengthen international monetary cooperation in the face of the financial problems caused by higher priced oil.

title: NO. AMER. SOCCER LEAGUE
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME

title: 4% Decline in Month Is 3d Dip in Row
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 Prices of raw farm products dropped 4 per cent from April 15 to May 15, the third monthly decline in a row, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: BigCity Problems Peril San Francisco's Charming Image
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 31 The City, San Franciscans call it. And there's no need to ask which city they mean.

title: Intercontinental Hotels in Soviet Pact
description: MOSCOW, May 31The Intercontinental Hotels Corporation signed an agreement today with the Soviet Government to begin negotiating the construction of Intercontinental Hotels for foreign visitors in the Soviet Union's three largest cities.

title: Dr. Robert L. Bedell Dies; Organist and Composer, 65
description: Dr. Robert Leech Bedell, comcert organist and, composer, died of a cerebral hemorrage Monday at his home, 267 Southwood Circle, Syosset, L.I. He was 65 years old.

title: Harold Roditi, Patent Agent, Aided Paralyzed Veterans
description: Harold Roditi, an international patent agent and a paraplegic who had been active in rehabilitating paralyzed war veterans, died Thursday at his home, 180 East End Avenue. He was 60 years old.

title: Boehm Quintette Offers Fringe Works
description: The advertising brochure for the Boehm Quintette's threeconcert series devoted to American music, which closed on Thursday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, depicts a puzzled eagle scratching its bald head while it contemplates a sheaf of music. Overhead is the motif: . . . in search of a Bicentennial . . .

title: Police Used Illegal Wiretaps in 33 Cases Here
description: The Police Department has informed the special state prosecutor, Maurice H, Nadjari: the citywide narcotics prosecutor, Frank Rogers, and the five District Attorneys that 33 narcoticsrelated arrests between 1969 and 1971 were based on illegal wiretapping and that untruthful evidence was presented at some of the trials.

title: Dance: Lively Premiere
description: The New York City Ballet presented Saltarelli, a new ballet by Jacques d'Amboise, on, Thursday night at the State Theater as its third and final premiere of the season.

title: Art: Mixture of Incongruity and Humor
description: Edgar Degas was the most caustic of men. He's a good fellow, of course, he once said of a colleague, but I do wish he'd stop inventing the umbrella. What he couldn't stand was the walltowall grin with which some people present ideas that have been in perfectly good working order for a generation or more. The paintings of Guy Johnson (Stefanotty, 50 West 57th Street, through Jun 15) have something of this quality, in that the motivation behind many of them is a mixture of planned incongruity and gallows humor. That specific mixture prompted much of surrealism and was brought to a level of unsurpassable complexity and sophistication in the two collage novels of Max Ernst, La Femme 100 Ttes (1929) and Une Semaine de Bont

title: 4% Decline in Month Is 3d Dip in Row
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 Prices of raw farm products dropped 4 per cent from April 15 to May 15, the third monthly decline in a row, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: SYRIA REPORTED IN PLEDGE TO BAR GUERRILLA RAID,
description: GENEVA, May 31  Syria's President gave secret assurances to Israel through Secretary of State Kissinger that Palestinian guerrillas would not infiltrate into Israel across the Syrian border, Middle East Peace Conference sources here said today.

title: SHEA TRIM HEARS BALLISTICS EXPERT
description: The stainlesssteel pistol belonging to Add Armstead, the stepfather of 10yearold Clifford Glover, the South Jamaica boy who was killed last year by Police Officer Thomas Shea during a police search for taxicabholdup men, had been fired twice, according to a police ballistics expert.

title: Bill to Ban Smoking in Elevators Is Passed by Council Committee
description: A bill to ban smoking in passenger elevators was approved unanimously yesterday by the City Council's Committee on Environmental Protection.

title: Arab Turn to the West
description: WASHINGTON, May 31American officials have refrained from talking about it publicly, but many of them say privately that Secretary of State Kissinger's persistence in bringing about SyrianIsraeli disengagement agreement will open the way for the United States to displace the Soviet Union as the major foreign influence in the Arab world.

title: An Explanation: Why House Unit Issued Subpoena For Tapes of 45 More Watergate Conversations
description: WASHINGTON, May 31Given President Nixon's apparently firm resolve to release no more Watergate evidence, why did the House Judiciary Committee make the extra effort yesterday to issue a subpoena for the tapes of 45 more Watergate conversations?

title: A.P. WILL SUPPLY NEWS FOR RADIO
description: The Associated Press will begin this fall a syndicated audio news service for radio stations, in addition to its regular broadcast news wire, Wes Gallagher, president and general manager of the news agency announced yesterday at a meeting in Kansas City, Mo., of the Associated Press Broadcasters Association.

title: 2d Person Investigated in Death Of Jersey Bride in New Orleans
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 31The District Attorney's office of Orleans Parish said today that more than one person was under suspicion in the death of Patricia Albanowski Giesick, a New Jersey bride who was killed here under mysterious circumstances in midJanuary.

title: Anaconda and Goodyear Disclose Price Increases
description: The Anaconda Sales Company, a unit of the Anacond Company, announced yesterday that it would increase its price. for refined copper by 5 cents pound, beginning today. The move will put the price for copper cathodes at 85 cents a pound an for wire bar at 87 cents a pound In other actions, the Good. year Tire and Rubber Company said it was posting price in creases averaging 10 per cent on a broad range of industrial rubber products, beginning July 1. Most lines of conveyor belting; industrial, automotive and fire hose; hose couplings; sheet rubber, and rubber railroad crossings are affected.

title: FUTURES IN GRAIN DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Grain and soybean prices declined quite sharply yesterday under the impact of some (profit taking and stoploss selling, The lower prices came mainly in the last half hour of trading on the Chicago Board of Trade, following a rising price trend during most of the session.

title: 10 in Primary Races for Widnall's Seat
description: When voters in Bergen County's Seventh Congressional District go to the polls next Tuesday to nominate major party candidates for the House of Representatives, they will have a full field to pick from.

title: Elaines Restaurant Passes Final Check Under Health Code
description: Elaine's restaurant passed the Health Departments final inspection yesterday, and Terry Southern, Shelley Winters, Clay Felker, Tom. Morgan, Kevin McCarthy, Donald Brooks, Michael Caine, A. E. Hochner, Phyllis Cerf, Lewis Upham, Nelson Aldrich, Richard Harris and John Barry Ryan 3d can share a collective sigh of relief.

title: Ervin Panel Staff Links Milk Rise to Aid to Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Mar. 31Donations by dairy cooperatives to President Nixon's 1972 reelection campaign were apparently linked directly to Mr. Nixon's order to raise milk price supports in 1971, according to the staff of the Senate Watergate committee.

title: FED SAYS IT HALTED DISCOUNT RATE RISES
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (Reuters)The Federal Reserve Board says it prevented five Federal Reserve banks from raising the discount rate to 8 per cent from 7 per cent in September of last year.

title: People in Sports
description: Jimmy Anderson, a scout for the Boston Bruins, was named head coach yesterday of the Washington Capitals, a National Hockey League expansion team that will begin play next season. Anderson signed a twoyear contract at a salary reported to be about $30,000 a year.

title: Productivity Unit Extended
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (Reuters)  The Senate voted today to extend the life of. the President's National Commission on Productivity, giving it a new mandate to concentrate on areas that can increase the United States competitive position in international trade. The bill provides $2.5million for the reconstituted commission's activities in fiscal 1975, in a compromise with the House of Representatives, where many members favored killing the agency entirely.

title: Seasoned Infielder 10th to DepartTwins Win, 52
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 31  For years some critics said if the Yankees got rid of Horace Clarke, they would instantly improve themselves. Well, the Yankees got rid of Clarke today but didn't show any improvement tonight as they lost to the Minnesota Twins, 52.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Must you always be wrong on every serious social issue?

title: THOUSANDS BEAT YOUTH FARE'S END
description: When their classes ended this week, Richard and Mary O'Donnell, a brother and sister from New Canaan, Conn., rushed home instead of lingering a few days at their college campuses in Minnesota. The reason: they had orders from their parents to beat the deadline yesterday that marked the end of cutrate domestic youth air fares, which since 1966 had given young Americans a degree of mobility unknown to any other generation.

title: CONNECTICUT GETS AN ENERGY AGENCY
description: HARTFORD, May 31  Although the energy crisis is now out of sightand possibly out of mindfor most people in Connecticut, Gov. Thomas J. Meskill signed legislation today creating a state energy agency and giving the Governor wide powers in an energy emergency.

title: Builders Accused of a $500,000 Bribe
description: NEWARK, May 31A Federal grand jury indicted two men today on charges of conspiring to bribe Mayor Burt Ross of Fort Lee with $500,000 to use his influence in getting the borough to approve a $250million commercial development complex overlooking the George Washington Bridge.

title: FUTURES IN GRAIN DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Grain and soybean prices declined quite sharply yesterday under the impact of some profit taking and stoploss selling. The lower prices came mainly in the last half hour of trading on the Chicago Board of Trade, following a rising price trend during most of the session.

title: Oh's 600 Homers Drawing Ahs in Japan
description: TOKYO, May 31The next player to break Babe Ruth's old record of 714 home runs will probably be the son of a Chinese, cook who learned to hit by swinging bamboo. swords in the manner of a Samurai warrior.

title: Upstate Vote to Buy Power Facilities Stirs Possibilities of a Domino Effect
description: MASSENA, N. Y., May 31 The thinking is toward public power, Democratic Assemblyman Dan Haley said here today. I definitely believe that the thinking is going to change across the state as a result of this.

title: Underworld Airways
description: The payment by Pan American World Airways of large sums to gangsters to buy back stolen flight ticketswould represent a shocking breach of corporate responsibility even if it had not come just when the giant airline was seeking huge Federal subsidies to underwrite its overseas air service.

title: Ulster Man Killed By Bomb Believed Meant for Soldiers
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 31 (UPI)A booby trap believed placed by the Irish Republican Army's Provisional Wing to kill British soldiers exploded at a house in Londonderry today, killing the owner and injuring his daughterinlaw and another woman.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: CHOP CHOP In this age of nuclear deterrent on a national scale, you can create a personal dtente, we're told, by the development of your own arsenal of the martial arts. And there are a lot of them: karate, kung fu, tai chi chuan, aikido, tae kwon do, jiujitAi, judo, laido, kendo, bando, hapkido, ninjitsu and nuncbaku, for example.

title: SOVIET SENSITIVE TO AN OIL ISSUE
description: MOSCOW, May 31Valentin D. Shashin, Soviet Minister of Oil, has kicked up a storm in Japan and drawn attention to changing Soviet oil policy by raising questions about whether Moscow will strike any big oil deal with Tokyo in the forseeable future.

title: WILSON SIGNS BILL ON ELECTION FUNDS
description: ALBANY, May 31Governor Wilson announced today that he had signed into law the comprehensive electioncampaign reform measure, which limits campaign spending, restricts campaign contributions, tightens campaign financereporting requirements and creates a new Board of Elections with Overall administration and enforcement authority.

title: TV: Lives of Three Women Alone
description: Some of the few nonrepeat moments on television this Sunday are provided by three women. They are in an RKO General documentary called Three Women Alone, portraits of lives that for different reasons, are set outside the bounds, protection, companionship and confines of wedlock.

title: BRICKLAYERS TO END PAY DIFFERENTIAL
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (AP)  An outofcourt agreement announced today would merge two local bricklayers unions, ending a situation in which members of a predominantly white local have been paid more than those of a predominantly black one.

title: 2d Person Investigated in Death Of Jersey Bride in New Orleans
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 31The District Attorney's office of Orleans Parish said today that more than one person was under suspicion in the death of Patricia Albanowski Giesick, a New Jersey bride who was killed here under mysterious circumstances in midJanuary.

title: WINE TALK
description: Someone recently asked Brother Timothy, the famous cellarmaster for The Christian Brothers' wineries, if he planned to list vintage dates on Christian Brothers wines. Never, he replied. At least, not while I'm around.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
description: Page

title: Issuing Subpoena to Sirica Studied by Panel Lawyers
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 Lawyers for the House Judiciary Committee have begun exploring the possibility of issuing a subpoena to Judge John J. Sirica of the United States District Court to obtain four White House tape recordings that are in the judge's custody.

title: End of Controls Stirs Inflationary Surge
description: Prices of a host of consumer and industrial products have shot up since Government controls lapsed a month ago, producing a widely anticipated inflationary surge.

title: 4 KEY DEMOCRATS BACKING SAMUELS IN GOVERNOR RACE
description: The state's key Democratic leaders have tentatively settled on Howard J. Samuels as their choice for the Democratic nomination for Governor, a decision that would assure his designation by the Democratic State Committee and very possibly foreclose a primary fight.

title: Kissinger Takes. Edge Off Watergate
description: WASHINGTON, May 31The twin shadows of Watergate and possible impeachment were dispelted from the White House today, if only momentarily, by Secretary of State Kissinger's diplomatic triumph in the Middle East.

title: Franklin Bank Review Gets Limited Approval
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 (UPI)A Justice Department spokesman said today that its limited approval to a proposal that 11 New York banks review operations of the financially troubledFranktin National Bank was granted in a business review letter dated May 23.

title: Javelin Record Is set by Coed
description: WICHITA, Kan., May 31 (UPI)Susie Norton of Kansas State University hurled the javelin 129 feet 6 inches today for a meet record on the opening day of the United States Track and Field Federation championships. Her throw bettered the mark held by Ginny Walker of Texas by six inches.

title: Devon Horse Show THE CHIEF AWARDS
description: AmateurOwner Conformation HuntersFox Lake Farm's and Mr. and Mrs. John H. Leib's Sure Blue.

title: BONN CONTINUES APPROACH TO EAST
description: BONN, May 31West Germany's policy of improving re lations with the Communist states, shaken by the resignation of Chancellor Willy Brandt over an East German spy in his office, will continue to move forward cautiously under Chancellor Helmut Schmidt, his aides say.

title: INTEREST CEILING ON MORTGAGES UP
description: TRENTON, May 32Richard F. Schaub, the State Banking Commissioner, today announced immediate increases in the mortgageinterest ceiling, from 8.75 per cent to 9 per cent, in a move to curb the flow of investors' money from financial institutions to other investments, such as Federal securities.

title: Court Ruling's Impact
Contract Awards
description: The Executive Committee of the Montreal Urban Community awarded Bombardier, Ltd., a leading snowmobile manufacturer, a contract valued at more than $117.8million for 423 cars for the Montreal Subway System expansion program. The lowest bid had been submitted by Canadian Vickers, Ltd., a 73 per centowned unit of Vickers, Ltd., oil London, which had built the original 360 cars for the system. Laurent Beaudoin, president of Bombardier, said the La Pocatiere works of his company, near Riviere de Loup, a suburb of Quebec City, would be converted to build the car bodies. Bombardier has a plant in Austria that makes subway cars for European markets.

title: RCA Will End Home Audio Line
description: The RCA Corporation announced yesterday that it would phase out its home audio products business by next year to concentrate entirely on televisionrelated home equipment.

title: Railway to Purchase Bonds
description: The Florida East Coast Railway, which in March abandoned a plan to, issue additional common stock in exchange for its $18.8million of bonds, said yesterday it now would purchase up to $2million of its 5 per cent first mortgage bonds, due 2011, in the open market this year. Purchases will be made when the price is attractive, W. L. Thornton, president, told stockholders at the annual meeting in Jacksonville, Fla.

title: U.S. IN TRADE PACT WITH EUROPEANS
description: WASHINGTON, May 31 The United States and the European Common Market announced today a major trade agreement that will reduce European tariffs on more than 20 products of which the United States is a big exporter. The cuts will compensate the United States for damage to American imports resulting from the enlargements of the Common Market.

title: ExMayor Seeks House Seat
description: WORCHESTER, Mass., May 31 (AP;)Paul V. Mullaney, a former Mayor of Worchester, has announced his candidacy for the third Congressional District scat held by Harold D. Donohue, who is retiring. Mr. Mullaney, a Democrat, says that Americans want new faces in elective office.

title: Farm Prices Drop Again; Other Costs Still Climbing
description: Farm Prices Drop Again; Other Costs Still Climbing

title: RHAPSODY IS PLAYED IN PROMENADE NIGHT
description: The New York Philharmonic's Rhapsody Promenade, with John Browning as soloist in Rachmaninoff's Rhapsody on a Theme of Paganini, was introduced at Avery Fisher Hall on Thursday night.

title: End of Controls Stirs Inflationary Surge
description: Prices of a host of consumer and industrial products have shot up since Government controls lapsed a month ago, producing a widely anticipated inflationary surge.

title: Maine Soccer Victor
description: HELSINKI, Finland, May 31 (AP)  The Maine Maritime Academy, visiting Helsinki on its annual training cruise, upset the Finnish Maritime Academy Soccer team, 40, yesterday.

title: MILLS MEETS BEAME ON U.S. AID FOR CITY
description: The chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, Representative Wilbur Mills, Democrat of Arkansas, had lunch with Mayor Beame at City Hall yesterday and told reporters afterward that he would try to increase the amount of money available to cities and towns under the Federal revenuesharing program.

title: Cute Is Tiny, and Other Bits of Wisdom
description: My husband and I began hunting for our first house with what I then thought was a reasonable amount of wary cynicism. We knew that such words as cute and adorable meant that the biggest room was 10x12; that Handyman's Special meant no roof and few floors, and that walk to schools and shopping meant that there were a Jesuit seminary and a feed grain distributor around the corner but the railroad station and the supermarket were five miles away.

title: Met Games This Week
description: TodayHouston at Shea Stadium, 2:05 P.M.

title: Irish Setter Judged Best at Huntingdon
description: AMBLER, Pa., June 1An Irish setter, Ch. Kincora Blazing Banner, owned by Cindy Trefrey of Lancaster and Minnie Kiefer of Allentown, went best in show today, defeating 1,440 rivals at the 48th annual Huntingdon Valley Kennel Club show held at Temple University's Ambler campus.

title: Nearby Yacht Results AT INDIAN HARBOR Y.C.
description: EASTOFRYE Y.R.A.

title: Pax Kissinger
description: Henry Kissinger's remarkable month in the Middle East has ended with an agreement between Israel and Syria to separate their armies on the Golan Heights  the first time the two nations have agreed on a matter of importance in a quarter of a century.

title: Red Smith
description: A member of the Winged Foot Golf Club lost a ball in the rough the other day. He dropped a second ball over his shoulder and couldn't find that, either. When they are getting a course ready for the United States Open, life can become interesting for the members.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: If you start from the end of your article on oilprice rises, it might put the problem of prices in proper perspettive (Skeptics Remain Unconvinced on Oil, May 19).

title: KENNEDY TOPS FORD IN PRESIDENCY POLL
description: If a Presidential election were held now, Senator Edward M. Kennedy would outpoll Vice President Ford by 50 per cent to 39, with 11 per cent undecided, a Gallup Poll released yesterday indicated.

title: Encounter: The Sikh, the Sweeper and the Train to Amereeka
description: KALKA lies' just at the point at which the last foothills of the Himalayas fall away into the vast plain of northern India. The town is the junction of the narrowgauge railway up to Simla and the broadgauge line which runs down toward Delhi and the rest of the subcon??ent. I was on my way from Simla once a summer retreat of the British rulers and rather like a dream version of a transplanted Sussex villageto the capital to see the Dussehra, the 10thday culmination of the Ramhila festival.

title: Athlete and the Community: Their Relationship Works Two Ways
description: In these days of instability in sports, where new leagues and franchises are emerging every month, where in a players' market the allegiance to team, city and fan are at best capricious, the concept of arrogance and insensitivity to one's community and environment has to be altered.

title: Priest's Superior Allows Him To Continue as Aide to Nixon
description: BOSTON, June I (AP)The Rev, John J. McLaughlin, who became involved in a dispute with his Jesuit superiors because of his political activities as a deputy special assistant to President Nixon, his political activities will be allowed to work for the President on a fulltime basis, the Very Rev. Richard T. Cleary, the regional provincial of the Society of Jesus in New England, said today.

title: Day Care A Rescuer Of Buildings In Decay
description: Daycare centers have become the salvation of scores of unused movie houses, synagogues, factories, garages and stores around the city.

title: Jung Takes Junior Golf
description: Rchard Jung, a 16yearold Madison High student, shot a 37, 3976 to win overall honors in the 18th annual Brooklyn junior golf tournament at Dyker Beach yesterday. Blily Castner of Fort Hamilton High had 37, 40 77 to win the senior division and Jerry Nadeau of Dyker Heights Junior High won the junior division with 39, 42 81. Richard Margintta, 11, from St, Finbar's, won the pee wee division with 51 for nine holes.

title: Votes in Congress
description: 1. Vote on bill providing for study of new river for possible inclusion in Wild and Scenic Rivers System, which passed, 49.19, May 28.

title: Debate Stirs in Shadow of Tamerlane Tomb
description: SAMARKAND, U.S.S.R.,The legendary name of Tamerlane may have a settled niche in Western history books, but in Central Asia, where he seized power and ruled in the 14th century, it stirs a lively controversy, with overtones of Uzbek nationalism that are troubling to Soviet ideologists.

title: THE LOFT'S OWNER IS TOLD TO VACATE
description: David Mancuso, the philosophic young music lover whose weekly parties have become a Saturday night sensation for several hundred devoted followers but a persistent headache for his artistic neighbors, hat been ordered by the Buildings Department to vacate his connecting secondfloor loft at 645647 Broadway.

title: Chris Evert, $7.60, Wins Belmont's M other Goose
description: Chris Evert posted a dramatic victory in the $89,625 Mother Goose at Belmont Park yesterday, holding off the charging Maud Muller and scoring by a halflength in the 1mile race. The Mother Goose, the second part of the triple crown for fillies, attracted a field of 14, including three sets of betting entries, and was witnessed by a crowd of 31,297.

title: Giscard and Schmidt End First Meeting With Pledge to Help Common Market
description: PARIS, June 1The new leaders of France and West Germany said today that they would work together to reinvigorate the Common Market and that France had no need right now for any special economic aid from the West German treasury.

title: Spotlight on Gifted Again
description: TRENTONPublic schools throughout the state are focusing once more on the gifted child.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: IBM Gives Brown $1Million
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., June 1 (AP)The IBM Corporation has given Brawn University a $1million endowment to create major academic chair in the sciences, Brown's president, Donald F. Hornig, said yesterday.

title: Leslie Arends, Teacher, Wed To a Minister
description: Miss Leslie Talea Arends and the Rev. Malcolm D. Eckel were married yesterday afternoon in the Memorial Church at Harvard University.

title: CITY AIDES TOUR INDUSTRIAL SITES
description: Directors of the city's Public Development Corporation had a board meeting on a bus last week, touring industrial sites the agency is developing to keep jobs in the city while they discussed such matters as contracts, leases and land auctions.

title: Chess:
description: Hypermodern play, though supposedly a system of restrained, refined maneuvering, has this in common with gambit play: it requires sacrificing.

title: Cool Party Giver Calms Politicians
description: Queens may be the only county in the nation where the Democratic county committee has two annual dinners in the same year and this year there may be three. Most people think that this is solely because of the genial archtwisting tactics of Councilman. Matthew J. Troy Jr., the gregarious and effervescent Democratic leader of Queens.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: Landlords planning major alterations or demolition of their buildings must give rentcontrolled taunts formal advance notice, according to new regulations announced by Leonard E. Yoswein, Rent and Housing Maintenance Commisioner.

title: GOVERNOR WILSON SAYS HE WILL RUN FOR A FULL TERM
description: Governor Wilson, declaring that New York is my life, announced formally that he would run this year for his first full term as Governor.

title: Recordings
description: ACCORDING to George Gershwin, Frederick Defies wrote wet musicnot, one imagines, a great compliment from one composer of a black opera to another. It's unlikely that the author of Porgy and Bess ever heard Delius's Koanga, but one can see what Gershwin meant by his terse description of a distinctive style that is indeed humidly atmospheric and elusively fluid in its tonat and formal orientations.

title: 5 New DrugTrial Judges Confirmed
description: ALBANY, June 1The Senate has confirmed the nominations of five judges to the Court of Claims to handle narcotics trials, after a clash of wills between Governor Wilson and the chairman of the Senate Judiciary Committee, which had delayed the appointments.

title: Jane Marcus Engaged To L. A. Mermelstein
description: Miss Jane Ellen Marcus, an English teacher at the University City High School in Philadelphia, plans to be married in September to Lewis Allan Mermelstein, an electrical engineer with General Electric in Philadelphia.

title: All Playwrights Are Frustrated Critics
description: YOU must never again believe the canard that all critics are frustrated playwrights. It's the other way around. All playwrights are frustrated critics. Think about it for moment, as I have had to do for some four or five hours recently. From Aristophanes onward, passing Greene and Beaumont and Sheridan along the way, right up to Tom Stoppard and just now Ira Levin, playwrights have been enormously happy to get their teeth into their fellowsor, failing that, into the fellows who are paid to sink teeth into their fellows. It scarcely matters whether it is reviewers or rival dramatists who are to be the object of bloodletting. Give a playwright a chance to write a notice in a play and he turns into a cad from Transylvania on the spot.

title: Scholarship Fund Urged In Memory of Truman

description: LUXEMBOURG, June 1 (Reuters)Gaston Thorn, the Liberal party leader, was named Premierdesignate today by Grand Duke Jean, ruler of this tiny duchy.

description: PATERSON  Like bucket brigade battling huge conflagration.

Gardens

description: JAMES McCAGUE: THE CUMBERLAND Andrew Jackson made a good judge .... His sketchy grasp of legal technicalities might be faulted, but his fairness, never .... His ... charge to juries ... has become a classic: Do what is right between these parties. That is what the law always means.

title: Carol J. Sonne Is Bride of R. J. McGrath
description: Miss Carol Joline Sonne, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Niels Henry Sonne of New Ybrk, was married here yesterday afternoon to Raymond Jewett McGrath, a, reporter for The Winchester (Va.) Star News. He is the son of Mr. and. Mrs. Raymond C. McGrath of Pittsfield, Mass.

title: Valery Panov Is in Hospital With Food Poisoning Case
description: MOSCOW, June 1 (Reuters)  Valery Panov, the dancer. has been hospitalized with food poisoning which he said had temporarily blinded him after he had some tea on a train.

description: TodayAt Minnesota.

title: Yanks Beat Twins, 65, In the 13th
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., June 1In a weird 13inning game spiced by two streakers and two players out of position at first base, the Yankees edged the Minnesota Twins, 65, today and gave some hope that June would be better than May.

description: Miss Barbara Anne Cunningham, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Edward Cunningham Jr. of New Canaan, Conn., was married last night to Robert Jay Schneider, son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Schneider of New York.

title: Schedule of Hearings By Council This Week
description: The following open hearings of City Council committees will be held this week:

title: Letters
description: James S. Kunen zeroed in on Ted Williams (Last of the 400 hitters, May 12) by describing him as exciting and volcanic. Two other words would have helped to fill out the picture: fearsome and dangerous.

title: Housewife Makes Grade
description: UPPER MONTCLAIRA 29yearold housewife who completed college in two years with a 4.'0, or straight A, average, will deliver one of the commencement addresses at Montclair State College next Sunday.

title: AwardGivers Honor a Few and Slab a Wrist
description: A sharp rebuke to the slopingfront office building at 9 West 57th Street was issued by the Fifth Avenue Association last week in the course of the announcement of its biennial architectural awards.

title: Susan Bender Is Bride
description: The marriage of Miss Susan Ellen Bender to Alvin Keith Klevorick, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sydney Klevorick of Rego Park; Queens, took place here yesterday evening at the Stephen Wise Free Synagogue. Rabbi Edward E. Klein performed the ceremony. Mr. and Mrs. Louis Bender of New Haven are the parents of the bride, who will continue to use her own name. She is a psychiatric social worker. Mr. Klevorick is an associate professor of law and economics at Yale University.

title: Woman Action Center Head
description: Mrs. Gerdi E. Lipschutz has been named by Mayor Beame to serve as head of the Mayor's Voluntary Action Center. A resident of Queens, Mrs. Lipschutz has been active in citywide health planning and drugabuse organizations. Her salary will be $19,589 a year.

title: The Art of America in The Gilded Age
description: With Whistler, Sargent, Cassatt, Eakins, Homer among its painters, Stieglitz and Jacob Riis pioneering in photography, and designers and architects such as Tiffany, Olmsted and Sullivan at work, the period from 1865 to 1900 was indeed a gilded age for art in America. This is the era Shirley Glubok documents in the latest of her Art of... series, employing her usual mixture of strong blackandwhite and sepia illustrations, accompanied by brief explanatory notes. It is a formula that has served her well in many of her previous books, particularly when  as in The Art of Ancient Egypt, The Art of Africa, for instancethe art involved was largely sculptural. But in this volume, where so many of the works discussed are paintings, the lack of color plates is a real drawback. And this time the notes seem all too brieftwo or three sentences about an artist and then on to the next subject, with no transitions, no connecting material. Certainly, Miss Glubok has covered a wide variety of artistic achievements in 48 pages, but even as an introduction to the period it seems unsatisfying, superficial. Perhaps the problem is that this time the subject matter demands a fuller treatment than the series format allows.

title: Trudeau Sets a Vigorous Tone In Canada Election Campaign
description: OTTAWA, June 1 Campaigns are fun again, Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau said the other day, apparently exhilarated by the giveandtake of the heated, threeway election contest, one of Canada's hardestfought in years.

title: Music
description: IF there is a new Buddy Richand those who were familiar with the violent temper, the furniture smashing, the cymbal throwing, the brawling battles, the stinging tongue of the old Buddy Rich agree that things have changedit can be largely attributed to Rich's discovery eight years ago of karate.

title: The Ballet: La Valse
description: One of the many reasons George Balanchine is such a supreme master of the ballet repertory is quite simply his sense of mystery. He knows that the ambiguity of dance lends itself to the halfpoetry of suggestion. He understands the balletic charm of the uncertain.

title: Film
description: IF I hadnt already read and heard the appalled reactions of many critics to Bertrand Bliers Going Places, I might have been disturbed myself by some of that films calculated crudities. Reviewers had found the movie sordid, disgusting, and a grotesque exercise In sadism; one had even said he felt molested by it. Well, I emerged from the theater full of admiration for what Id just seen and amazed that it could have caused such a fuss. At its worst, Going Places is simply not that bad. And at its frequent best, it has to be one of the most mordant satires ever made about rebellious youth.

title: Brooklyn Tech Captures P.S.A.L. Track Crown
description: Gerry Russell of Lafayette swept the sprints and Brooklyn Tech won the team title yesterday in the Public Schools Athletic League citywide track and field championships at Downing Stadium on Randalls Island.

title: Fiction: The Best Is by Nixon
description: My recommendations of 1974 fiction worth spending some beach or lakeside time on this summer had best begin with a couple of caveats. Notwithstanding the urgings of billboards and skywriters, I have not read Peter Benchley's Jaws, I have a congenital and incurable distaste for any book touted as a good read; moreover, a couple of friends whose opinions I trust tell me that it is terrible novel that you can't put down so I've solved the problem by not picking it up. a congenital and incurable distaste for any book touted as a good read; moreover, a couple of friends whose opinions I trust tell me that it is terrible novel that you can't put down so I've solved the problem by not picking it up.

title: Christina Zelkoff Married to R. R. Davis
description: Miss Christina Rae Zelkoff and Richard Ralph Davis were married here yesterday in a Protestant ceremony at noon in Christ Chapel at Riverside Church by the Rev. Dr. Jesse Lyons. A reception was given at the New York Junior League, of which the bride is a member.

title: NCAA Title In Lacrosse To Hopkins
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., June 1Johns Hopkins, as wellknown for its strong lacrosse team as for its worldfamous school of medicine, finally established its national supremacy in lacrosse today when it won the national collegiate title by beating Maryland, 1712, in the final of the fourth annual N.C.A.A. tournament at Rutgers Stadium.

title: Utility Rate Increase Focuses on Industry
