title: Agreement for Saudis' Control Of Aramco Is Seen as Vague
description: Petroleumindustry sources said yesterday that the announcement of an interim agreement giving Saudi Arabia majority control of the Arabian American Oil Company was vague because few details had been settled and because the Saudis had not determined a final course of action.

title: Novel on Kissinger Held Up by Dispute Over Two Passages
description: The publication of a novel entitled President Kissinger has been put off because its prospective distributor objected to two passages, the publisher announced here yesterday.

title: Kissinger Cool to European Bid to Arabs
description: BONN, June 11Secretary of State. Kissinger said today that the United States had reservafi tions about some aspects of the European decision yesterday to begin a dialogue with 20 Arab countries, but he welcomed what he called a change in spirit and attitude on the troublesome issue of EuropeanAmerican consultation.

title: HIGHER PAY URGED FAR TRANSLATORS
description: A translator is a missionary force. Jerzy Kosinski, novelistpresident of the American Center of P.E.W. said yesterday. The international writers' group was cosponsoring a Latin American Translation Conference, asserting that without translators our world would be parochial and impoverished, and urging more recognition and reward for them.

title: PRIEST IN ENGLAND REBUKED OVER I.R.A.
description: LONDON, June 11A Roman Catholic priest who delivered a eulogy over the coffin of a young Irishman who died last week in an English prison after a twomonth hunger strike was relieved of his diocesan duties today.

title: How the Teams Stand Today
description: Wednesday, June 12, 1974

title: Ecology: I Law at Sea
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  One of the most important international meetings of recent years opens next Week at Caracas, Venezuela. Some 130 nations will gather at the first working conference called by the United Nations on drafting a legal code for the sea around us. The session starts June 17 It is already evident that the problems are enormously complex and therefore a second session has been tentatively scheduled next year Vienna.

title: School Boards Elected in 3 Suburban Counties
description: Following are the results of local school elections yesterday on Long Island and in Westchester County.

title: Two Newspapers Are Sued Over Perfume Advertising
description: A California concern marketing lowprice copies of wellknown French and domestic perfumes filed a $250,000 lawsuit yesterday against The New York Times and The Daily News, accusing them of refusing to accept the company's advertisements in violation of its rights.

title: Maine Democrats Choose Muskie Ally for Governor
description: PORTLAND, Me., June 11 (AP)George Mitchell, a former political lieutenant of Senator) Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, won the Democratic gubernatorial nomination in the state's primary election tonight.

title: Ford Offers WNET Loan of $7Million
description: The Ford Foundation has agreed to make a longterm loan of $7million to the Educational Broadcasting Corporation, the licensee of WNET/13, for the establishment of a permanent home for the station at the Henry Hudson Hotel, on West 57th Street.

title: Brigham Young Tops Poll
description: DENVER, June 11 ((UPI) Brigham Young, University, which claimed conference crowns in outdoor track, golf and swimming as well as the northern division baseball title, was named the Western Athletic Conference allsports champion today in a poll conducted by United Press International.

title: 11 Major Banks to Lend $250Million To Franklin National on Secured Basis
description: Eleven major New York banks, with the apparent backing of the Federal Reserve Board, have agreed to lend $250millionon a secured basisto the financially pressed Franklin National Banks

title: 2 Held in Slaying of Seton Hall Teacher After a 3Mile Auto Chase in Newark
description: MONTCLAIR, June 11Two young men, arrested following a highspeed chase through Newark city streets today, were held in connection with the stabbing murder of a Seton Hall University law professor in his home early Sunday morning.

title: Nixon Asks Court Ruling On CoConspirator Issue
description: WASHINGTON, June 11President Nixon wants the Supreme Court to decide whether he Should have been named an unindicted coconspirator in the Watergate coverup, his lawyers disclosed today.

title: Russian Sees a Regularity In NixonBrezhnev Talks
description: MOSCOW, June 11A member of the Soviet leadership asserted today that President Nixon's forthcoming visit to the Soviet Union emphasized that Moscow and Washington had put summit meetings on a regular basis.

title: Old Trains and Other Fun for Children
description: Films

title: HOWARD M. BRIGHAM
description: Howard M. Brigham, a retired executive with Reeves Brothers, a major textile manufacturer and distributor, died yesterday in Mountainside Hospital, Montclair, N. J. He was 72 years old and lived at 65 Exsex, Montclair.

title: People and Business
description: George P. Schultz, 53 years old, outgoing Secretary of the Treasury, has been appointed to the faculty at Stanford University's Graduate. School of Business on a parttime basis, effective Sept. 1, it was announced yesterday by Dean Arjay Miller. In midMay Mr. Shultz accepted the post as executive vice president of the Bechtel Corporation, San Francisco. A dean and professor of industrial, relations at the Universilty of Chicago's Graduate School of Business before joining the Nixon Administration in 1969, Mr. Schultz will have the title of professor of management and public policy at Stanford.

title: I.R.S. CHIEF DENIES USE OF TAX QUOTAS
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 (AP)The head of the Internal Revenue Service denied today charges that the agency works under a quota system that rewards tax agents for their harshness.

title: HOUSE UNIT VOTES TO EXTEND CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, June 11 (Reuters)The House Banking Committee approved a bill today extending the Export Control Act for an additional two years, giving the Secretary of Commerce continued authority to impose export controls under certain conditions. Present authority of the act expires June 30.

title: Prison Tenure Offered As a Basis for Election
description: WOODBURY, Conn., June 11 (AP)A Woodbury Democrat, citing political scandais of past months, thinks it is time someone from prison got into politics.

title: Samuels and Carey Woo the Delegates.
description: At Samuels  for  Governor headquarters, a computer absorbs the detailspolitical, personalprovided by 25 coordinators in persistent contact with the 357 Democrats who will designate the New York State ticket this week.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: 10 SCOUT COUNCILS AID TO PAD ROLLS
description: The Boy Scouts of America acknowledged yesterday that 19 of their local councils appriar to be involved in the Adding of membership rolls.

title: AUSTRIAN LEADER AND NIXON CONFER
description: SALZBURG, Austria, June 11 President Nixon met with Austria's Chancellor, Dr. Bruno Kreisky, today as part of his preparations for the beginning of his Middle East tour tomorrow.

title: ExNarcotics Officer Says Egan Approved Split of Seized Funds
description: A former lieutenant in the special investigations unit of the Police Department's narcotics bureau testified yesterday in Federal Court here that the commander of the unit, Lieut. John J. Egan, had approved a fiveway split of $40,000 seized from two suspected drug peddlers.

title: U.S. STEEL RAISES ITS PRICES BY 8%
description: The United States Steel Corporation, the nation's largest steel producer, confirmed yesterday that it had raised prices on a number of steel items that are used by the construction Industry and makers of fabricated products. U.S. Steel said that the overall increase was about 8 per cent and covered such products as bars, semifinished steels, rod, wire and plate products.

title: A Tentative Accord Is Reached In Newark Taxi Drivers' Strike
description: NEWARK, June 11Spokesmen for both sides in the weekold strike by drivers against this city's taxicab industry reported that they had reached a tentative settlement tonight.

title: Sadat to Press Hussein on Palestinians
description: CAIRO, June 11 President Anwar elSadat has promised Palestinian leaders that he will seek concessions from King Hussein of Jordan to make it possible for the Palestinians to take part in the Middle East peace talks in Geneva.

title: ILLNESS PUTS OFF TRIAL OF INDIANS
description: ST. PAUL, June 11  The Wounded Knee trials were temporarily postponed today after a Public Health Service physician reported that Russell C. Means, one of the de. fendants, was suffering from bleeding ulcers.

title: The Opera: Bluebeard and Schicchi
description: Just as there are culinary possibilities other than meat and potatoes or ham and eggs, so there are alternatives to Cav and Pag, opera's once inescapable double bill. The Metropolitan Opera discovered a workable combination last night in its new production of two oneacters, Bluebeard's Castle and Gianni Schicchi. The former and more profound work proved disappointing visually, but more of that later.

title: About New York Making the Ticket Official
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 11 The only thing to be decided was who would run against Arthur Levitt, and that was decided yesterday. A former Mayor of Rochester heard the clarion call, and when he showed up last night, clutching a single suitcase, he was asked about it.

title: Common Market Fights OPEC Tax Rise
description: BRUSSELS, June 11The nine nations of the European Common Market will tell the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries that higher taxation of oil companies to absorb excess profits would only drive up oil prices in Europe and harm the world economic situation.

title: MAHEU RESTS CASE IN HUGHES LAWSUIT
description: LOS ANGELES, June 11Robert A. Maheu rested his $17.3million defamation suit against Howard R. Hughes today without the defense attorneys producing any testimony from the reclusive billionaire.

title: F.B.I. Tied Tap Requests To Kissinger or Gen. Haig
description: WASHINGTON, June 11Some of the original requests for wiretaps placed on 17 Government officials and newsmen came from Henry A. Kissinger or Gen. Alexander M. Haig Jr., according to a summary of an inquiry last year by the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Italy's Compound Crisis
description: The Government of Premier Mariano Rumor has fallen in Rome. In itself, that may sound like Italian politics as usual, since Italy has had 36 governments in the last 31 years. But what makes this political crisis different is that it is superimposed upon an economic crisis that many fear could be only the first in a series of disasters that might rip through Europe and the world economy.

title: Whirlpool Pact Nears
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP)  Union and management negotiators accepted early today a Federal mediation panel's proposal that could end a 110day strike by 7,500 workers of the Whirlpool Corporation in Evansville, Ind.

title: Cairo's American University Is Returned to U.S. Control
description: CAIRO, June 12 (UPI)The 55yearold American University in Cairo returned to American control today seven years after it was seized by the Egyptian Government.

title: Search for Airman Ended
description: ANCHORAGE, June 12 (AP)  The Rescue Coordination Center of Elmendorf Air Force Base has suspended search efforts for Spec. 4 Dennis God boud, missing for more than a week on a hiking trip. A spokes, man said the 21yearold artillery man from Middleton, Conn. reportedly left Fort Richardson on a twoday backpacking tripJune 2 in the Alaska range and failed to return.

title: Inspectors Fail 42 Food Places For 2d Time on Health Code
description: The Health Department has announced the names of 42 more restaurants, groceries and other food establishments charged with violating the city's Health Code by failing to correct infractions detected by Department of Health inspectors on two occasions.

title: Rug Concerts Resume
description: The New York Philharmonic's Rug Concerts, begun last season as an experiment in pleasing the young, seem to be headed for a successful. reprise. In the second season's opening program, on Tuesday night at Avery Fisher Hall, Pierre Boulez and an ensemble of 70 musicians. played to a full house that greeted every piece with unrestrained enthusiasm.

title: SAYINGS OUTFLOW CONTINUED IN MAY
description: Savers last month withdrew $190million more from their savings bank accounts than they deposited. This outflowthe first for the month of May since World War IIworsened the shortage of funds available for home mortgages.

title: G.M. Raises Car Prices by 2.4%
description: DETROIT, June 12The General Motors Corporation raised the prices of its 1974 models by an average of $118, or 2.4 per cent, by making certain optional equipment standard on mast models.

title: Sexist Cards Are Greeted With Disdain
description: Greetings! Those cards that people send to each other on Father's Day, Mother's Day, graduation day, birthdays and all of those other Big Days are not just sentimental.

title: TV: A Timely Interview With Kissinger on ABC
description: After Henry A. Kissinger's extraordinary press conference in Austria on Tuesday, ABC News has the benefit of fortuitous timing with Kissinger: An Action Biography, an hourlong special that will be presented tomorrow at 9:30. P.M. Near the end of the program, in an interview conducted by Howard K. Smith and Ted Koppel, the Secretary of State briefly makes the same basic points about the wiretapping controversy that he made at length in the press conference.

title: Italian Communists Seek a Role In PolicyMaking on High Level
description: ROME, June 12The Communist party called today for a democratic turn in governmental affairs to help solve Italy's cabinet crisis, making it plain that it wants a say in decisionmaking on the highest level.

title: Wilson Accepts, Calling G.O.P. Vibrant
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., June 12Governor Wilson accepted the nomination of state Republicans for a full term tonight with a message for those crepehangers, those hopeful pallbearers and those wishful thinkers outside our party who would like to believe our party is dead.

title: CAPITAL RALLYING ROUND KISSINGER VINDICATION ASKED
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 Members of Congress and Government officials rallied to the support of Secretary of State Kissinger today, urging that his reputation be, cleared so he would not carry out his threat yesterday to resign.

title: Junior High Bars Third of 6th Grade; Principal Cites Substandard Reading
description: The principal of a Manhattan junior high school has rejected for admission to the seventh grade onethird of the 200 graduates of a local elementary school because, he said, their reading levels were not up to standards.

title: JURY CLEARS SHEA IN KILLING OF BOY
description: Police Officer Thomas J. Shea was acquitted yesterday of murder in State Supreme Court, Queens, in the shooting death of 10yearold Clifford Glover.

title: Investment Advisers on Tour Here Are Bullish on New York
description: For a long time we haven't been recommending New York City bonds. The city seemed to have too many problems, and there didn't seem to he good control over the finances. But now I have the feeling things have changed and I am going to recommend that we start buying New York obligations for our trust portfolios.

title: Briton Held as Smuggler
description: Elizah Getter, a 22yearold native of London, was arraigned yesterday before Magistrate Max Schiffman in Federal Court Brooklyn, on charges of smuggling diamonds into this country. According to Assistant United States Attorney Paul Lazarus, the defendant arrived here Monday and was found to be carrying three cut diamonds valued at $67,500.

title: U.S. Court Backs Landing Of Concorde Jet at Boston
description: BOSTON, June 12 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit rule:1,70.day that a supersonic Concorde jetliner could land here as planned tomorrow.

title: Victory for the Slurbs
description: The 211to204 House vote barring consideration the landuse planning bill is a splendid example of the old American tendency toward recklessnesscummyopia, working in tandem with crassly brutal impeachment politics. The vote had the effect of almost surely killing the chances this year of legislation (already approved by the Senate) which the Administration once called its number one environmental priority, but which it turned against as the arithmetic of impeachment became the Administration's number one obsession.

title: MRS. WILLIAM L. FOX
description: Mrs. Betty Fox, widow of William Logan Fox, died Tuesday in Whitemarsh, Pa., near Philadelphia. She was 81 years old.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, JUNE 13, 1974

title: Lox: It's Not Smoked, It's Soaked
description: You, David Sklar said, are the 4,742d person to ask me that question.

title: U.S. Charges Pend In Apparel Pricing
description: A twoyear investigation by the Justice Department of an alleged apparel pricing conspiracy involving some of New York's bestknown retailers is reportedly to be nearing completion, with industry sources expecting Federal indictments against present or former executives of two or three stores. Within the last few weeks, the investigation, which began in July, 1972, in Philadelphia has intensified, and Federal attorneys have been granting immunity to most of the recent witnesses. In addition to store presidents, witnesses subpoenaed included other top management executives as well as staff assistants.

title: JOSIAH K. ADAMS
description: Josiah K. Adams, retired founder and president of J. K. Adams Company, Inc., maker of specialty wood products in Dorset, Vt., died Tuesday in Burlington, Vt. He was 79 years old and lived in Dorset.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Vinyl Chloride Is Reported In Air Around Seven Plants
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) The Environmental Protection Agency said yesterday that vinyl chloride gas, a chemical suspected of causing cancer, had been detected in the air of neighborhoods surrounding seven plants that manufacture the gas.

title: Zorila, Nisselson Gain Westchestet Golf Final
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 12The championship of the Westchester County Golf Association's 55th amateur tournament will be resolved tomorrow between two former titleholders.

title: Tennis Results
description: N.Y. STATE MEN

title: City Says Food Industry Fails to Let Prices Drop
description: Commissioner Elinor Guggenheimer of the City Department of Consumer Affairs accused the food industry yesterday of deliberately keeping prices high at a time when wholesale food prices were dropping, a practice she said is having a disastrous effect on the budgets of low and middle income consumers.

title: Senate Votes Bill to Spur Coal Use by Power Plants
description: WASHINGTON, June 12The Senate approved by voice vote today a bill to promote use of coalrather than oil or gas for steampowered electric plants, but to do it with minimum impact on clean air goals and schedules.

title: VVNET Gets $4Million for Adams Saga
description: The National Endowment for the Humanities announced in Washington yesterday a grant of $4million to WNET/13 toWard the production of a 13week dramatic series tracing the 150 years of United States history that were affected by four generations of the family of President John Adams.

title: Italy in Distress
description: Italy's second political crisis in three months has the same origin as the first: the impact of a fourfold increase in oil prices on an economy already suffering from strains difficult for a weak coalition government to resolve. The international cause of the trouble suggests that it requires an international solution.

title: DRUGGISTS URGE 3D CLASS OF DRUGS
description: The nation's druggists have proposed that certain nonprescription drugs be sold only by registered pharmacists so that consumers can be warned about adverse reactions to the potentially harmful chemicals that many of the drugs contain.

title: Facts on U.S. Open
description: EVENT74th United States Open, one round each today, tomorrow, Saturday, Sunday. Playoff, if necessary, 18 holes on. Monday, June 17.

title: But Proposed Rules Pose Difficulties
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced Yesterday that it endorsed foreign membership in the exchangesignaling a big step toward free trade in the world's securities business. However, the exchange also proposed guidelines that would make membership difficult without substantial changes in foreign and United States banking, and securities regulations.

title: TEXAN SURRENDERS IN SLAYING OF BRIDE
description: NEW ORLEANS, June 12Claudius James Kiesick Jr., indicted here last week on a seconddegree murder charge following an intensive police investigation of the death here of his heavily insured bride, surrendered today to authorities in San Antonio, Tex.

title: Humphrey Turns In Diamond Received From Mobutu in '68
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) Senator Hubert H. Humphrey, Democrat of Minnesota, turned over to the State Department today an eightcarat diamond given to him by President Sese Seko Mobuto of Zaire, the Senator's office confirmed.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The state Environmental Protection Department said It would spend $525,000 this year for summer recreation and cultural outings for youngsters. Seventy local and country agencies will use the money to send a quarter of million disadvantaged children to a baseball game in New York and Philadelphia, and to zoos, museums and parks, They will also visit the New York Giants and New York Jets football training camps. The Legislature appropriated $600,000 for the summer Youth Conservation and Recreation Development program. The remaining $75,000 will be used for a pilot Youth Conservation Corps camp at Stokes State Forest.

title: Federal Resources Agrees  On Producing Coking Coal
description: The Federal Resources Corporation and KanematsuGosho, Ltd., announced at Salt Lake City that they had signed an agreement for largescale production of lowsulphur coking coal on lands controlled by Federal near Tuscaloosa, Ala. Preliminary estimates have placed coal reserves in place at about 80 million tons. The site is 17 miles north of Tuscaloosa.

title: France Sets Higher Taxes In a Broad Austerity Plan
description: PARIS, June 12The French Government today announced an austerity program that would include higher taxes and lower consumption of energy as a means of checking inflation and improving the sagging balance of payments.

title: Industry's Abuse of Women
description: LOS ANGELES  The American businessman is losing his head over women. He claims that he employs them if they are qualified; pays them what they are worth; involves them high in the decision  making process, and even welcomes their becoming corporate presidents. A fine public posture. After all, women want to be treated like any other commodity in the market place, not to be subsidized, not to be given preferential treatment. The Supreme Court has held that women are entitled to wage parity. But what really is happening?

title: Personal Finance
description: Having a check bounce by mistaking the amount of money in the account can be embarrassingnot to mention expensive if it happens a few times.

title: Angels End Rift, Then Lose to Yankees, 64
description: The California Angels patched up the feud between Frank Robinson and Manager Bobby Winkles yesterday and then, one big happy family again, dropped a 64 decision to the New York Yankees.

title: MEMOS TO PANEL SAY NIKON SOUGHT SECOND COVERUP
description: WASHINGTON, June 12Confidential memorandums pre pared by some Democratic members of the House impeachment inquiry have stated that President Nixon took an active part last year in attempts to develop a second Watergate coverup plan when the first one went awry.

title: House Inquiry Criticizes White House For Approach to Ellsberg Trial Judge
description: WASHINGTON, June 12Democrats and Republicans on the House Judiciary Committee concluded today that it was highly improper for the White House to approach the judge in Dr. Daniel Ellsberg's trial last year about the possibility of the judge's becoming director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: WOODCLIFF LAKE, June. 12After Diane Lovato's last scholastic gymnastic meet, in which she won her third straight Bergen County allround title for Pascack Hills, she was approached by one of the judges. The judge said: Good luck in the future. I've enjoyed watching you the last few years.

title: Big Board Sale Unchanged
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that two of its memberships were sold at $85,000 each, unchanged from the previous sale on June 7. Seats on the exchange are currently quoted at $73,000 bid and $85,000 offered.

title: 2 Are Found Guilty of Bribery In Model Cities Programs Here
description: The head of an East Harlem antipoverty agency and a realestate broker have been convicted of conspiracy to defraud the Federal Government for their part in a $70,000 bribe scheme involving almost $2million in Model Cities contracts.

title: FRAUD LAID TO FIRMS ON 1969 STOCK SALE
description: Two national accounting firms committed fraud in the 1969 offering of $7.5million of securities of the Firestone Group, Ltd., a California real estate, company, a Federal District Judge has ruled.

title: Maine Democrats Pick '72 Aide Of Muskie to Run for Governor
description: AUGUSTA, Me., June 12George J. Mitchell, the deputy director of Senator Edmund S. Muskie's 1972 Presidential campaign, easily won the Democratic nomination for Governor yesterday.

title: Tigers' Lolich Shuts Out Rangers and Evens Mark
description: For a while it appeared as if it were going to be a repeat of the 1970 season for Mickey Lolich, Detroit's 33yearold lefthander, but after last night's 70 shutout of Texas in Tiger Stadium it seems it might be a repeat of his 1971 season.

title: Sirica Urges Haldeman and Ehrlichman To Seek White House Data as Friends
description: WASHINGTON, June 12Federal Judge John J. Sirica, saying that the easy way is worth a try, advised John D. Ehrlichman and H. R. Haldeman today to have a nice hearttoheart talk with President Nixon about the White House files they contend they need for their defense, in the Watergate coverup case.

title: Cheering Cairo Throngs Greet Nixon
description: CAIRO, June 12  Great crowds of Egyptians cheered President Nixon with unreserved enthusiasm today when he arrived on the first stop of his tour of the Middle East.

title: VOLCKER SEES PEAK IN INTEREST RATES
description: WASHINGTON, June I2, WASHINGTON, June 12, (Reuters)Paul A. Volcker, the Under Secretary of the Treasury for Monetary Affairs, said today that he believed high interest rates had peaked and that he foresaw a decline in the rate of inflation to below 10 per cent by yearend.

title: What Is Fast, Safe and Also Cheap? In Tokyo, It's the Expanding Subway
description: TOKYO  It's fast, it's safe, it's cheap, and if you don't have one in your neighborhood, don't be impatient. They're building a new one almost every year.

title: Acid in Raia Found Up Sharply in East; Smoky Curb Cited
description: In the last two decades, rain falling on the eastern United States and Europe has increased in acidity to 100 to 1,000 times normal levels, two ecologists have found. They said that the change had come about despite the increased use of air pollution controls and, in large part, because of some methods now used to clean smokestack emissions.

title: Finding of Rats Closes Habitat's Food Section
description: TRENTON, June 12 (AP)The commissary at the Jungle Hibitat amusement park in West Milford has been shut down because of rat droppings and other unsanitary conditions.

title: Panovs Receive Exit Visas; Dance for Joy on Sidewalk
description: MOSCOW, June 12  The dancers Valery and Galina Panov received their Soviet exit visas today and afterward danced for joy on the sidewalk outside Leningrad's visa office, which was opened especially to accommodate them.

title: STATE G.O.P. TOLD: HEW TO NEW LAW
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., June 12 Republican public and party officials were warned here today that they could go to jail if they violated the new State Election Law.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The New York and Amercan Stock Exchanges yesterday issued their latest reports on changes in stock ownership by leading stockholders, directors and officers of listed companies, The reports include the following:

title: Chris Evert Overcomes Miss Heldman, 609 75
description: PARIS, June 12Chris Evert marched into the semifinals of the French open tennis championships today, but for some spellbinding moments in the second set, when Julie Heldman rose from 13 to 54 with her service to come, the match was up for grabs.

title: Town Puts X on Movies
description: WESTBROOK, Me., June 12 (UPI)  This town voted yesterday to ban pornographic movies. Returns from three out of five wards showed a 1,121to375 vote against showing obscene, hardcore pornographic films.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The Case for a U.S. Food Reserve Policy

title: Franklin Asks S.E.C. to Extend Ban on Trading of Its Securities
description: The Franklin National Bank for the fifth time since May 12asked the Securities and Exchange Commission yesterday to suspend trading in its securities.

title: Amex Seat Down $2,000
description: A regular membership on the American Stock Exchange was Sold yesterday at $30,000, down $2,000 from the last sale on June 5. The current bid is $27,500, with $34,000 asked.

title: Byrne Bids Labor Back Income Tax
Briton Held as Smuggler
description: Elizah Getter, a 22yearold native of London, was arraigned yesterday before Magistrate Max Schiffman in Federal Court Brooklyn, on charges of smuggling diamonds into this country. According to Assistant United States Attorney Paul Lazarus, the defendant arrived here Monday and was found to be carrying three cut diamonds valued at $67,500.

title: Newark's Air Terminal C Expected to Be Postponed
description: NEWARK, June 12  The Port, Authority of New York and New Jersey plans to post pone for three years the completion of one of the thre?? new terminals at Newark International Airport because of what officials describe as th?? very severe financial straits?? of the airlines.

title: WATERGATE ASSURED PRIORITY BY BURGER
description: WASHINGTON, June 12Chief Justice Warren E. Burger said today it was a myth that the Supreme Court took a fourmonth holiday in the summer and would thus not be available to decide Watergate cases promptly as they may arise in the coming months.

title: Nixon's Favorite Mayor Seeks New Tag
description: INDIANAPOLISFor a number of years, Mayor Richard G. Lugar of Indianapolis has reveled in the description President Nixon's favorite Mayor.

title: SOVIET USES DEVICE TO PREDICT QUAKES
description: Soviet scientists have confirmed that they are using magnetohydrodynamic generator to drive electrical currents through the earth to predict the time, place and magnitude of impending earthquakes.

title: Townshenod One of the Who, Faces a Creative How
description: Pete Townshend is the chief composer and lead guitarist for the Who, the British rock group that is at Madison Square Garden this week. Most of the songs that he has written for the band ware autobiographical, in one way or another. And so it comes as no great surprise when one meets him that his personality seems to approximate the image suggested both in the Who's music and by his own stage presence: nervous, intense, full of repressed violence and quick small smiles, and above all capable of a level of analytical speculation rare in the world of rock'n'roll.

title: DRUG DETECTIVE LINKED TO MAFIA
description: Joseph N. Nunziata, a narcotics detective, who was found dead in his parked car two years ago and whose forged signature appears on vouchers used in the theft of $70million worth of heroin from the Police Department property clerk's office, was linked to Vincent C. Papa, an alleged Mafia member described as a major narcotics dealer, court records disclosed yesterday.

title: Recount Starts Tomorrow
description: NEWARK, June 12 (UPI)A recount will begin Friday in the Fifth Congressional District Republican primary election won by Millicent Fenwick over Assemblyman Thomas H. Kean, unofficially by 86 votes. The recount, ordered by the Superior Court Assignment Judge, James R. Juliano, is not scheduled to be completed until June 20.

title: A.E.C. Gives AllClear
description: CORDOVA, Ill., June 12 (AP) Officials of the Atomic Energy Commission found no contamination in the Mississippi River yesterday after radioactive steam was accidentally released at a nuclear power plant. The accident was the second within a month at the Quad Cities Nuclear Station, operated by Commonwealth Edison and the IowaIllinois Gas & Electric Co. No one was injured.

title: Senate Vote Lets Aide File Affidavit in Reinecke Case
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP) The Senate voted today to allow a Senate Judiciary Committee staff counsel to respond to a motion in the perjury case of Lieut. Gov. Ed Reinecke of California.

title: Fur Designers Make Big Exit
description: The last act of the recent fur showings was Alixandre's. To this furrier's regular designing team of Givenchy and Viola Sylbert was added Calvin Klein, who is usually to be found doing sportswear on upper Seventh Avenue. The designers go their different ways, but what they all have in common is bigness and a lavish use of dyed furs.

title: Notes on People
description: Two Federal Appeals Court judges yesterday excused themselves from sitting on a panel studying the release on bond of the former Army lieutenant William L. Calley Jr., who was convicted in connection with the My Lai massacre in Vietnam. They did so because they have extensive military backgrounds.

title: Accord Set on Use Of Monetary Gold
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 The 10 leading financial powers have agreed upon a plan to make national monetary gold holdings at least partially usable again by permitting them to be pledged as collateral for loans at a price to be agreed between the lender and the borrower.

title: Kosygin Says Soviet Energy Pool Buoys Economy
description: MOSCOW, June 12Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin today credited ample energy reserves with having insured the Soviet Union a bright economic future, but he conceded that the economy had not yet surmounted some of its most persistent problems.

title: ... Health Breakthrough
description: The Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America, a pioneer in identifying union objectives with community betterment, has demonstrated in settlement of its weeklong strike that its capacity for pioneering is not all behind it.

title: CAPITAL RALLYING ROUND KISSINGER; VINDICATION ASKED
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 Members of Congress and Government officials rallied to the support of Secretary of State Kissinger today, urging that his reputation be cleared so he would, not carry out his threat yesterday to resign.

title: F.D.A. Asks Rules On Nutrients Added To Food Products
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 The Food and Drug Administration proposed today important new regulations to protect the American consumer from both nutritionally substandard foods and irrationally overfortified products.

title: CHARLES J. SPIES SR.
description: Charles J. Spies Sr., who retired as assistant treasurer of the Chase Manhattan Bank in 1958 after 40 years with the institution, died yesterday in St. Clare's Hospital, Denville, N.J. He was 80 years old and lived in Boonton Township.

title: Siege End's as Girl Is Pulled to Safety; Stepfather Is Dead
description: After a day and a night of persistent pleading with a gunman holding a 5yearold girl hostage in a Queens housing project, the police managed to snatch the girl to safety yesterday morning and seize her captorwithout firing a single shot.

title: Little League Baseball Yields to Social Climate and Accepts Girls
description: Officials of Little League; Baseball, Inc., announced yesterday in Williamsport, Pa., that they would defer to the changing social climate and permit girls to play on their teams.

title: Guard Gets New Post; His Father Is an Inmate
description: MORRISTOWN, June 12 (UPI)A county guard whose father was jailed oh gambling charges and ended up being guarded occasionally by his son, has been ordered transferred from the Morris Counto Jail.

title: W.F.L. Changes PointAfter Rule
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., June 12 (AP)  The World Football League has changed its rule concerning the point after a touchdown, Commissioner Gary Davidson announced today.

title: A Ruling Clouds issue of Rent Rebates
description: A ruling by an Appellate Division judge threw into confusion and dispute last night the question whether tenants of 100,000 rentcontrolled apartments are entitled to immediate refunds of money owed them by their landlords under a law signed by Mayor Beame on Tuesday.

title: CAMBIDIAN PREMIER REPORTED TO RESIGN
description: PHNOM. PENH, Cambodia, Thursday, June 13 (AP) Premier Long Boret submitted his resignation to President Lon Nol today, a source close to the president reported.

title: CAMBODIA UNEASY IN MURDERS' WAKE
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, June 12  More than a week has passed since the Education. Minister and a former minister were shot to death while being held hostage by protesting students, and no one apparently knows who pulled the trigger.

title: Bill on Energy Research Supported by House Panel
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (AP)  The House Interior Committee approved today a $3.1million energy research and development bill.

title: REFORMS URGED IN CHARITY FIELD
description: TRENTON, June 12The New Jersey State Commission of Investigation today recommended new and stronger state laws to stop profitmaking organizations from falsely implying through their telephone sales pitches that they are aiding the handicapped.

title: Death Penalty Law Upheld
description: CONCORD, N.H., June 12 (AP)  The New Hampshire Constitutional Convention upheld the state's new death penalty law today when it refused to place the question of capital punishment before voters. The delegates also rejected a righttowork proposal that would prohibit mandatory union membership, or closed union shops.

title: Market Place: Bringing Back The Individual
description: Twothirds of some 300 analysts and money managers who responded to a questionnaire said that a rising market was all it would take to bring the individual investor back to Wall Street.

title: COUSINS MAGAZINE TURNS THE CORNER
description: Norman Cousins announced yesterday that Saturday Review/World had begun operating in the black in recent weeksa year after the publishers of the old Saturday Review magazines had filed bankruptcy proceedings with more than $4million in debts.

title: Judge Decides Ehrlichman Can Be Tried With Others
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 In a surprise move, Federal District Judge Gerhard A. Gesell reversed himself today and said that he would let John D. Ehrlichman stand trial with three other men in the White House plumbers case.

title: Shell Agrees to Payment For Libyan Oil TakeOver
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 12 (UPI)The Shell Oil Company agreed today to accept compensation from the Libyan Government following the nationalizaon of all its holdings in Libya last March, the Arab Revolution News agency said.

title: For a Black Family in Detroit, Inflation Ends Retirement Plan
description: DETROIT, June 12It began at the White Pine Tavern.

title: TEXACO UNIT SUES LILCO ON LIBYA OIL
description: A subsidiary of Texaco, Inc., the Texaco Overseas Petroleum Company, charged yesterday that the Long Island Lighting Company had illegally acquired oil belonging to it that had been unlawfully seized after what it described as the purported nationalization of the subsidiary by the Libyan Government.

title: P.S.C. Aide Urges Rise in State Rates For Western Union
description: ALBANY, June 12  A Public Service Commission examiner today recommended rate increases of 67 per cent for the Western Union Telegraph Company on intrastate telegrams of up to 15 words.

title: Theater: Vivid Playboy
description: The great John Millington Synge undoubtedly would smile at the charming version of The Playboy of the Western World now at the West Side Community Repertory Theaterif he could find it.

title: 13 Golfers Picked For Hall of Fame
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 12 (UPI)  Thirteen golfers, including Jack Nicklaus, Arnold Palmer, Ben Hogan and Bobby Jones, were named today as the first inductees to the world golf Hall of Fame. The selections were made by the Golf Writers Association of America.

title: Florida Gets Disclosure Law
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., June 12 (UPI)  Gov. Reubin Askew signed today a law requiring politicians in Florida to disclose the sources of their income. No one should underestimate the mood of the public today, nor the need for these in public office to earn, and earn again, the faith of the people we seek to serve, Mr. Askew said.

title: Alleghany to Inform USM Of New Stock Purchases
description: The Alleghany Corporation, which is seeking to acquire control of the USM Corporation over its objections, agreed yesterday to advise USM daily of any new purchases of its stock.

title: The Horsey Set Makes Hay at Ox Ridge
description: DARIEN, Conn., June 12The 45th Ox Ridge horse show  the largest outdoor show in the metropolitan areaopened today with 95pound Michelle McEvoy riding the first winner of the day, although she couldn't find a glass of milk to soothe her upset stomach.

title: Egypt at a Glance
description: Vital StatisticsEgypt is a nation of 386,000 square miles, as large as Texas and New Mexico combined, but most of the population of 35.9 million are farmers who live in about 14,000 square miles of cultivatable land along, the banks of the Nile. Over five million live in Cairo, the capital and largest city.

title: Wood, Field & Stream: Some Pointers on How to Hook Striped Bass
description: WARWICK, R. I.Something is after him. Get ready! cried Dick Sevigny, the operaloving Narragensett Bay quahogger who is also a linguist and a dedicated striped bass angler.

title: Senate Votes Bill to Spur Coal Use by Power Plants
description: WASHINGTON, June 12The Senate approved by voice vote today a bill to promote use of coal rather than oil or gas for steampowered electric plants, but to do it with minimum impact on clean air goals and schedules.

title: A LEGALAID BILL ENCOUNTERS SNAG
description: WASHINGTON, June 12Legislation setting up an independent Federal program of free legal services for the poor may become a victim, its supporters fear, of the crippling new Washington disease: impeachment politics.

title: Consumer Notes
description: If the city's experience is any criterion, the new state law that will require unit pricing starting Jan. 1 in food stores that do a total of over $2million in gross sales a year can be expected to be an eyestraining, kneebending, confusing and spotty aid to consumers.

title: Iowa Beef Executive Said to Have Known Of Payoffs Here
description: A key prosecution witness in the conspiracy trial of Currier J. Holman and Ws company, Iowa Beef Processors, Inc., testified yesterday in State Supreme Court in Manhattan that Mr. Holman had known that payoffs were necessary to do business in New York City.

title: France Sets Higher Taxes In a Broad Austerity Plan
description: PARIS, June 12The French Government today announced an austerity program that would include higher taxes and lower consumption of energy as a means of checking inflation and improving the sagging balance of payments.

title: Merger Prospect Revived
description: A detailed plan for the amalgamation of the American and National Basketball Associations in time for next season has been drawn in informal meetings the last few days. It will come up before each league in formal meetings next week.

title: Miss Furtseva Reported Back in Soviet Elections
description: MOSCOW, June 12Soviet sources reported today that, in a reversal, Yekaterina A. Furtseva, the Minister of Culture, was being assigned an election district though she had originally been passed over for renomination to the Supreme Soviet.

title: Kuwaiti Panel Proposes A Cut in Oil Production
description: KUWAIT, June 12 (Reuters) The Kuwait National Assembly's Finance and Economy Committee has proposed sharp cut In oil production, Deputy Abdullah alBeiri said today.

title: City's Hostage Unit Had Genesis in Munich
description: Fiveyearold Avril Letticia Kinsler is alive today partly because of the concern of a high police officer two years ago over the killing of Israeli athletes at the Munich Olympic games.

title: Vatican Hopes Cup Has Sporting Spirit
description: VATICAN CITY, June 12 (AP) The Vatican voiced the hope through its radio today that the World Cup tournament starting in West Germany tomorrow would be played in a noble and sporting spirit.

title: Air Canada Blocks Increase in Fares For Atlantic Flights
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., June 12Air Canada continued today to block efforts by other international airlines to raise trans,Atlantic air fares again next month in what would be the fourth increase this year.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Fireman Killed in Rescue Attempt

title: May Savings Outflow
description: Savers last month withdrew $190million more from their savings bank accounts than they deposited. The outflow was the first for the month of May since World War II. Page 69.

title: Dazzling Feast of French Drawings
description: The pressures of economy can sometimes yield high esthetic dividends, at least in a museum blessed with a firstrate permanent collection too sizable to be exhibited in its entirety in the normal course of things. This has lately been the case, certainly, at the Museum of Modern Art, where the rising cost of loan shows has prompted a program of major exhibitions drawn from the museums' own extensive holdings.

title: F.D.A. Asks Rules On Nutrients Added To Food Products
description: WASHINGTON, June 12Thee Food and Drug Administration proposed today important new regulations to protect the American consumer from both nutritionally substandard foods and irrationally overfortified products.

title: House Panel Estimates U.S. and States Lose $115Million a Year in Taxes That Illegal Aliens Escape
description: WASHINGTON, June 12The loss of tax revenue to Federal and state governments on the income of aliens who are in this country illegally is estimated at roughly $115million annually by a Congressional subcommittee in a report on its investigation of the Immigration and Naturalization Service.

title: Braves Down Mets by 10 As Morton Beats Parker
description: ATLANTA, June 12Harry Parker, the Mets' taciturn righthander, may soon be doing more talking. Tonight, he lost his second 10 decision in a row, a squeaker decided in the eighth inning.

title: Advertising: Gain for Parents'?
description: When your corporate slogan is From crib to college, a decline in the national birth rate is not considered a happy turn of events.

title: Rentzel Loses Appeal On Marijuana Ruling
description: LOS ANGELES, June 12 (UPI)  The State Court of Appeals upheld today a lower court marijuana conviction against the Los Angeles Rams' wide receiver, Lance Rentzel.

title: A. Special Presidential Consultant Comments on Questions of Justice
description: WASHINGTONRichard M. Nixon, President of the United States, has been named an unindicted coconspirator by the unanimous vote of a Federal grand jury in the nation's capital, Washington, D. C. Sounds impressive and ominous.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Failure of Perception
description: LONDON, June 12  Henry Kissinger's unique place in world politics was indicated plainly enough by the British treatment of his resignation threat. It made banner headlines even in the tabloids. The Guardian doubtless reflected informed opinion when it said his departure would be a sad day.

title: Rand Report Predicts Any National Health Insurance Plan Would Swamp Doctors' Offices and Clinics
description: Any national health insurance plan that covered costs of most medical bills would swamp doctors' offices and outpatient clinics but have little impact on hospitalizations, according to a Rand Corporation report released yesterday.

title: Results of School Board Vote In Nassau, Suffolk, Westchester
Peron Withdraws a Threat to Resign After Supporters Stage Rally
description: BUENOS AIRES. June 12President Juan Domingo Pern threatened to resign today if he did not receive public support for his economic and political programs, but withdrew the threat after thousands of supporters staged a rally here.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: MERGER DELAYED BYGENERAL CRUDE
description: Directors of the General Crude Oil Company, which met yesterday to take action on the proposed $437million acquisition offer by the International Paper Company, did not approve the deal had been expected. Instead, the company said its board would take the proposed transaction under advisement and would attempt to promptly evaluate the fairness of the terms offered and to take action on the proposal as soon as reasonably practicable.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SIX FLATS FRND. Twentyseven members of the New York chapter of the National Society of Interior Designers were turned loose in 24 rooms of six apartmentswith more than a halfmillion dollars.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Lee MacPhail, American League president, upheld yesterday the forfeit of the Cleveland Indians' June 4 game to the Texas Rangers after he met with Indians' officials. MacPhail met with Ted Bonda, vice president of the Indians, and Phil Seghi, the club's general manager.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Todd Shipyards Corporation said yesterday it had been awarded contracts for construction of four 89,700ton (deadweight) tankers totaling about $155million. Three of the tankers would be built for the Hawaiian International Shipping Corporation and the fourth for the United States Lines.

title: Prices of Bonds Dip in Quiet Trading
description: Several new corporate offerings received good initial receptions yesterday in the credit markets, where trading remained generally quiet and prices of outstanding obligations slipped toward the close. The slippage in prices dotted the list of recently marketed corporate obligations and also showed up in the Treasury bill market, where rates on the new threemonth and sixmonth bills rose.

title: Shale Tract Fails to Get Bid
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo., June 12 (UPI)The sixth and final oil shale lease tract offered under a Federal program to spur energy development failed to receive a single bid from the nation's energy companies yesterday. The lease, a 5,120acre tract about 50 miles Southeast of Rock Springs in Southwest Wyoming, was the second lease offered in Wyoming under the program. The first offering, a tract of the same size in the same area, also failed to spur a bid.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, June, 12 (UPI)The Senate approved bill today to establish a 13member independent commission that would warn the country of impending shortages of raw materials, minerals and agricultural commodities.

title: DECLINES SHOWN BY AMEX STOCKS
description: With traders losing confidence in the possibility of an immediate sharp reduction in the prime interest rate, prices fell yesterday on the American Stock Exchange and the over. thecounter market in dull trading. Activity on the Amex was the slowest since May 6.

title: Sawhill Says Simon Backed Oil Aide's Energy Role
description: WASHINGTON, June 12Federal Energy Administrator John C. Sawhill said today that the assignment of an oil company employe, temporarily working for the Government, to energy matters had been approved by Treasury Secretary William E. Simon under guidelines laid down by the Treasury's general counsel.

title: New York Will Become a SevenDay Mecca for Star Athietes and Their Fans
description: New York's reputation for yawning at momentous events is about to be tested by a weeklong carnival of major sports happenings.

title: Land Use Policy
description: The House of Representatives' rejection Tuesday of the land use policy and the planning assistance bill, while it will be deplored by environmentalists, shapes up as an exercise in futility akin to King Canute's broomwielding against the sea. The measure, in essence, would have provided $800million in grants to the states to set up comprehensive land use planning. But the fact is that in the four years the legislation has been gestating, circumstances have pushed the states willynilly into land use planning.

title: Wilson, Accepting, Calls G.O.P. Strong
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., June 12Governor Wilson accepted the nomination of state Republicans for a full term tonight with a message for those crepehangers, those hopeful pallbearers and those wishful thinkers outside our party who would like to believe our party is dead.

title: Albany Bill to Channel Rents Into Repairs Becomes a Law
description: ALBANY, June 12Tenants in Nassau, Suffolk, Rockland and Westchester Counties now can seek court orders directing that the rents be paid into a special account to pay for correcting dangerous violations under the terms of a bill signed into law, Governor Wilson's office reported today. Previously, only tenants in New York City could do this.

title: Multinational Army Urged at Meeting Of African Leaders
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia, June 12 The leaders of 25 black and Arab African nations meeting here today heard the Somali President, Maj. Gen. Mohamed S. Siad Barre, declare that the establishment of a multinational African military force was the only answer to what he called the inevitable confrontation with South Africa.

title: Marcos Offers New Land Policy And Amnesty to Moslem Rebels
description: MANILA, June 12 (UPI)President Ferdinand E. Marcos announced today that his Government would grant full amnesty to Moslem rebels in the southern Philippines who are willing to negotiate and lay down their arms.

title: Europe Is Surprised and Smpathetc
description: LONDON, June 12Secretary of State Kissinger's threat to resign over allegations that, he was involved in illegal wiretapping aroused surprise and feelings of sympathy in the European diplomatic community today.

title: Judge Bars du Pont From Dumping Waste in Gulf Off Florida
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., June 12 A Federal District judge barred E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co. today front discharging industrial waste into the Gulf of Mexico off the Florida coast for 10 days.

title: Borrower and Lender Are Victims of Holdup
description: A young man who had just borrowed $1,200 at the Household Finance Company office at 587 Fulton Street, in Brooklyn's downtown section, was forced to surrender the money to two gunmen, who also robbed the company cash drawer of $936 and several employes of $120 yesterday.

title: HOLDERS' UNIT SUES INTERSTATE STORES
description: A group of investors in Interstate Stores, Inc., has filed a suit for $110million in damages against the financially troubled retail chain.

title: Angels End Rift, Then Lose to Yankees, 64
description: The California Angels patched up the feud between Frank Robinson and Manager Bobby Winkles yesterday and then, one big happy family again, dropped a 64 decision to the New York Yankees.

title: N.H.L. Gives Franchises To Denver, Seattle for '76
description: MONTREAL, June 12The National Hockey League filled the rosters of its two new teams today, the New York Rangers officially acquired Derek Sanderson from the Boston Bruins and Denver and Seattle were named as the expansion clubs for 1976. The league business all went without a hitch, as everyone expected.

title: Asamera Oil's Profits Up by 132.1% in Fiscal Year
ENVOY OF AUSTRALIA IS SNUBBED IN PEKING
description: PEKING, June 12Chinese Foreign Ministry officials yesterday snubbed Dr. Stephen Fitzgerald, the Australian Ambassador, and three resident Australian correspondents by refusing to attend a dinner party to which they were invited.

title: BAPTISTS REJECT MINORITY QUOTAS
description: DALLAS, Tex., June 12 Delegates to the 117th annual meeting of the Southern Baptist Convention here turned down resolution after resolution today that would have established quota systems and rights for minorities and women within the 12.3millionmember denomination.

title: WNET Gets $4Million for Adams Saga
description: The National Endowment for the Humanities announced in Washington yesterday a grant pf $4million to WNET/13 toward the production of a 13week dramatic series tracing the 150 years of United States history that were affected by four generations of the family of President John Adams.

title: LOW BEEF PRICES TO BE DISCUSSED
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 (UPI)Under heavy bipartisan pressure from members of Congress, Agriculture Secretary Earl L. Butz said today a White House conference would be held Monday to seek ways to help cattlemen who have had losses estimated at over $1.5billion in the last nine months.

title: April Rise in Plant Inventories Was the Smallest Since October
description: WASHINGTON, June 12The buildup of business inventories was the smallest in April since last October, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Tokyo Aide Startles Business By Enforcing Antitrust Laws
description: TOKYO, June 12  The conservative world of Japanese business may be the last place on earth to look for a revolution. But an insurrection has started here, and it is being led by a very pillar of the governing establishment.

title: Aramco Deal Is OilPrice Movel
description: BEIRUT, June 12 Saudi Arabia's acquisition of 60 per cent ownership of the ArabianAmerican Oil Company forms part of a plan to bring crude oil prices Iower, according, to Saudi Arabian Government sources.

title: Court Hears of Shipment of 32 Rothkos
description: Frank Lloyd, head of the Marlborough Gallery, and Edward Ross, lawyer for Kate Rothko, daughter of the late Mark Rothko, sparred all day in Surrogate's Court yesterday over the real reason for the fact that 32 Rothko paintings were shipped to Europe from New York in 1972.

title: Siege Ends as Girl Is Pulled Safety; Stegfather Is Dead
description: After a day and a night of persistent pleading with a gunman holding a 5yearold girl hostages in a Queens housing project, the police managed to snatch the girl to safety yesterday morning and seize her captor without firing a single shot.

title: LOCKHEED SET BACK BY CONTRACT LOSS
description: BURBANK, Calif., June 12 (AP)The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation suffered a financial setback when Middle East Airlines signed an estimated $100million contract with the Boeing Corporation of Seattle Monday.

title: Prosecution Rests in Trial In '73 Sports Store Siege
description: The prosecution finished presenting its case yesterday against four Sunni Muslims on trial before State Supreme Court Justice Hyman Barshay and a jury in Brooklyn for the robbery of a sporting goods store there on Jan. 13, 1973.

title: BLACK MUSLIMS TURN TO IMPORTS
description: In the first phase of an international buying program, local representatives of the Nation of Islam, the Black Muslim group whose businesses include SteakandTake fastfood shops, picked up a quartermillion pounds of Imported whiting from a Brooklyn pier yesterday morning.

title: Police Chief and 4 Wounded By Sniper in California City
description: UNION CITY, Calif., June 12 (UPI)Shots that were fired through a parish hall window last night wounded five persons, including a police chief who had been trying to better police relations in a MexicanAmercian district of this San Francisco suburb.

title: Doctors' Decision Allowed Suspect's Release in July
description: A decision by doctors at Matteawan State Hospital, an institution for mentally disturbed criminals, led to the release last summer of the man who held a 5yearold girl hostage for more than 30 hours and allegedly killed her stepfather.

title: MEMOS TO PANEL SAY NIXON SOUGHT SECOND COVERUP
description: WASHINGTON, June 12Confidential memorandums prepared by some Democratic members of the House impeachment inquiry have stated that President Nixon took an active part last year in attempts to develop a second Watergate coverup plan when the first one went awry.

title: Acid in Rain Found Up Sharply in East; Smoke Curb Cited
description: In the last two decades, rain falling on the eastern United States and Europe has increased in acidity to 100 to 1,000 times normal levels, two ecologists have found. They said that the change had come about despite the increased use of air pollution controls and, in large part, because of some methods now used to clean smokestack emissions.

title: Committee Backing for Samuels Likely
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N. Y., June 12Backed by the state's top Democratic leaders, Howard J. Samuels today appeared assured of at least 70 per cent of the Democratic State Committee vote while his only chal lenger, Representative Hugh L. Carey of Brooklyn, fought to capture at least the 25 per cent of the vote needed to force a primary fight over the Democratic gubernatorial nomination.

title: PROTECTION VOTED FOR CITY GREENERY
description: The City Planning Commission approved yesterday a systern of special protective controts to preserve open space within planned residential communities and moved immediately to designate Parkchester in the Bronx and Fresh Meadows in Queens as two of the first beneficiaries.

title: 2 Seized in a Kidnapping; Victim, 51, Released Later
description: WEST NEW YORK, June 12 The Federal Bureau of Investigation arrested two men today after a feigned ransom drop and charged them with extortion in connection with the kidnapping of a 51yearold man yesterday.

title: Miami Upsets U.S.C. Nine, 73
description: OMAHA, June 12 (UPI) The Miami Hurricanes scored for four runs in the eighth inning tonight to defeat Southern California, 73, and remain the only unbeaten team in the 1974 college world series.

title: PRICE SWING WIDE SILVER TRADING
description: Wide swings in price marked trading in silver futures yesterday as traders responded to news about the international monetary meeting of finance ministers in Washington.

title: DR. FRANK CRAIG DIES, ENDOCRINOLOGIST, 59
description: Dr. Frank A. Graig, director of the department of medicine at Westchester County Medical Center and professor of medicine at the New York Medical College, died of cancer yesterday in Montefiore Hospital, the Bronx. He was 59 years old and lived at 2 North Broadway, White Plains.

title: Spiral Uncoiling...
description: The inevitable spillover in strikes and inflationary wage settlements of the Government's abandonment wageprice controls is already being reflected in a nationwide jump in the volume of stoppages.

title: City Labor Aide's Travel Reported Under Scrutiny
description: The acting director of the city's Bureau of Labor Services is under investigation for alleged misuse of official funds, according to the.Department of Investigation.

title: Kissinger Quiet and Glum Day After His Statement
description: CAIRO, June 12  Quite suddenly, it seemed, the man who appeared on the Newsweek cover of June 10 as Superman is today no longer the center of attention.

title: Return of South Vietnamese From Hong Kong Is Fought
description: LONDON, June 12Amnesty International appealed to the British Government today to stop the deportation from Hong Kong to South. Vietnam of 119 South Vietnamese.

title: Nathaniel Rothenberg, Lawyer And a Zionist Leader, Dead at 61
description: Nathaniel S. Rothenberg, a lawyer and a Zionist leader, died at Mount Sinai Hospital on Tuesday evening. He was 61 years, old and lived at 225 West 86th Street.

title: BONN WON'T MARK EAST'S '63 RISING
description: BONN, June 12  The West German Government decided today that it would not observe the 21st anniversary next Monday of the June 17 uprising of workers in East Germany.

title: U.S. MAIL SERVICE FACES BIG DEFICIT
description: The Postal Service is ending its third fiscal year with record $385million nationwide deficit in operations instead of a $14Million surplus initially hoped for, William F. Bolger, Postmaster General for the Northeast region, said here yesterday.

title: Nixon and Kissinger Face New Suit Over Wiretaps
description: WASHINGTON, June 12Two former members of the National Security Council staff filed suit today against President Nixon and Secretary of State Kissinger, arguing that taps on their telephones were placed unconstitutionally. One suit was later withdrawn.

title: MAURICE BOWER SAUL
description: Maurice Bower Saul, who had been a lawyer in Philadelphia from 1905 until his retirement in 1970, died Monday evening at his home in Rose Valley, Pa. He was 90 years old.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Chess: Denmark and Panama Add To U.S. Team's High Score
description: NICE, June 11  Cleansweep victories over Denmark and Panama enabled the United States team to take over the lead in its qualifying section of the International Team Tournament here in the Palais des Expositions.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Dave Anderson
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., June 12Are you staying with friends here, like you do the week of the Westchester Classic? somebody asked Gary Player.

title: Field of 150 to Tee Off in Open Today
Brief St. Clair Offered to Panel Said to Bar a CoverUp Charge
description: CHICAGO, June 12 (UPI)James D. St.. Clair, President Nixon's Watergate lawyer, in legal brief he attempted to present to the House Judiciary Committee, argued that Mr. Nixon could not be impeached for taking part in the Watergate coverup, if he in fact did, The Chicago Tribune reported today.

title: U.S. Adds to Refugee Aid
description: GENEVA, June 12  The United States contributed $400,000 today to the United Nations program for assisting the. repatriation of Bengalis and Pakistanis trapped by the 1971 war between India and Pakistan and, by Bangladesh's gaining Of independence, The cnntribution raised to $4,55million the total given by the United States for the program.

title: People and Business
description: Bernard Clappier, a French banker and president of Credit National, a Governmentcontrolled credit institution, was appointed governor of the Bank of France yesterday. He succeeds Olivier Wormser, who has held the post for the last five years and who was entangled in a policy dispute with the new French President Valry Giscard d'Estaing.

title: Star of The Magic Show Transforms Act Into Art
description: If the paragraphs are misplaced and the lines are pied in this account, the blame could easily be traced to the long fingers of young Doug Henning, who has been putting things where they should not be at the Cort Theater.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE GULAG ARCHIPELAGO, 19181956. An Experiment in Literary Investigation. III. By Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn. Translated from the Russian by Thomas P. Whitney. 660 pages. Illustrated. Harper & Row. Cloth, $12.50; paper, $1.95.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: Solarz Seeks Podell's Seat
description: Assemblyman Stephen J. Solarz announced yesterday that he would run in the Democratic primary for the Brooklyn Congressional seat now held by Bertram L. Podell, who is under Federal indictment on charges of influence peddling. Mr. Solarz, 32 years old, was elected from Brooklyn's 45th Assembly District in 1968, A year ago, he ran second in a threeway primary race for Brooklyn Borough President, losing to the incumbent, Sebastian Leone.

title: Low Profile: Harold Wilson's First 100 Days
description: LONDON, June 12  When Harold Wilson stood outside 10 Downing Street 100 days ago yesterday, he told the television audience in a brief statement that he was going right in to tackle the nation's problems. Since then, the British public has seen very little of the Prime Minister. What many are calling an almost invisible profile has been a deliberate decision. Apart from some speeches at political meetings, Mr. Wilson has made only three brief television appearances, given no news conferences, turned down all requests that he meet privately with reporters and per mitted only one radio interview.

title: Committee Backing for Samuels Likely
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N. Y., June 12Backed by the state's top Democratic leaders, Howard J. Samuels today appeared assured of at least 70 per cent of the Democratic State Committee vote while his only challenger, Representative Hugh L. Carey of Brooklyn, fought to capture at least the 25 per cent of the vote needed to force a primary fight over the Democratic gubernatorial nomination.

title: Braves Down Mets by 10 As Morton Beats Parker
description: ATLANTA, June I2Harry Parker, the Mets' taciturn righthander, may soon be doing more talking. Tonight, he lost his second 10 decision in a row, a squeaker decided in the eighth inning.

title: National Ballet Suspends Activities
description: The announcement from Washington yesterday that the National Ballet was to suspend its activities indefinitely and was immediately releasing its dancers and staff caused no surprise in American dance circles.

title: Special Panel Will Meet In Newark Taxi Dispute
description: NEWARK, June 12A special taxicab committee of the City Council is scheduled to meet tomorrow morning with taxicab owners and some drivers in an effort to resolve the eightday strike after a tentative settlement was voted down last night ly more than 300 cabbies.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: M.T.A. Seeking $33Million From U.S. for City Transit;
description: Taking advantage of new Federal regulations, the Metropolitan Transportation Authority has applied to Washington for a $33million grant to pay 70 per cent of the cost of 398 new airconditioned buses plus other transit improvements here. The buses alone would cost $17.2million.

title: A.K.C. Opens Its Doors For Women Delegates
description: After 90 years it has come to pass. Since its founding, in 1884, the American Kennel Club, as stated in its constitution, had only male delegates. But last Tuesday at its quarterly meeting the A. K. C. unanimously approved Mrs. Julie Gasow of Troy, Mich.; Mrs. Carol Duffy of Stanfordville, N. Y., and Mrs. Gertrude Freedman of Boxford, Mass., as delegates. Thirteen men also were voted upon favorably.

title: PLAN FOR CENTER HELD DECEPTIVE
description: A key opponent of the $200million convention center proposed for Manhattan's West Side charged yesterday that the center eventually would, be much largerand a much larger environmental problem in the crowded citythan the plans made public indicated.

title: Workers Cross Picket Line
description: PITTSBURGH, June 12 (UPI) Members of the United Automobile Workers, responding to an order by Leonard Woodcock, the union's president, crossed a teamsters' picket line without incident today and returned to work at the General Motors Corporation's Fisher body plant in nearby West Mifflin after being idled two days. Mr. Woodcock told the 1,200 members of Local 544 that the U.A.W. no longer has a reciprical agreement with the International Brotherhood of Teamsters.

title: G.O.P. Doldrums
description: Deprived of the drama that former Governor Rockefeller rarely failed to generate, this year's G.O.P. rally reflected the temper of the party's new state leader, Gov. Malcolm Wilson  wellorganized, controversyshy and colorless. The closest thing to a surprise was Mr. Wilson's last  minute preselection of another downstate suburbanite, Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso, to be his running mate. That choice has a certain logic nevertheless, because of Mr. Caso's impressive votegetting record in Nassau County, the nation's largest suburban county. New York Republicans are placing high hopes on wooing the suburban voter.

title: DEL BELLO OFFERS A CONSUMER PLAN
description: WHITE PLAINS, June 12 County Executive Alfred B. Del Bello unveiled an ambitious new consumer affairs program today, parts of intended to solve problems prevalent in the suburbs.

title: School District 2 Decides to Replace Its Superintendent
description: The school board of District 2 has voted in executive session not to renew the contract of Rhoda Lansky, the, district's school superintendent, and to replace her with the district's present deputy superintendent, Dr. Barbara Weldon.

title: Port Unit Expected to Postpone Newark Airport's Terminal C
description: NEWARK, June 12  The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey plans to postpone for three years the completion of one of the three new terminals at Newark International Airport because of what officials describe as the very severe financial straits of the airlines.

title: Ruffian Equals Mark, in Her Fashion
description: A filly that drew superlatives before, during and after the running of the $27,850 Fashion Stakes contributed a most impressive performance at Belmont Park yesterday.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time

title: Judge Decides Ehrlichman Can Be Tried With Others
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 In a surprise move, Federal District Judge Gerhard A. Gesell reversed himself today and said that he would let John D. Ehrlichman stand trial with three other men in the White House plumbers case.

title: NEW ZEALAND CHIDES PARIS ON ATEST PLAN
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, June 12New Zealand has protested to the French Government over its decision to hold further nuclear tests in the South Pacific and will seek to have the International Court of Justice forbid them.

title: Meskill Forms Regional System And Commits State to Aid Buses
description: HARTFORD, June 12Gov. Thomas J. Meskill today formed a system of regional management of public trans portation in Connecticut and committed the state to subsidize a basic level of service.

title: Stock Prices Drop Amid Rate Doubts
description: Fresh doubts over the prospects of lower interest rate sent the stock market down yesterday in sluggish trading.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Connecticut Lifts Gas Curb
description: HARTFORD, June 12 (AP)Beginning Friday, the 23 service stations on the Connecticut Turnpike and Merritt and Wilbur Cross Parkways will resume selling gasoline 24 hours per day, seven days a week, Transportation Commissioner Joseph Burns said today. If the demand exceeds supplies, he said, limits will be imposed on individual sales.

title: $8Million U.S. Home Suit Filed Against Ernst & Ernst
description: The U. S. Home Corporation has filed a suit seeking $8million in damages from the accounting firm of Ernst & Ernst charging the firm with negligently auditing the books and records of the 3H Building Corporation, according to filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Best Defense at World Cup Is Off the Field
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, June 12If Brazil and Yugoslavia open the 10th World Cup soccer tournament tomorrow with defenses as stern and unyielding as the security that will be surrounding them, nobody might ever score.

title: Copier Rescues Two 800 Miles into Pacific
description: SAN DIEGO, June 12 (AP) An H3 helicopter, refueled five times in flight, ventured 800 miles into the Pacific to rescue two seriously injured crewmen off the tuna clipper Proud Heritage the Air Force announced early today.

title: Bank in Foreign Venture
description: LONDON, June 12 (Reuters) Midlantic National Bank of New Jersey said today it has opened a representative office in London to contact and advise British and European companies planning new or expanded investments in the United States.

title: Tuesday's Fights
description: Sacramento, Calif.  Joe Guevara, 121 pounds, Sacramento, knocked out Lorenzo Malvonado, 123, Mexico, 5 rounds.

title: Recital: A Gifted Cellist
description: Given the rate at which talented cellists have been emerging within the past few years, the nineteenseventies may someday be identified in cello history as the decade of the talent explosion.

title: Cyclops Corp. Raises Prices For HighTemperature Alloys
description: The Cyclops Corporation became the second steel maker to raise prices this week. The company's UniversalCyclops Specialty Steel division said it was raising prices for hightemperature alloys in bar and forging billet forms by 5 to 17 per cent, effective yesterday. Syclops said the increases follow patterns set by competitors and added that it planned to announce price rises for sheet and strip forms of hightemperature alloys at an early date.

title: DOUGLAS E. BAILEY
description: WATCHUNG, N. J., June 12 (AP)Douglas E. Bailey, subur. ban editor of The Daily Journal of Elizabeth, died today at his home here, apparently of heart attack. He was 70 years old.

title: Cheering Cairo Throngs Greet Nixon
description: CAIRO, June 12  Great crowds of Egyptians cheered President Nixon with unreserved enthusiasm today when he arrived on the first stop of his tour of the Middle East.

title: House Backs Observatory Site For Vice President's Residence
description: WASHINGTON, June 12 The House of Representatives voted today to give the Vice resident an official residence an 81yearold house at the Naval Observatory in North west Washington that has served as the home for the Chief of Naval Operations for the last 40 years.

title: Bridge:
description: Almost all good players would agree that the fairest and most satisfying form of competition is the knockoutteam event. Many such contests in the Metropolitan area are spread over a long period of nine months or more.

title: JURY CLEARS SHEA IN KILLING OF BOY
description: Police Officer Thomas J. Shea was acquitted yesterday of murder in State Supreme Court, Queens, in the shooting death of 10yearold Clifford Glover.

title: Alabama's Law on Ethics Brings Threats to Resign
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., June 12 (UPI)  Alabama's ethics law, called the toughest in the nation by Gov. George C. Wallace, is in danger of being rendered impotent.

title: Politics Is Not Dirty, Mrs. Gaggenheimer Tells Class at York
description: Elinor C. Guggenheimer, the city's Commissioner of Consumer Affairs, yesterday told 337 graduates of York Collage of the City University of New York that politics isn't a dirty business.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, June 13 (AP)  The Securities and Exchange Commission limited today the stocks for which last sale data must be reported under the commission's consolidated tape plan.

title: PROGRESSIVES WIN SOUTH AFRICA VOTE
description: CAPE TOWN, June 13An election victory by the liberal. Progressive party in a byelection near here is expected to have profound effects on the Parliamentary opposition in South Africa.
