Holmgren performed the cermony in the nondenominational Chapel of the Prince of Peace. The parents of the couple are Mr. and Mrs. John MacMillan Wilson of Maplewood, N. J. and Mr. and Mrs. Lionel Augustus Darrow of Longmont, Colo.

title: News of the Camera World
description: FOR those interested in combining a vacation with photographic studies the Latent Image Studio in Watch Hill, R.I., is offering twoweek shootingandcritique sessions which will meet five mornings a week. Sessions will include field trips to nearby Mystic Seaport, Galilee and other nearby points of scenic and historic interest, and the cost will be $100, which includes processing. Accommodations can be arranged in surrounding seaside resorts. For information write: Latent Image Studio, OntheBay, Watch Hill, R.I. 02891.

title: Minnesota G.O.P. Votes Against Rights Proposal
description: DULUTH, Minn., June 22 (AP)The Minnesota Republican Convention today chose an allmale slate of eandidates for state offices, then adopted a platform plank that called for the State Legislature to rescind its approval of the proposed equal rights amendment.

title: Portugal Orders Severe Curbs on News
description: LISBON, June 22The new Portuguese Government, faced with a continuing war in Africa and a faltering economy, today published severe restrictions on all news media.

title: Delivery of Some Stampless Letters Brings Warning to Postal Employes
description: Postal Service officials are warning employes about mailers' attempts to send letters without stamps  a criminal offense that could cost defrauders up to $300 each time.

title: Moon Pots' Rate High With Artist
description: CLINTON Toshiko Takaezu, a potter, weaver and painter, lives upstairs and downstairs at the Clinton Music Hall. During intermission, strolling theatergoers sometimes find themselves in the artist's studio, which is tucked under the stage; her apartment is upstairs, over the balcony.

title: Home Improvement
description: In an effort to catch up on the backlog of unanswered questions, most of the Home Improvement Column this week is being devoted Questions and Answers. Many of these letters pose questions that are similar to those asked by other readers whose actual letters may not published here, but who, nevertheless, will find their answers below. Readers sending in questions about home repair problems should address them to: Home Improvement Department, The New York Times, Times Square, New York, N.Y. 10036. BERNARD GLADSTONE

title: Grace D. Jackson Plans Bridal
description: Lieut. Col. Charles Worrell Jackson, U.S.A.F., retired, and Mrs. Jackson of Belchertown, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Grace Davies Jackson, to Jonathan David Scott, son of Mr. and Mrs. Isadore M. Scott of Meadowbrook, Pa.

title: Wrestling L.I.Bound
description: Bruno Sammartino will oppose Nikolai Volkoff when professional wrestling exhibitions return to the Nassau Coliseum July 1. In a tagteam performance, John and Jimmy Valiant will face Larry Zbyszko and Haystacks Calhoun.

title: WHALER UNFURLS SAILS AT MYSTIC
description: MYSTIC, Conn., June 22The Charles W. Morgan, the last of the wooden ships that hunted the whale and carved out a legendary niche for themselves in American history, was rededicated here today after five years of painstaking restoration.

title: Jonathan Hertz to Wed Miss Sampliner
description: Mr. and Mrs. Malcolm L., Sampliner of Merrick, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marjorie Lynn Sampliner, to Jonathan Hertz, son of Mr. and Mrs. Hamilton Hertz, also of Merrick.

title: The House of Many Woes...
description: EAST BRUNSWICKThree years ago, Marion Thomas lived in one of the most attractive homes in the area.

title: Snoring: Is the Cure Worth the Pain?
description: NgcaWwwwwwwww . . . wheooooo. Ngcawwwwwwwww. . . wheooooo. Those are the sounds of snoring, a habit that affects 35 million Americans and has keen known to cause' chaos in college dormitories, havoc in military barracks, and splitsville in once blissful marriages.

title: A Connoisseur's Summer Theater Guide
description: DESPITE the prevalence on the straw hat circuit of slightly tired touring packages of old Broadway shows like No, No, Nanette and Butterflies Are Freewhich must be granted their popular appealsummer theater has a few offerings this season which promise to be unusually rewarding for the theatergoer in search of the stimulating.

title: Encounter: A Healthy, Democratic Mugging in Colombia
description: WALLS surround the city of Cartagena. From the 16th to the 19th century, the construction of fortifications never ceased; some of the ancient forts still remain. The Spanish conquerors had a proper sense of their danger, and this jewel of their colonial civilization was intended to provide a feeling of security.

title: How to Hit From the Sand: High, Short and Soft
description: It is often said the sand shot is the easiest shot in golf. That is a lot of bunkas in bunkerand whoever said it first should be made to cross the Mojave Desert with nothing but a themos of water, a tube of suntan oil and a sand wedge.

title: Mexico Relaxes Controls on the Press
description: MEXICO CITYMost Tuesdays, the Finance Ministry is annoyed by a critical column in the daily newspaper Excelsior. Each Thursday, the Interior Ministry is irritated by the publication of an extreme leftist magazine, Por Qu? Every day, the press carries some detail of terrorist activity or of corruption that the Government would prefer to keep quiet.

title: Nixon's BlueCollar Backers Are Angry and Disillusioned
description: WARREN, Mich.  Bob Vavro, a 45yearold welder whose generous Slavic features hint strongly at his heritage, is a genuine American original, bluecollar style.

title: State Police Switch Handguns To More Powerful 357 Magnum
description: The New York State police are switching to a more powerful weapon, the 357 magnum, gradually phasing out the 38caliber police, special, which has been the trooper's official handgun in the state for nearly 25 years.

title: KISSINGER DENIES SECRET ARMS DEAL
description: WASHINGTON, JUNE 22Secretary of State Kissinger today described as totally without merit or any foundation whatsoever allegations that he had made at least two secret arrangements with Soviet leaders in 1972 on the number of strategic nuclearmissile launchers permitted by an arms agreement reached that year.

title: That Rarest of Birds, a Successful Political Movie
description: LOVE and Anarchy, the current Italian movie about a young farmeranarchist who sets out to assassinate Mussolini, was generally well received, but I want to write about one scarcely mentioned aspect only: the film's politics. I want to single out this movie as one of the very few totally successful radical political films. If I weren't afraid of unqualified statements, I would write: the very first one.

title: Numismatics
description: THE 18th annual Metropolitan politan N.X. Numismatic Convention opens at 1 P.M. this Thursday, June 27, in the Barbizon Plaza Hotel, 101 West 58th Street, just off Central Park South. It will run through Sunday and there is no admission charge. This is the last of the big coin shows for collectors in this area until late next fall, except, of course, for those who will be attending the American Numismatic Association's giant convention in Bal Harbour, Fla., in mid August.

title: RAID INTO LEBANON BY ISRAEL FEARED
description: CAIRO, June 22Four days after President Nixon's triumphal peace tour, Arab diplomats and officials here expressed concern today that Israel might send troops into southern Lebanon in the wake of Israeli air strikes against Palestinian bases.

title: U. S. Soviet Trade Progress: So Far So Good
description: As President Nixon heads for Moscow this week, some economic questions arise from his visit there two years ago.

title: Hofstra to Offer Free Legal Aid on Taxes
description: HEMPSTEAD  The middleincome businessmen and workers, so frequently forgotten when economics are concerned, may get a taxbreak under a program being developed by the Hofstra University Law School.

title: Gibson Basking in New Political Image in Newark
description: NEWARK  This city's Mayoral and Council elections, completed in two parts on May 14 and in a runoff last Tuesday, have given Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson new political image and effectively ended the Cty Hall influence once exerted by Imamu Amiri Baraka, the black nationalist.

title: Irked Foreman Rips Ali's Suit at Dinner
description: George Foreman, world heavyweight champion, and Muhammad Ali, who will challenge for the title on Sept. 25, became involved in a scuffling match last night as the New York Boxing Writers' Association dinner drew to a close at the Waldorf Astoria.

title: Phone Rate Rise Rejected
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., June 22 (AP)The New England Telephone Company request for a 17 per cent temporary rate increase for Vermont customers was unanimously rejected yesterday by the State Public Service Board.

title: The kidnapping
description: In their novel, Rosebud, Joan Hemingway (Papa's granddaughter) and Paul Bonnecarrre deal with the kidnapping of five heiresses of the movers and shakers of the world, including a wealthy Irish U.S. Senator who, has the pole position for the Presidency. The book has a nice quirky beginning. Two members of the infamous Black September hijack a German commercial airliner and hold its passengers and crew hostage, asking for the return of the three surviving Palestinian prisoners from the 1972 Munich Olympics massacre. The offbeat touch is that the kidnapping is a sham. The skyjackers are the unwitting dupes of their own movement (their weapons have blank cartridges) and the German government.

title: Missy McHugh, Luis Rinaldini Have Nuptials
description: Miss Elaine Nash McHugh, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Nevin McHugh of Larchmont, N.Y., was married yesterday afternoon to Luis Emil Rinaldini, son of Dr. and Mrs. Luis Maria Rinaldini of Mendoza and Maipu, Argentina.

title: MAYORS HOLD U.S LACKS LEADERSHIP
description: SAN DIEGO, June 22City, officials, opening their annual convention here today, charged that the Federal Government was not functioning because of impeachment politics.

title: Pharmacists Warn on Stock in Cabinets
description: TRENTON  The onset of summer should signalize an updating of the bathroom medicine cabinet, the New Jersey Pharmaceutical Association suggests.

title: 3 Republicans Seek Nomination To Challenge Ribicoff This Fall
description: HARTFORD, June 22Three Connecticut Republicans are already in the running for their party's nomination to challenge Democratic Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff this fall. Party strategists say the race could have a major impact on their chances in the guberrnatorial campaign, with a strong Senate candidate adding luster to the whole ticket.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Giants Open SeasonTicket Sales

title: Television/Radio
description: SUMMER has a nasty, habit of bringing out the worst in television. Preoccupied with demographic machinations for next season's schedule, network executives take to wining and dining any available and willing members of the press, eagerly arranging anything from elaborate junkets on the West Coast to exclusive telephone interviews with the character actor destined to be next year's superstar.

title: Cook College Offers Course on Outdoors
description: NEW BRUNSWICKAs a supplement to classroom instruction, teachers can learn how to use natural resources and the outdoors in a course to be offered by Rutgers University from tomorrow through July 12.

title: Photography There Is Something Missing Here
description: I HAVE to confess that do not entirely understand the principle of selection governing the Robert Schoelkopf Gallery's large and somewhat disappointing current exhibition, The Art of the Portrait Photograph (through July 19).

title: Court Backs City On Pierrepont
description: The city's revocation of a building permit, which has stalled developers' plans to convert the 480bed Pierrepont Hotel in Brooklyn Heights into a proprietary home for the aged, was upheld in State Supreme Court last week.

title: Strange Is Victor In N.C.A.A. Golf
description: SANTEE, Calif., June 22 (AP)A Wake Forest freshman, Curtis Strange; eagled the final hole with a 7foot putt today for a onestroke victory in the 77th annual National Collegiate Athletic Association golf championship.

title: 23 Cakes of Sorcery
description: I WAS once detained at Customs. I was, in fact, invited into a little office and searched with some care by a woman officer. Then my bags were brought in and they took out the 23 cakes of soap I had carefully listed on my customs declaration. They placed the cakes on a desk and studied them. Why had I chosen to bring back so much soap of so many different kinds? I said that I liked soap. They scooped my cakes of soap into a wire basket and went off with them. Finally they brought them back. It is just soap, they said. You may go now.

title: Letters: Hunt the Hunters
description: To the Editor:

title: Nixon, Here & There
description: President Nixon flies to Moscow this week to meet for the tnirn time witn Leonid Brezhnev. The conference is unlikely to produce much of substance toward settlement of EastWest differences, but both sides believe there are gains to be made from the fact of the meeting itself.

title: Lawyer to Wed Janet McWilliams
description: Miss Janet Marie McWilliams, a freelance writer in Denver, and John Foster Meck 3d, a lawyer with the Davis, Graham & Stubbs law firm in Denver, will be married Aug. 17 in that city.

title: In Holland, a Police Conflict
description: HOLLAND TOWNSHIP Seven years ago, this Hunterdon County township, once principally a farming community, hired its first fulltime policeman and had an annual police budget of $9,000. The township, which lies along the Delaware River, covers 22 square miles, an area smaller than Manhattan.

title: Chess Affiliation Is Asked
description: NICE, France, June 22 (Agence FrancePresse)China and Egypt have asked to become members of the International Chess Federation. Their affiliation will be decided during the federation's congress to be held during the current 21st Chess Olympiad here. Admittance of these two countries would raise the federation's membership to 88 countries.

title: DIRECTIVE ALTERS A FIGHT IN BOSTON
description: BOSTON, June 22  The Federal District Court ruling yesterday that Boston has deliberately maintained unconstitutionally segregated schools appears to have swept away months of political posturing here over the issue of busing.

title: Just Who's In Charge of Economic Policy?
description: The President Has Other Things on His Mind

title: Whitlinger Wins N.C.A.A. Crown
description: LOS ANGELES, June 22 (AP)John Whitlinger, scoring with his twofisted backhand and his volley, defeated Chico Hagey 16, 63, 63, 6.1, in an allStanford final of the National Collegiate tennis championship today.

title: Rubbings From Tombstones
description: A group sponsored by the Queens Historical Society gathered in a churchyard off Jamaica Avenue last week to pursue a hobby usually associated with English cathedrals or New England, graveyards. The dozen men, women and children had come to Grace Episcopal Church, just off Parsons Boulevard, to prepare tombstone rubbings.

title: 43 DISSIDENTS GET PASTORAL OFFERS
description: ST. LOUIS, June 22About onethird of the graduates of the dissident Lutheran seminary in exile, which calls itself Seminex, have been offered pastoral positions in Congregations of the Lutheran ChurchMissouri Synod.

title: Marjorie Anderson Harrison Married to Vincent Webb Jr.
description: Miss Marjorle Anderson Harrison, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David Alexander Harrison 3d of Old Brookville, L. I., and Hopewell, Va., was married yesterday afternoon to Vincent Cosmas Webb Jr., son of Dr. and Mrs. Webb of Glen Cove, L. I.

title: AL GREEN NO HERO TO APOLLO CROWD
description: For the last three years, Al Green has been the most successful soul and rhythm and blues singer in the business, with a steady stream of millionselling singles, albums that do nearly as well and a torrent of adulation from the black and white press. But his most recent couple of singles have shown a slight falling off in sales, and his performance at the early show Friday night at the Apollo Theaterwhere he will be playing through Thursdaywas a long way from an unqualified success.

title: Tracking down a predatory prey
description: Mark Smith, who published two relatively unnoticed novels during the 1960's, has now written one remarkable for both its ambition and its accomplishment. It is 596 pages long, and every one of them is a pleasure to read. It is full, rich and deepa complete success.

title: The Cafe That Gave Us CheeChee and Boogieboogie, too
description: SHORTLY after the opening of the jazzandpoliticalcomedy cabaret, Cafe Society, in Greenwich Village in December, 1938, two midtown clipjoint operators went downtown to check on this new nightspot. When they left, they were shaking their heads in amazement.

title: Anne Steele Married
description: Miss Anne Steele, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward C. Steele of Fredonia, N. Y., was married yesterday afternoon to Bruce Jenkins, Skinner, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Skinner of Fort Wayne, Ind. The Rev. James A. Walter performed the ceremony in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church in Dunkirk N. Y.

title: Smith Defeats Metreveli In Erratic Final on Grass
description: NOTTINGHAM, England, June 22Stan Smith raised his confidence for Wimbledon today by winning the $100,000 John Player grass tennis tournament.

title: Peking Posters Assail Factory Chiefs
description: HONG KONG, June 22The latest big character posters to be pasted up on walls in Peking are singling out factory managers as targets, accusing them of suppressing the workers and stifling criticism.

title: Trade
description: The American Telephone & Telegraph Co., through a subsidiary, the 195 Broadway Corporation, has leased 115,000 square feet in the new 10story office building known as 1776ontheGreen in Morristown, N.J.

title: Detente Is Not Paradise
description: MOSCOWIt made splash headlines almost everywhere else and produced photos of cheering crowds. But here in Moscow President Nixon's tour of the Middle East sometimes got only a single paragraph on the inside pages. On other days, when it merited a bit more space, it was stripped of emotion and the cheers. The note of triumph was carefully sifted out.

title: HANOI SAYS VIETCONG WILL SUSPEND TALKS
description: HONG KONG, Sunday, June 23 (Reuters)The Vietcong will suspend military talks with South Vietnam designed to carry out the Paris peace agreement, the North Vietnam press agency reported today.

title: Ideas &Trends
description: The cancellation of nine of the 21 New York State high school Regents examinations, following the theft and sale of answer sheets, has led to a renewed demand that the tests be abolished as unnecessary.

title: Productivity Plan Hailed in Nassau
description: MINEOLANassau's 23,000 county and town civil servants are working smarter, not harder, these days in an experimental program supported by labor and management to improve productivity.

title: Impeachment: It Is a Factor in the Annual Meeting
description: MOSCOWThere is an inevitable and perhaps deceptive air of anticlimax about the 1974 meeting between President Nixon and Leonid Brezhnev. cannot promise the kind of dramatic turn in SovietAmerican relations produced by Richard Nixon's journey to Moscow via Peking of two years ago. Nor the curiosity of Mr. Brezhnev getting acquainted with a bit of America last year while the public took his measure on TV.

title: Kissinger And the Joint Chiefs
description: WASHINGTON, June 22Almost on the eve of the NixonBrezhnev summit meeting in Moscow, the Nixon Administration is still deeply divided on what kind of arrangements it should make with the Soviet Union for the control of strategic weapons.

title: Two Slain Gangland Style in Brooklyn
description: Two men who the police said were soldiers in the Mafia family of Joseph A. Colombo Sr. were slain gangland style by shotgun blasts in the back early yesterday in the Bensonhurst section of Brooklyn.

title: Food: Summer soups
description: Cold soups were a rarity in this country until the late Louis Diat came up with vichysoisse in kitchen of the RitzCarlton Hotel about three decades ago. Today, cold soups of all persuasions help make sultry summers palatable. Three extraordinarily good ones are offered below.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Daylight Saving Time

title: Drivers Concerned About Safety Features at Dutch Grand Prix
description: ZANDVOORT, the Netherlands, June 22The Ferraris dominated practice today, but the story at the Dutch Grand Prix, as usual, was safetyor the lack thereof.

title: New Head of Jewish Philanthropies
description: The election of Frederick P. Rose, president of the realestate firm of Rose Associates, as the 22d president of the Federation of Jewish Philanthropies of New York, was announced yesterday at the organization's headquarters, 130 East 59th Street.

title: Arts
description: FOR many of the great French painters of the 19th century, the official Salonthe annual exhibition of new paintings sponsored by the statewas a scene of tragedy, frustration and humiliation. Year after year, the best new paintingor what, at least, posterity now regards as the bestmet with derision and rejection at the hands of the conservative jurors, while the work of facile talents conforming to established taste won acceptance, patronage and acclaim.

title: Candace Marion Perkins Married
description: Miss Candace Marion Perkins, daughter of Mrs. Richard Alden Perkins of Pelham Manor, N. Y., and the late Mr. Perkins, was married yesterday afternoon to William Francis O'Connor 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. O'Connor Jr. of Lewiston, N. Y.

title: 170 Graduate From State's College Without Walls
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I.Twentythree years after she last stepped inside a college classroom, Rita Berg has received her bachelor's degree.

title: Bare Facts Are Problem At World Cup Soccer Site
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, June 22  Dortmund's city fathers have a problem. All World Cup games here have been held at night, but tomorrow's game between the Netherlands and Bulgaria is a day game. The problem is that part of the stands of the stadium directly overlook a nudist camp. The nudists decided to do what every visitor has been doing since the World Cup startedthat is, ask for protection.

title: Wayne Eden, $36.60, Wins Realization Trot
description: WESTBURY, L. I., June 22 Although doubleteamed by an entry with the formidable names of MacArthur and South Bend, Wayne Eden scored a major upset tonight in capturing the $141,562.50 Realization Trot at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Ft. Greene Group Sues City
description: A State Supreme Court judge has ordered the city to show cause why it should not be enjoined from spending $250,000 to study the feasibility of constructing a sports arena and a bus terminal in the Brooklyn Atlantic Terminal Urban Renewal Area.

title: Pamela Prizer Denver Bride
description: The Whatley Chapel at Colorado Woman's College in Denver was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Miss Pamela Anne Prizer, to Craig Joseph Chernick. The Rev. Martin Schroeder, pastor of the Bethany Lutheran Church in Denver, performed the ceremony.

title: Marilyn Wiley Wed To Bryan Anthony
description: Miss Marilyn Wiley, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Adolph J. Wiley of Westbury, L.L, was married at noon yesterday to J. Bryan Anthony, son of Mr. and Mrs. S. Reed Anthony of Old Brookville, L. I.

title: West Siders Assail New Highway Plan; Want Quick Repair
description: A dozen West Side politicians and 175 community residents staged a rally in Riverside Park yesterday to press their campaign for an early reopening of the West Side Highway.

title: UNION SETTING UP LEGAL AID SERVICE
description: A longtime member of District Council 37 of the State, County and Municipal Employes wants to gain custody of her grandchild, now living with his widowed mother who is a drug addict. The grandmother needs legal help, she told her union.

title: Miss Bartlett Leber Wed to Bruce Hyde
description: Miss Bartlett Fenton Leber, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Charles Leber 2d of Blauvelt, N.Y., was married yesterday afternoon to Bruce Geoffrey Hyde, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edwin Yetter Hyde of Btlrlington, Vt. The Rev. Charles R. Greene performed the ceremony in Grace Episcopal Church in Nyack, N.Y.

title: Israeli Scientists Develop A Method to Identify Gems
description: REHOVOT, Israel, June 22 (Reuters)  Israeli scientists have developed a device to fingerprint precious gems for easy idenitfication, the Weizsnann Institute of Science announced here.

title: News Analysis
description: In the nineteenforties it was rent control. In 1971 it was vacancy decontrol. And now, courtesy of the State Legislature, the city is in line for vacancy stabilization. Is everyone happy? Not a bit.

title: Fluoridation in Boston Area
description: BOSTON, June 22 (AP)The Massachusetts House has approved a bill to provide for fluoridation of the water supply for the 33 cities and towns in the Boston Metropolitan Water District. The legislation, passed without debate, was sent to the Senate for action.

title: Back to the City
description: More than half the country's retail business is now being done in shopping centers outside the city limits. In the smaller cities, Main Streets increasingly resemble ghost towns, and in the larger cities, these outlying commercial and recreational complexes have been a conspicuous contributing factor to central business district decline. They replace the attractions of downtown and weaken its economic base. They also replace woods and fields with brick and asphalt.

title: HOWARD LILIENTHAL
description: Howard Lilienthal, a partner, in the law firm of Freedman & Lilienthal and director of Camp Winnebago, a summer camp in Fayette, Me., died yesterday of cancer at his home, 60 East 96th Street. He was 64 years old.

title: Dressage Unit Disbands Upstate Training Facilities
description: The American Dressage Institute is undergoing a major change in philosophy and direction with the result that its physical facilities in Saratoga Springs, N.Y., have been disbanded.

title: Criminals At Large
description: For a tough. American piece of writing, FIFTYTWO PICKUP by Elmore Leonard (Delacorte, $6.95) is recommended. It is about a smallbusiness man hit by a trio of blackmailers. He has been indiscreet, and they have the photos. They are as vicious a trio as any big city (Detroit, in this case) can spawn. But they have picked the wrong man, and he fights back. Leonard is a very good writer; he manages to get into his characters and build a believable situation. The dialogue reads in a natural manner, and is certainly tough enough, yet there is an agreeable avoidance of fourletter words, proving that profanity and toughness do not necessarily have to together.

title: 1914 and Today's Trade Crisis
description: Henry A. Kissinger recalled, in a recent speech, the apparently not very severe crisis of July, 1914, when the leaders of Europe looked unseeingly at the coming end of their civilization as they knew it. Mr. Kissinger's speech is most celebrated for his remarks about the tenuous legitimacy of subsequent European governments. Yet the memory of 1914 may have a wider significance for the present crisis of trade and resources. Certain economic fears and hopes of the years before the First World War are now disturbingly familiaras much so, perhaps, as the fears of the nineteenthirties, whose memory Mr. Kissinger, and others, have also recalled.

title: Odetta Rhythms Warm Soviet Listeners
description: MOSCOW, June 19A woman alone on stage is rare entertainment in the Soviet Union, a country that likes to buttress its performers with sometimes formidable supporting ensembles.

title: Beam Aides Split on Retaining Rand
description: Exceptionally vigorous lobbying by friends of a think tank that was formed with some flourish by former Mayor John V. Lindsay has fomented an unusual split at the top level of the Beame administration.

title: David Freeman Fiance Of Ellen B. Gogolick
description: Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Gogolick of Shaker Heights, Ohio, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss. Ellen Beth Gogolick, to David John Freeman, son of Mr. and Mrs. John L. Freeman of Rye, N.Y. A December wedding is planned.

title: AMER. SOCCER LEAGUE LAST NIGHT'S GAME
description: Conecticul O, Boston O.

title: SECRET PANEL DATA HELD PERIL TO NIXON
description: HARTFORD, June 22 (AP)Representative John Conyers Jr., Democrat of Michigan, member of the House Judiciary Committee, says the panel has heard evidence of numerous impeachable offenses by President Nixon that has not been made public.

title: Francis and Murphy Gain L.I. Amateur Golf Final
description: PLANDOME, L. I., June 22 Since golfers never turn down assistance from Lady Luck, Gene Francis, the defending champion, readily accepted her help on the 16th and last hole of his semifinal match today in the 53d annual Long Island, amateur championship at Plandome Country Club.

title: Arts Center for Jamaica
description: It will take a while before the old, noisy, lightblocking elevated subway is torn down over Jamaica Avenue in Queens, but until the el is removed a new project promises to brighten the area with the performing and visual arts.

title: Andrew David Laidlaw Weds Augusta Wilberding in Vermont
description: Miss Augusta Wilberding, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph C. Wilberding of Mount Kisco, N.Y., was married in Jonesville, Vt., yesterday afternoon to Andrew David Laidlaw, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ralph R. Laidlaw of Cazenovia, N.Y.

title: Sunday Observer
description: A mother whale and a father whale were swimming along the coast with their adolescent son whale when the mother sighted a school of people on the beach.

title: West Caldwell Resents County Draining of Tax Funds
description: WEST CALDWELL  Although this Essex County borough lies just a few miles from urban centers and urban problems, its residents contend that theirs is a friendly and countrylike community. Ironically, the only major complaint that most people in West Caldwell have with their town is that taxes are too high, a situation they attribute to the contribution they must make to welfare payments in other parts of the county.

title: Connecticut U.S. Attorney
description: HARTFORD, June 22 (AP)The Chief United States District Court Judge, T. Emmet Clarie, has appointed James Pickerstein Interim United States Attorney for Connecticut until the United States Senate confirms a successor to Stewart Jones, who resigned the post today.

description: Tickets to the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Suffolk May Drop Suit Against Bank
description: RIVERHEAD  Suffolk County may have to drop its plans to sue the Franklin National Bank to recover $7,000 that the county says the bank owes it from nowdiscontinued welfare account, according to authoritative sources.

title: Ervin Staff Says Mitchell Bypassed Aides on Hughes
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 John N. Mitchell, as Attorney General, bypassed the Justice Department's Antitrust Division four years ago in giving the Howard R. Hughes organization approval to purchase a casinohotel in Las Vegas, Nev., according to evidence gathered for the Senate Watergate committee.

title: Safety Panel Will Enforce Federal Fireworks Laws
description: WASHINGTON, June 22 (AP) The Consumer Product Safety Commission has warned fireworks dealers that it will vigorously enforce existing Federal bans on supersize firecrackers, even though far stiffer regulations have been temporarily delayed.

title: Synagogues on Wheels Explain Orthodox Rites
description: A cavalcade of synagogues on wheels last week took up positions in busy, strategic sections of Manhattan and from morning until late in the evening youthful rabbinic students instructed Jews in the use of sacred religious articles.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: TodayQualifying for United States Auto Club Schaefer 500 at Pocono International Raceway, Long Pond, Pa., from noon to 6 P.M. Information; phone (717)6462300.

title: Miss Haynie Gains Lead By Stroke
description: SUTTON, Mass., June 22 (AP)Sandra Haynie charged into a onestroke lead over Sandra Palmer today in the third round of the $50,000 Ladies Professional Golf Association championship.

title: Stars' First Scrimmage a BellRinger
description: CENTRAL ISLIP, L.I., June 22The only thing George Sauer, John Elliott, Randy Beverly and Gerry Philbin of the New York Stars could tell after their first World Football League scrimmage with the Philadelphia Bell today is that everything is a lot different than it was with the New York Jets.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: Mr. Dudley Young ventures such imaginative surmises [in his review of I. A. Richards: Essays in His Honor, edited by Reuben Brower, Helen Vendler and John Hollander, and Beyond, by I. A. Richards, May 26] that comment from the horse's mouth  best put, at this date, in the third person may be admissible. When I.A.R. wandered away from the Cambridge of the thirties he was not murmuring anything despairful but pursuing a reasonable if ambitious purpose: a World Cultural Instauration, badly needed, so he thought, and as specific as such a design could be. With R. D. Jameson and George Yeh he did, in fact, persuade the Chinese Government to adopt a new method of teaching English (that tool of tools) just at the moment the Japanese invasion swept all such hopes away. He went to Harvard because that was then the place from which the enterprise could be continued. Educational resistances defeated it. But he still thinks that the more alerted educators of today may soon have to look again at those suggestions (set out in J. P. Russo's fine bibliography in the Oxford University Press volume) toward avoiding the imminent collapse of the human effort.

title: The Pros and Cons of an Established Practice Under Criticism
description: WASHINGTONThe Watergate prosecution is disposing of the political crimes of the century by plea bargaining. Dealing, to be blunt. Trading Reducing the charges in exchange for a promise to plead guilty, to testify against the other guy and to save the prosecution the trouble of trial.

title: VIOLENCE REPORTED BY RULER OF SIKKIM
description: NEW DELHI, June 22 (UPI) Indian police in the Himalayan kingdom of Sikkim fired tear gas and used clubs to break up demonstrations supporting the ruler of Skkim, Chogyal. Palden Thondup Namgyal, the Chogyal said today.

title: Handicapped Girl Graduates on L.I. Following Dispute
description: LAKE RONKONKOMA, L. I., June 22A shyly smiling Roseann O'Brien graduated today with her Sachem High School class after receiving permission yesterday from the State Board of Education.

title: The Selling of the $2.2Billion TV Season
description: LOS ANGELES

title: W. H. Brown Weds Lucinda Siegler
description: The marriage of Miss Lucinda Siegler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edouard Horace Siegler Jr. of Darien, Conn., to Wesley Harmon Brown took place in the First Congregational Church in Darien yesterday afternoon. The bridegroom is a son of Mrs. John Quincy Hunsicker 3d of Darien and William Herbert Brown of Portland, Me. The Rev. Timothy Edward Haut performed the ceremony.

title: U.S. Envoy in Taiwan Defends Policy on Peking
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, June 22Ambassador Leonard Unger, in his first speech since his arrival here in early May, presented this week the most vigorous argument in favor of the new American policy toward China ever publicly enunciated here.

title: Carol Eaton Is Bride of Richard Hevner
description: Miss Carol Marylyn Eaton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lester Eaton of Forest Hills, Queens, was married yesterday afternoon to Richard Wesley Hevner of Philadelphia, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Wesley of Media, Pa.

title: Noel Adler Is Fiance Of Rita Greenberger
description: Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Greenberger of Westbury, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss. Rita Ellen Greenberger, to Noel David Adler, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur S. Adler of Valley Stream, L. I. A November wedding is planned.

title: The Bard Is Coming to Madison Again
description: MADISON  The New Jersey Shakespeare Festival, which is said to be the state's only professional (Actors' Equity) repertory company, will launch its 10th summer season on Tuesday. The festival is being presented again at Drew University, where it has appeared for the last three summers.

title: Instant Pictures, Instant Response
description: MY husband and I are not sociologists. Nor anthropologists. The experiment was far from scientific. On previous trips abroad, armed with our movie and slide cameras, we often found that people turned awayor worse, ran awayfrom us. That didn't happen during our recent journey to Peru, when we added a Polaroid camera to our equipment and gave prints to our subjects on the spot. We found ourselves constantly surrounded by friendly, curious peoplenot exactly a typical experience for the traveler. Chance? Coincidence? Or was it the magic of the instant photograph?

title: Endorsement Ban Stirs Suffolk Races
description: Already designated for the Conservative nomination for Suffolk District Attorney, Frederic Block will announce his candidacy this week for the Democratic nominationthe latest but not the last ramification of the politically explosive split between Suffolk Republicans and Conservatives.

title: Wood, Field & Stream Bass Fishing on Grindstone Island
description: CLAYTON, N. Y.A vigorous west wind sweeping down the broad St. Lawrence River died with the sun and dozens of fish came to the placid surface of Flynn's Cove on the northern end of Grindstone Island to feed in the soft afterlight.

title: OTB Aide, Methadone Patient, Sought in $9,000 Receipts Theft
description: OTB Aide, Methadone Patient, Sought in $9,000 Receipts Theft A methadone outpatient employed as a supervisor of a Brooklyn Offtrack Betting parlor allegedly stole more than $9,000 in receipts from the parlor yesterday afternoon.

title: A Boost for the Plodding Bus
description: The lowly bus the ugly duckling of transportation, unglamorous conveyance of the masses and neglected corner of the auto industry is again big business, of a sort.

title: MUSLIMS IN SIEGE PLANNING APPEALS
description: Four young Muslims who were convicted late Friday night of murder and kidnapping in connection with their holdup of a Brooklyn sporting goods store plan to appeal on the ground that they were found guilty of duplicate charges and could not serve two sentences for the same crimes.

title: Now Margaret Trudeau Is a Campaign Regular
description: MONTREAL, June 22 In the early days of Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau's marriage, his young wife rarely appeared in public. I don't like my family life to be mixed up in politics, he explained. The whole idea is repugnant to me.

title: Property Tax Tide Buffets the Elderly
description: Rising real estate taxes are producing severe economic and psychological problems for elderly property owners throughout the metropolitan area.

title: New Rules to Split SportsCar Racing, Bring Back Automobile
description: PARISThe old joke was that 350,000 spectators would show up for the 24 Hours of Le Mans even if there were no cars. Le Mans, after all, is a carnival, complete with twoheaded lady.

title: Sara Tassie, Hugh M. Boyd Have Nuptials
description: Miss Sara Tassie, daughter of Mrs. Brogan Tassie of Princeton and John Milton Tassie of New York, was married yesterday afternoon to Hugh Maclachlan Boyd, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Boyd of Princeton in the Chapel of Aquinas Institute of Princeton University. The Rev. Charles Weiser, Roman Catholic chaplain of Princeton University, performed the ceremony.

title: Jury Acquits Defendant In Minnesota Kidnapping

The child, the couple's second son, has been named Bradford Marsh. He is a grandson of Mrs. Novie Westbrook of St. Louis and William G. H. Acheson of New York and a greatgrindson of Mrs. Pearson Fessenden Marsh of Chicago.

description: Herb FitzGibbon won the New York State men's claycourt tennis championship yesterday 10 years after he had taken it for the first time.
