Dean 3d and five other central figures in the Wate, gate case would rebut charge that President Nixon took pal in an alleged hush money pal ment last year if they were called as witnesses at impeachment hearings, the White House has told the House Judiciary Committee.

title: Courageous, Intrepid Win Easy Tests
description: NEWPORT, R. I., June 26 Courageous and Mariner, the two new boats built for the defense of the America's Cup, met today for the first time in the preliminary trials being held here. Courageous won by the margin of 9 minutes 46 seconds over a 21.7mile course. An equivalent score in football would be 720.

title: Limit of Youthful Offender Law Is Ruled Unconstitutional Here
description: The fouryearold state law banning youthfuloffender treatment for persons inndicted for Class A felonies was declared unconstitutional yesterday by a State Supreme Court justice in Manhattan, in what is believed to be the first court opinion arising from the enactment of the state's new drug laws last year.

title: Master vs. Mini Plan
description: It is simple common sense to recognize that a community, familiar with its own problems, may often know what is best for it. The City Planning Commission's neighborhood miniplans are a logical step toward acknowledgment of that obvious possibility. But this approach does not nullify the value of the badly misunderstood master plan of the Lindsay administration. Planning as a process responsive to community input was initiated in the Lindsay years and is bearing welcome fruit now. The Beame administration has not suddenly been blessed with planning omniscience, as has been implied in recent discussion of the miniplans.

title: ALGERIA IN WARNING OF OIL OUTPUT CUTS
description: ALGIERS, June 26 (Reuters) Algeria warned today that she was prepared, together with other oilproducing countries, to reduce production to maintain the current high prices.

title: Advertising: Oil Unit Credibility
description: The present wave of oilcompany advertising that talks of the industry's need for profits for capital investments is good advertising but probably isn't working, Peter G. Peterson, a onetime ad man and former Secretary of Commerce, told a group of ad agency executives yesterday.

title: Kingsbridge Moves Against High Rises
description: Community approval appears nearly unanimous for the new miniplan to rezone a tidy 20squareblock enclave of Kingsbridge, in the northwest corner of the Bronx, to preserve its honeysuckleandrosetwined houses for one, two or three families from further highrise development.

title: DOLLAR OFF ABROAD AS GOLD DIPS $3.75
description: LONDON, June 26 (UPI)The dollar retreated on a broad front on European foreign exchanges today in continued reaction to the depressing United States trade figures for May. Gold fell $3.75 to close at $146.25 an ounce.

title: Excerpts From Report Proposing a New Science Council in Office of President
description: WASHINGTON, June 26Following are excerpts from a report submitted today to President Nixon by the National Academy of Sciences:

title: In Moscow, They Called It the Big Kniksen
description: Two years ago, as I walked along a Moscow street, I stopped in amazement before the United States Embassy. In a glass display case there were photographs showing life in America. It was as if one had opened the tiniest window and seen a piece of a world beyond the ocean. And every passerby was welcome to glance through it. But very few of them lingered at the display.

title: 3 Bronx Neighborhoods Get New Chance to Chart Futures
description: Wrestling with her small son and daughter and two of their playmates and a slippery brown puppy, Mrs. Evelyn Oriol is too busy to think big. Maybe, she concedes, she could symbolize what city planners call one of the most thoroughly integrated districts in the Bronx.

title: Senate Unit Assails F.A.A. on Defect Tied to Crash
description: A Senate aviation subcommittee approved yesterday a report sharply criticizing the Federal Aviation Administration for allegedly failing to act to insure correction of DC10 cargodoor defects that led to the crash of an airliner on March 3 outside Paris in which 346 persons were killed.

title: Chase's Prime Rate Advanced to 11%
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank, the nation's third largest banking organization, said yesterday that it would raise its prime lending rate to 11 per cent from 11 effective today.

title: School Election Reform
description: The shameful attempt by members of the District 1 community school board to oust Janice Wong on charges that she was not a duly registered voter underscores both the need for an investigation of that specific case and the urgency of longterm reforms of the process of electing local school boards.

title: A Science Council Is Urged As Agency in White House
description: The National Academy of Sciences urged President Nixon and Congress yesterday to reestablish in the White House a panel to advise the President and such agencies as the National Security Council on matters involving science and technology.

title: MRS. ARTHUR G. ZUPKO
description: Mrs. Lillian Cosner Zupko, wife of Dr. Arthur G. Zupko, dean of Long Island University's Brooklyn College of Pharmacy, died yesterday at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical center. She lived at 22 Warwick Road, Bronxville, N. Y.

title: Boston Girls Take Intercity Team Golf
description: HUNTINGTON VALLEY, Pa., June 26  Boston won the annual junior girls' intercity team golf matches for the second straight time today, scoring 20 points to 191/2 for Philadelphia and 5 for New York at the Huntingdon Valley Country Club.

title: Citicorp's FloatingRate Notes Under Fire by Savings Banks
description: The nation's savings banks, suffering from deposit outflows as funds move toward higher interest rates than they are permitted to pay, sought yesterday to block Citicorp from selling $250million or more of floatingrate notes.

title: Clifford of the City Ballet Takes Los Angeles Posts
description: John Clifford, a principal dancer with the New York City Ballet who has staged eight of his own ballets for the company, will leave the troupe at the end of the season on Sunday. The 26yearold choreographer and dancer said he was resigning to become artistic director and choreographer of the new Los Angeles Ballet in California.

title: DESALTING PLANT FACES YEAR DELAY
description: The United States Government is as much as a year away from choosing designs for the world's largest waterdesalting plant near the lower Colorado River, according to officials of the Interior Department's Office of Saline Water.

title: PRICE RISE HALTS ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Tuesday's advances on the American Stock Exchange and overthecounter market proved shortlives as prices fell yesterday. Investors seemingly have become convinced that the rise in the prime interest rate has not halted.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (Reuters)The Senate passed today a bill extending the life of the ExportImport Bank for 30 days beyond the present June 30 cutoff date. The bill now goes to the House where action on a similar measure was temporarily blocked on Monday.

title: New U.S. Treasurer Francine Irving Neff
description: WASHINGTON, June 26For two cents, I'd join the Republican party, Francine Neff said to a friend in Albuquerque back in 1964 when Barry Goldwater was running against Lyndon B. Johnson for President of the United States. Her friend promptly removed two pennies from his pocket, handed them to Mrs. Neff, and then closed the deal by sending someone from the local Republican organization to her home that evening to register her Republican.

title: Key Witness Awaited in Brasco Trial
description: The second trial of Representative Frank J. Brasco entered its second week in Federal District Court here yesterday on a charge that the Brooklyn Democrat had conspired to obtain bribes to help a truck company headed by a reputed Mafia member.

title: Bobbie Brooks Announces Disposal of Three Divisions
description: Bobbie Brooks, Inc., a large manufacturer of women's apparel announced yesterday that it was liquidating its Jo Edwards junior dress division.

title: BIG BANK CLOSED BY WEST GERMANY
description: COLOGNE, West Germany June 26 (Reuters) One of West Germany's largest private banks was officially ordered to cease business today because of heavy trading losses falsely entered in its books.

title: I.R.S. IS AUDITING TELEPHONE CALLS
description: WASHINGTON, June 26The Internal Revenue Service is conducting what it calls a massive spot check on Centrex telephone customers across the country to determine whether the Federal excise tax on communications is being paid.

title: Moscow Is Gratified by Gain in Trade
description: MOSCOW, June 26When American astronauts arrived here last Sunday for joint training with Soviet astronauts, one of the Russians commented that the program for their joint space flight was going well technically but we are still ill at ease with each other. In a capsule, this remark summarizes the Soviet view of accommodation with Washington the day before President Nixon arrives here and two years after he came for his first summit visit, in May, 1972.

title: Tax Shelter That Attracted Notables Studied by S.E.C.
description: An oildrilling tax shelter that attracted a glittering array of movie and television stars, bigbusiness men and other wellknown personalities is under criminal investigation by the Securities and Exchange Commission, S.E.C. sources disclosed yesterday.

title: U.S. WOMAN CHARGES SOVIET HARASSMENT
description: MOSCOW, June 26A young American woman said today that the Soviet authorities had been harassing her and the Russian she wants to marry and refused to let them go through with a wedding set for tomorrow.

title: N.F.L. Players' Strike Looms as Talks Break Off
description: WASHINGTON, June 26 (AP)  Negotiations between the National Football League owners and players broke off today, paving the way for a strike on Monday that could possibly wipe out the exhibition season.

title: Moderates in the Palestinian Movement
description: How moderate can an Arab terrorist be?

title: GALIBER CLEARED BY A GRAND JURY
description: State Senator Joseph L. Galiber was in effect absolved yesterday by a Bronx grand jury after an investigation of corporate campaign contributions and alleged forgedcheck problems that thwarted his appointment as the city's first black Deputy Mayor last January.

title: GRAIN PRICES OFF ON GOOD WEATHER
description: Sunny, warm weather came to the Midwest growing areas yesterday and grain and soybean prices tumbled as a result in futures trading on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Building Corporation Accused Of Fraud for Lower Realty Tax
description: The corporation that owns a 45story midtown office building was indicted yesterday on charges of fraud in obtaining sizable reductions in the building's real estate taxes.

title: EARL HOLCOMBE
description: Earl Holcombe, an inventor and motionpicture projectionist, died Wednesday at his home, 18 74th Street, North Bergen, N.J. He was 64 years old.

title: New Paper Names President
description: The appointment of John B. Olson as president and publisher of The New York Press, which is scheduled to begin publication early in 1975, was announced yesterday by John M. Shaheen, prsident of the Shaheen Natural Resources Co., Inc., owner of the publication. Mr. Olson, who will join The New York Press on Aug. 1, is general manager, vice president and treasurer of The Chicago Tribune.

title: Film Captures Anais lain, Heroine for Other Women
description: As preparation for the first volume of Anas Nin's Journal, I read three of her early novels, and discovered that heroines named Sabina, Djuana or Zora tested many lovers, including primitive men christened Rango (like Heathcliff) or Mambo, while seeking a joyous, joyous joyous, joyous impaling of woman on man's sensual mast, The result was a dissatisfaction with the flaming eucalyptus of the flesh. Hurtling between ancient holocausts, abysms, miasmas and charivaris of freedom, these women don't drink, travel or make guesses: Instead, they imbibe, peregrinate and divine. Yet men are very grateful to know them: By touching her naked foot he had felt a unity resembling the first unity of the world. . . .

title: Tax Shelters Offer Hedged Risks, Maybe Big Rewards
description: The taxshelter business, while not exactly on its last legs, is not so robust as it once was.

title: NIXON, IN MOSCOW, MET BY BREZHNEV; FIRST TALKS HELD
description: MOSCOW, June 27President Nixon arrived here today to a warm welcome and began his third summit meeting with Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet party chief.

title: Haldeman, Citing News Leaks, Seeks Reporters as Witnesses
description: WASHINGTON, June 27H. R. Haldeman asked the United States District Court here today to let him put news reporters and columnists on the witness stand In an attempt to prove that Government leaks had destroyed his prospects for a fair trial in the Watergate coverup case.

title: FORT LEE BRIBE TRIAL TO GET BODY TAPES
description: NEWARK, June 27 (AP) Body tapes made secretly with a recorder worn by Fort Lee Mayor Burt Ross will be part of the evidence in the trial of two contractors accused of trying to pay Mr. Ross a $500,000 bribe, it was disclosed today.

title: $5Billion More Taxes Asked for Italy
description: ROME, June 27Premier Mariano Rumor told Parliament today that it would require grave sacrifices to rescue Italy from financial disaster.

title: Ballet
description: This has been the first year that New Yorkers have had a choice between ballet versions of A Midsummer Night's Dream by two home companies. Sir Frederick Ashton's The Dream entered the City Center Joffrey's Ballet's repertory in the fall. On Wednesday night, George Balanchine's familiar 11yearold treatment of Shakepeare's play went on view again at the State Theatre with the New York City Ballet.

title: Rebirth of Night Life Jolts Old Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 27 Nobody seems to remember just how or when it began, but people have been laughing at this old city for years  and more often than not at its allegedly indigenous ennui.

title: Pirates, Union Agree
description: PITTSBURGH, June 27 (UPI)The Pittsburgh Pirates and Baseball Employes Union, Local 508, reached agreemat today permitting ushers to distribute AllStar ballots to fans beginning tomorrow night at Three Rivers Stadium. The ushers had refused to distribute ballots to fans, contending their contract did not require them to distribute anything. The AllStar Game will be played here July 23.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: AMERICAN BEES And the products there from are the subject of a small but imposing exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Twelve earlyAmerican through lateAmerican quilts from the museum's permanent collection have been hung in one highceilinged room on the second floor of the museum.

title: Repairs Scheduled For the F.D.R. Drive From 14th to 23d
description: While the West Side Highway faces controversial rebuilding, the Franklin D. Roosevelt Drive on the East Side is scheduled for repairs from 14th to 23d Street that may start late in July.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: HAMILTON, Bermuda, June 27Ondine, the yacht that broke the record for the Newport to Bermuda race this week, improved her official time by 16 minutes today because she had stopped in the Atlantic to help a boat distress.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It, is always an easy task to pronounce upon other peoples' problems so please bear in mind that the overwhelming proportion of Britishers are well disposed towards America and its citizens. I would ask you and your readers to accept whatever criticism is contained in this letter as sincerely meant and motivated by very genuine feelings of friendship.

title: World Cup Standings
description: GROUP A

title: Vincent R. Corrou, 74, Dies; Mayor of Utica, 1936 to '43
description: UTICA, N.Y., June 27 (AP)Vincent R. Corrou, who had been Mayor of this city four consecutive terms and had also served as a State Senator, died in Cooperstown Hospital today. He was 74 years old.

title: Kerr Ousted as Newark Police Head
description: NEWARK, June 27In a surprise move, Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson announced today he was relieving Police Director Edward L. Kerr, the city's first black Police Department head, and replacing him with Lieut. Hubert Williams, who also is black.

title: General Pinochet Sworn In As Head of State in Chile
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, June 27 (Reuters)  The leader of Chile's fourman junta, Gen. Augusto Pinochet Ugarte, was sworn in as supreme chief of the nation here today in a brief ceremony.

title: NUCLEAR MEASURE GAINING IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, June 27A Senate committee sent to the floor today an energy research and nuclear reorganization bill that emphasizes safety and seeks to protect development of nonnuclear energy sources, such as coal and sunlight.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: TRENTON, June 27Back in the Depression days, when people around here were working for 50 cents a day, there arose the sound of a bell. It could be heard for several blocksfrom backyards, from vacant lots and alleys, from saloon yards, churchyards and firehousesfar into the evening. It was the sound of the quoit.

title: WITNESS BALKING IN BRAD'S TRIAL
description: The prosecution's case against Representative Frank J. Brasco ran into a major obstacle yesterday when a reputed Mafia member refused to testify in the briberyconspiracy trial.

title: U.S. Court Quashes Indictment of Burke
description: The indictment against John W. Burke, Supervisor of Oyster Bay, L. I., on a charge of making a false statement was dismissed in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday after the Government said it did not have sufficient evidence for a conviction.

title: Millions for Museums
description: The State Council on the Arts announced grants of $5.6million to 21 museums and other institutions in New York City. As a result, the Metropolitan Museum of Art will rescind a cut In its hours. Details on Page 26.

title: HUBERT F. FISHER JR.
description: Hubert F. Fisher Jr., board chairman of Cook Industries, Inc., of Memphis, a large grain company that played a role in selling grain to the Soviet Union recently, died Wednesday at his home in Memphis. He was 63 years old.

title: U.N. PANEL BACKS MOZAMBIQUE CASE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., June 27A fivemember United Nations commission that was established last fall to investigate reports of atrocities in Mozambique has concluded that many hundreds of unarmed villagers were killed there by Portuguese troops.

title: Campanelli Wins No, 8, All on New York Tracks
description: Although he was the New York State wrestling champion when he was a student at the Nassau Community College a halfdozen years ago, Tommy Campanelli had no intention of pursuing the mat career as a professional. The reason was obvious  his specialty was the 98pound class.

title: Officer Whose Stolen Gun Killed Another Is Identified
description: The Police Department identified yesterday the policeman whose revolver was stolen in a mugging in May and used in the June 20 murder of another policeman, Lieut. Henry O. Schmiemann, in Queens.

title: Manson Case Reporter Again Held in Contempt
description: LOS ANGELES, June 27 (UPI)A newspaper reporter was found in contempt of the county grand jury and in contempt of court today for refusing to answer six questions about the source of an article he wrote about the Charles Manson clan in 1970.

title: Foreign Aid ...
description: The House of Representatives faces a critical choice next week on two issues that should not have beenbut arelinked together. A pending bill would put up $375 million a year during each of the next four years as the United States contribution to the International Development Association, which makes longterm, lowcast loans to the world's poorest nations. Another part of the same measure would require the President to lift the 40yearold ban on the ownership of gold bullion by United States citizens before the end of 1974. The gold bugs have made no secret of their determination to torpedo the contribution to I.D.A. unless the liberals and internationalists in Congress accept the prompt removal of restrictions on gold buying by private citizens.

title: Court Throws Out Indictment of Burke
description: The indictment against John W. Burke, Supervisor of Oyster Bay, L. I., on a charge of making a false statement was dismissed in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday after the Government said it did not have sufficient evidence for a conviction.

title: JAIL TERM GIVEN TO DEPROGRAMER
description: DENVER, June 27Ted Patrick, a 43yearold, selfdescribed deprogramer of young people, was sentenced today to a year in prison and fined $1,000 for falsely imprisoning two young Denver women.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Plumbers Jury Sworn In; Ehrlichman Denied Notes
description: WASHINGTON, June 27A jury of six men and six women was sworn in today to decide whether John D. Ehrlichman, a former Presidential aide, and three other defendants conspired to commit a burglary. Opening statements in the trial will begin tomorrow.

title: AUG. 23 VOTE SET ON IMPEACHMENT
description: WASHINGTON, June 27The Democratic leadership of the House, anticipating a recommendation by the House Judiciary Committee for the impeachment of President Nixon, has tentatively scheduled a House vote on impeachment for Aug. 23.

title: Company Turns Its Attention From Hair Color to Gray Matter
description: Clairol, the beauty products company that would like women to believe that they don't get older, they get better, yesterday put some of its profits where its slogan is.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS June 27, 1974
F.T.C. ACTS TO CUT OILDIRECTOR TIES
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 The Federal Trade Commission began action today to break up interlocking directorates involving a dozen oil and gas concerns, complaining that seven of their directors are on the boards of competing companies.

title: Boating Outlook
description: The National Weather Service issued this forecast at 6:45 P.M. yesterday for New York Harbor, Long Island Sound, Long Island south shore and nearby coastal area:

title: Hunter Title Is Captured By Dresden
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., June 27  Gerald Goldman's Dresden, a steady winner all year, scored in all four classes today for 11 points and won the large pony hunter championship in the opening session of the fourday Middlesex County horse show.

title: Democrats Debate Balance Vs. Bias In Selecting Slate
description: The controversy over a balanced Democratic ticket spread yesteday to the contest for the Democratic nomination for Lieutenant Governor as one of the contenders, Mario M. Cuomo, and Representative Bella S. Abzug traded charges on whether an ItalianAmerican Roman Catholic or a woman would better balance the ticket.

title: GARROW IS GUILTY IN YOUTH'S DEATH
description: LAKE PLEASANT, N. Y., (UPI)Robert F. Garrow, who has admitted his involvement in four killings, was found guilty today of murdering an 18yearold camper in the Adirondack Mountains last summer.

title: Israel Convicts Kahane In Plots on Embassies
description: JERUSALEM, June 27 (UPI) A district court here convictd Rabbi Meir Kahane of New York today of seeking to damage relations between Isby conspiring to blow up foreign embassies in Washington. Sentencing was set for Friday morning.

title: Widow, 72, Wins $1Million
description: HARRISBURG, June 27 (AP)A 72yearold widow receiving $202 a month in Social Security became today the 13th millionaire winder of. Pennsylvania's lottery. She is Mrs. Sophie Martin of Pittsburgh, who, when told by a reporter that she had won, said, I've never. had nothing in my living life.

title: Deposits Off $47Million
description: The outflow of deposits from the Franklin National Bank slowed considerably in the week ended Wednesday  the first week since the bank restated its earnings, disclosed a $63.6million loss and replaced its chairman.

title: Judge Bids U.S. Attorney Weigh Indicting Grumman
description: Judge Jack B. Weinstein sentenced two businessmen yesterday for rigging bids and then urged the United States Attorney's office to consider seriously indicting the Grumman Aerospace Corporation of Bethpage, LI., and its highest officials.

title: ItalianAmericans Here Unite to Fight Reverse Racial Bias
description: New Yorkers of Italian descent are becoming more vocal and militant about what they see as an impediment to their upward mobility and their growing desire to enter colleges and the professions.

title: Books of The Times
description: EISENHOWER: Portrait of the Hero. By Peter Lyon. 839 pages. Illustrated. Little, Brown & Co. $15.

title: Minority Hiring Said to Hurt Colleges
description: The affirmative action program by which the Federal Government is compelling colleges and universities to hire more women and blacks is lowering standards and undermining faculty quality, according to a report to be published today under the spons?? ship of the Carnegie Commission on Higher Education.

title: Grain Prices Slump
description: Grain and soybean futures prices tumbled yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade as sunny and warm weather came to growing areas in the Middle West. Details on Page 51.

title: Foyt Gains Post No. 29 At Pocono
description: MOUNT POCONO, Pa., June 27 (AP)A. J. Foyt, complaining of bad track conditions, qualified his Gilmore Racing Team Coyote at 181.415 miles an hour today as the 33car lineup was completed for the Schaefer 500mile championship auto race.

title: Mills and Humphrey Rebut Campaign Fund Charges
description: WASHINGTON, June 27Two 1972 Democratic Presidential aspirants rebutted in strong terms today preliminary reports from the Senate Watergate committee's staff that were critical of the financing of their campaigns.

title: U.S.Soviet Ties Called Knotty Issue for Press
description: MOSCOW, June 27Many Soviet journalists accredited to the Nixon visit have shown up at the press center on the third floor of the Intourist Hotel on Gorky Street dressed in their most mod clothes, leaving at least a few veteran resident American correspondents here looking more typically Russian in their dark, baggy suits with narrow lapels.

title: Kremlin Menu Features A Boned Stuffed Grouse
description: MOSCOW, June 27 (AP) The menu at the Kremlin dinner in honor of President Nixon tonight consisted of the following:

title: GARROW IS GUILTY IN YOUTH'S DEATH Verdict Returned in Murder of Adirondacks Camper
description: LAKE PLEASANT, N. Y., (UPI)Robert F. Garrow, who has admitted his involvement in four killings, was found guilty today of murdering an 18yearold camper in the Adirondack Mountains last summer.

title: LISBON ASKS AID FROM TRADE BLOC
description: BRUSSELS, June 27  Portugal has asked the European Common Market for economic aid and cooperative arrangements to help her modernize her economy.

title: 5 INDICTED IN DEATH OF TWO IN BROOKLYN
description: District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn announced the indictments of five alleged underworld members yesterday in the ganglandstyle murder of two Brooklyn brothers in January, 1970.

title: Capital Gains Tax Urged In ByrnePlan Alternative
description: TRENTON, June 27The chairman of the Joint Legislative Committee on School Funding today proposed increases in several state taxes and some new levies, including a capital gains tax, as an alternative to Governor Byrne's beleaguered state income tax program.

title: A Study Finds Ignorance About Impact of Oil Spills
description: Pending Government decilions about offshore oil drilling, refineries and tanker superports, run the risk of being made in considerable ignorance and uncertainty about the impact of oil spills on life in the oceans according to a study for the Ford Foundation Energy Policy Project released yesterday.

title: Minority Hiring Said to Hurt Colleges
description: The affirmative action program by which the Federal Government is compelling colleges and universities to hire more women and blacks is lowering standards and undermining faculty quality, according to a report to be published today under the spons?? ??hip of the Carnegie Commission on Higher Education.

title: Commodities Exchanges Beginning a Joint Venture
description: A coin made of silver and copper, packages of sugar and coffee, a wad of cotton, two oranges and two potatoes were placed into a metal box yesterday at the World Trade Center, marking the beginning of a cooperative venture. The metal box will be laid in the cornerstone of a new building at the World Trade Center which will house four exchanges, giving them one trading floor and the economy of joint facilities. At the same time they will keep their identity as separate exchanges.

title: $100Million Contract Set
description: The Northern Natural Gas Company of Omaha announced yesterday the signing of a $100million contract with CENTROMOR, the importexport enterprise of the United Polish Shipyards.

title: New Trial of Egan Is Sought on Counts Jury Left Unsettled
description: Red States Attorney Paul J. Curran announced yesterday that his office would seek a retrial of former police Lieut. John J. Egan on conspiracy, extortion and taxevasion charges on which a Federal jury could not agree last week.

title: Red Smith
description: It is a privilege to announce that even if a players' strike were to force cancellation of the National Football League games this year, the solemn autumn rite of breaking intelligent young heads would still be practiced in shrines like the Yale Bowl in New Haven, Michie Stadium at West Point, Franklin Field in Philadelphia, and points north, south and west, Although in some communities the Hessians have managed to monopolize public attention, there is still a game called college football, and the fact that its practitioners are paid less than Joe Namath or Larry Csonka implies no lack of merit on their part.

title: STABILIZED RENTS GET NEW CEILINGS
description: The city's Rent Guidelines Board announced new and higher ceilings yesterday on rent increases for lease renewals in the next 12 months in many stabilized apartments here.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Two 16yearold suspects were arrested in the May 11 slaying of 78yearold Mrs. Clara Sokolsky, whose body was found in her ransacked apartment at Broadway and 140th Street.

title: MORRIS E. SIEGEI, EXSCHOOLS AIDE
description: Morris E. Siegel, who retired In 1954 as assistant superintendent of New York City schools after s??e 52 years in the school system, died Thursday in Mill Valley, Calif., where he had lived for the last 20 years. He was 90 years old.

title: Five Groundsfors Impeaching the President
description: Opinion in the Nixon and the antiNixon camps has come around to supporting impeachment rather than resignation as the proper solution for the Watergate crisis, and for the soundest of reasons impeachment will answer fundamental questions about Presidential power and the nature of the American constitutional system, whereas resignation will leave these questions forever unanswered.

title: ... and the Gold Bugs
description: It is extremely risky for Congress to be forcing the President's hand on gold at this time. Last month the United States ran a trade deficit of $777 million, the second largest in its historythe largest having been run in October, 1971, shortly before the dollar was devalued for the first time since 1933. A substantial outpouring of American dollars to buy gold bullion abroad could seriously worsen the trade and payments deficit that appears to many observers to lie ahead.

title: Delegates at Rabbinical Parley Warn of Low Jewish Birth Rate
description: MIAMI BEACH, June 27Rabbi Shlomo Goren, Israel's Ashkenazic chief rabbi, said today that the Jewish state's security was threatened because of its zero population growth.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Suspect Seized in Murder Of RockMusic Arranger
description: A 34yearold New Jersey man has been arrested and charged with the murder, last year of George Howard Hodge, a 42yearold rockmusic arranger, who was slain when he and his wife reportedly surprised two burglars at their Lincoln Towers apartment at 165 West End Avenue.

title: FIDELITY CORP. SETS CHARGE AGAINST NET
description: The Fidelity Corporation of Pennsylvania, parent of the Fidelity Bank, notified the Securities and Exchange Commission yesterday that it planned to increase the loanloss reserve of its consumerloan subsidiary, the Local Finance Corporation, by $800,000 after taxes. Local Finance became a Fidelity Corporation subsidiary a year ago.

title: Burch Assails Limiting Panel Witnesses
description: WASHINGTON, June 27Dean Burch, a counselor to President Nixon, said today that it was patently unfair of the House Judiciary Committee decide to hear only two of the six witnesses requested by James D. St. Clair, Mr. Nixon's attorney.

title: Weekend Fishing and Boating Outlook
description: AREA AHeavy rains with northeast winds kept most fishing boats off the water from Monday to Wednesday, but the seas flattened out yesterday and the outlook is guardedly good. Blues are abundant around Manasquan Ridge and at Barnegat Ridge. Fishermen chumming and trolling are making catches that average from 10 to 12 pounds. Fluke are also running up and down the New Jersey coast with good catches reported north of Point Pleasant and at Barnegat. The average fluke are Weighing about five pounds, but some have gone as much as eight or nine pounds. At Surf City, John Falkiewicz repdrts a smattering of everything, but says that bass of about 20 inches are as likely a catch as any.

title: Anthony E. Sega, 55, Dies; A Foreign Service Officer
description: Anthony E. Sega, a career Foreign Service officer, died Wednesday of cancer in Washington Hospital Center. He was 55 years old and had come to the capital for treatment from Palermo, Sicily, where he was deputy principal officer in the American Consulate General.

title: Savings Flow Lagging
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (AP) Savings and loan associations had net savings of $400million in May, the lowest total for the month in eight years, the Federal Home Loan Bank Board said today. The May increase of $400million in net new savings was an improvement from a savings loss of $300million in April.

title: Assailant Kills a Woman After Kicking In Her Door
description: JERSEY CITY, June 27A quiet 26yearold woman from the suburbs who reportedly told her friends she moved here because she liked the atmosphere of a city, was murdered here last night.

title: Treasury Discloses Plan
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 The Treasury announced today that it planned to require regular reports on foreign currency positions of large banks and corporations that operate internationally before the end of this year.

title: Bridg
description: The most popular open international tournament in the world, though only two years old, is in Monte Carlo each June. This month it attracted close to 100 American competitors, as well as players from most European countries.

title: Sadat Flies to Rumania For Talks With Ceausescu
description: CAIRO, June 27President Anwar elSadat flew to Rumania this afternoon for four days of talks with President Nicolae Ceausescu, to be followed by a twoday official visit to Bulgaria.

title: Reform, Limited
description: When the State Legislature passed an emasculated election law last spring, the one potential bright spot for disappointed reformers was its provision for creation of a new State Board of Elections. It was hoped that this bipartisan body might provide the vigorous oversight of elections that has been so conspicuously absent in the past, and that new limits on campaign spending and other controls, however inadequate, would be enforced.

title: Average Drops 13.30 as Volume Increases
description: It was a bad day for the stock market yesterday.

title: Southern Lebanese Dwell in Cross Fire
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 27 There is a village in the Arkub region of southeastern Lebanon that some people call the town that sleeps in a church.

title: About New York All the Battery Is a Stage
description: The best place from which to view the city is a Staten Island ferry, or, if that is too much trouble, the Battery. Water is around one side of the Battery, and buildings around another, and while some of the new buildings look like big cabbage graters, it is all impressive, nonetheless. There is no other piece of New York as full of history as the Battery, and no other piece of New York where citizens have been hanging out for so long.

title: JERSEY CITY SEEKS TO COLLECT TAXES
description: Jersey City is operating on the premise that sugar will be more effective than muscle in persuading businessmen to pay delinquent personal property taxes that in some cases have gone uncollected for 30 years.

title: NEW TAX LEVIES SIGNED BY BEAME
description: Following a routine, humdrum public hearing yesterday at City Hall, Mayor Beame signed into law $270.1 million in new and increased taxes to baalance his $11.1billion expense budget.

title: Net of 41c a Share Reported by A.&P.
Players Urge Rookies to Skip Camps
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (AP)The National Football League Players Association asked all rookies today to stay away from the training camps that are scheduled to open next week.

title: New A.M.A. President Malcolm Clifford Todd
description: CHICAGO, June 27  Dr. Malcolm C. Todd, the new president of the American Medical Association, likes to call himself a moderate conservative, but a realist. This characterization of his political persuasion also proved to be an accurate portrayal of his role at the 123d annual convention of the organization, which ended here today.

title: MAN IS CONVICTED OF KILLING BOY, 1
description: TOMS RIVER, June 27 (UPI) A Lavallette man, whose wife had testified that he had beaten her 18monthold son to death because the child had refused to sleep in a cardboard box, Was convicted of manslaughter today by an Ocean County jury.

title: 2 Rob Finance Concern And Flee Police Cordon
description: NEWARK, June 27 (AP)Two men held up a downtown finance company today, then escaped a dragnet the police had set up to trap them inside the building in which the holdup took place.

title: Stein Now Expects A Slower Recovery
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 The Government now expects the recovery in the economy in the second half of this year to be a little less than had previously been forecast, the President's Council of Economic Advisers disclosed today.

title: Two Leaders in a Jovial Reunion
description: MOSCOW, June 27President Nixon's first summit visit here in 1972 began like a respectful but restrained and tentative testing of the waters of dtente. His second visit today began like a jovial reunion.

title: Price Decline Resumes on HighGrade Debt Issues
Williams Will Manage Angels On 3 Year Pact
description: ANAHEIM,. Calif., June 27 (AP)Dick Williams, who led the Oakland A's to World Series titles the last two years, agreed tonight to end his exile from baseball and to manage the California Angels, who earlier in the day had dismissed Bobby Winkles as manager.

title: ST. CLAIR ASSERTS DEAN'S TESTIMONY BACKS PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 Persident Nixon's defense attorney cited sworn testimony by John W. Dean 3d in attempting today to convince the House Judiciary Committee that the President had committed no wrongdoing that would justify his impeachment.

title: New Sense of Alliance
description: BRUSSELS, June 27  As President Nixon left here for Moscow today, there was widespread satisfaction among the Western allies with the declaration of Atlantic principles that he and other leaders signed here yesterday. While the long haggling that produced it did bring about compromises that all could accept, no one, however, was presuming to call this a start of a new and happier era in relations between the members of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. There was no sense of solemn achievement or historic advance, just a sense of relief that the stormy quarrels that had undermined the alliance seemed to have been calmed if resolved.

title: State Council on the Arts Sets Millions for Museums
description: The first largescale infusions of funds under the big new budget of the New York State Council on the Arts will pour $5.6million into 21 New York City museums and other institutions and, among other things, will let the Metropolitan Museum of Art restore hours that were to have been curtailed

title: Opera: Alfresco Boheme in Bronx
description: Where would outdoor summer music in New York be without beer? The Schaefer (pop) Music Festival at Wollman Rink is subsidized by Schaefer; the New York Philharmonic free park concerts are sponsored by Schlitz, and now Miller High Life has come to the rescue of the Metropolitan Opera's alfresco opera concerts.

description: DACCA, Bangladesh, June 27 Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto of Pakistan arrived here today on what was described by a Pakastani official as a mission of peace and reconciliation.

title: A.M.A.'s PresidentElect From Political Action Unit
description: CHICAGO, June 27 (AP) The House of Delegates of the American Medical Association chose Dr. Max H. Parrott today as the A.M.A.'s presidentelect.

title: Elmore Picks A.B.A. and Pacers Sign Him
description: The American Basketball Association won a bigname signing battle with its rival, the National Basketball Association, yesterday when Len Elmore chose the Indiana Pacers over the Washington Bullets. The 6foot9inch Elmore, who came out of New York's Power Memorial Academy to star with the University of Maryland, signed a multiyear contract that Norman Blass, his lawyer, called the third largest negotiated thus far this year, exce4ded only by the Portland Trail Blazers' signing of Bill Walton and Tom Burleson by the Seattle SuperSonsics.

description: A sevenhour sitin in the executive offices of the region al headquarters of the Veterans Administration here ended peacefully when a dozen protesters, including Vietnam veterans, submitted to arrest on charges of criminal trespass.

title: Theater

Directed by Robert Mandel; setting by Mariorie Kellogg; costumes by Carol Oditz; lighting by Arden Fingerhut; sound by Robert Dennis; fencing choreographed by Stu Paukin; technical director, Peter Dowling; production stage manager, Richard L. Barr. Presented by the Manhattan Theater Club, Lynne Mead??, artistic director. At 321 East 73d Street.

title: Prime Rate of 12% or Higher Is Expected
description: Business Ioan demand continued to show strong growth in the week ended Wednesday, and interest rates continued to climbpromising a 12 per cent prime rate or even higher within the next several days.

title: Judiciary Panel Stressing A Need to Be Bipartisan
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 Members of the House Judiciary Committee said today that they believed the wounds from last night's bruising, partisan battle over the calling of impeachment witnesses need not be permanent.

title: Bird's Friends Salute a Giant of Jazz
description: Stouter now, looking tired from years on the road, in combos and small bands and big bands, in clubs and ballrooms and Las Vegas, the jazzmen who grew up with Charlie (Bird) Parker and bebop get together tonight in Carnegie Hall to remember him and play his music.

title: 1,000 Honor Slain Mt. Vernon Detective
description: MOUNT VERNON, N.Y., June 27The street in front of a lovely old Episcopal church here became a field of blue today when more than 1,000 police officers gathered to honor Detective Bernard L. Christopher, who was killed last Monday when he attempted to stop robbery in a bar.

title: TWODAY SQUABBLE ENDS IN A SLAYING
description: A twoday squabble between a 13yearold Brooklyn girl and her 22yearold neighbor ended yesterday afternoon when the teenager fatally stabbed the older woman after being threatened by a cap pistol, the police said.

title: The Screen
description: THE NINE LIVES OF FRITZ THE CAT, an animated feature directed by Robert Taylor; written by Mr. Taylor and Fred Halliday; cinematography, Ted C. Bemliler and Greg Hescheng; film editor, Marshall M. Borden; music, Tom Scott and the L.A. Express; produced by Steve Krantz; Presented by Samuel Z. Arkofi. At the Penthouse, Broadway and 47th Street; the 591h Street Twin, east of Third Avenue, and the 861h Street Twin. Running time: 76 minutes. (This film has been classified R).

title: Regents Examinations' Security Scored at Legislative Hearing
description: Security methods for guarding testing materials at public and private schools in the city were severely criticized at a legislative hearing yesterday prompted by the recent theft of state Regents examination papers.

title: Weekly Retail Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, June 27The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $1.030billion, up 9 per cent from the yearearlier $??million.

title: CHRYSLER RAISES PRICES $60 A CAR
description: DETROIT, June 27  The Chrysler Corporation announced today it would increase prices on its cars and options to keep up with recent rises in the price of steel. The average rise by Chrysler comes to $60 per vehicle.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Sewer Work Stalled
description: TRENTON, June 27 (AP)The State Department of Environmental Protection reported today that it had made little headway in awarding Federalstate grants for sewer construction projects.

title: Excerpts From Speeches by Brezhnev and Nixon During a Dinner in Moscow
description: Following are excerpts from speeches at a dinner in Moscow last night by Leonid I. Brezhnev, General Secretary of the Soviet Communist party, as distributed in English by Tass, the official Soviet press agency, and by Prsident Nixon, as issued by White House officials and distributed by The Associated Press:

title: A Report Finds McGovern Used 1972 Funds in Senate Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (AP) Senator George McGovern enriched his South Dakota Senate campaign by $340,416 in leftover funds raised for his 1972 Presidential campaign, according to a staff report to the Senate Watergate committee.

title: CHRYSLER RAISES PRICES $60 A CAR
description: DETROIT, June 27  The Chrysler Corporation announced today it would increase prices on its cars and options to keep up with recent rises in the price of steel. The average rise by Chrysler comes to $60 per vehicle.

title: Labor Statistics Bureau Completes Its 90th Year
description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported yesterday that it had completed its 90th year of existence, a record, up one year from its previous record of 89 years established in June of last year.

title: Vandalism Reward Offered
description: A frequent but unindentified visitor to Central Park offered a $100 reward yesterday for information leading to the arrest of the vandals who tipped over four large stone vases on June 20. The vases, at the end of the Literary Walk near the bandshell at 69th Street and valued at about $5,000 each, are of pink granite, stand 4 feet tall and measure 3 feet in diameter.

title: Killing for Peace?
description: Al Fatah, the largest Palestinian guerrilla group, has made a serious and potentially fatal miscalculation its reported decision to step up terrorist attacks on Israel at a time when the parent Palestinian Liberation Organization is seeking recognition as spokesman for the Palestinians at the Geneva peace talks.

title: Rumors on Westinghouse Assailed by Its Chairman
description: Donald C. Burnham, chairman of the Westinghouse Electric Corporation, assailed the rumors that halted trading in its stock yesterday and said that it was irresponsible to suggest that the company was in financial trouble.

title: Screen: 'Natural Thing':View of Homosexuality at Two Theaters
description: "Being gay is a very natural thing," a young Lesbian gently says in a keynote observation in "A Very Natural Thing," which opened Wednesday at the Cine Malibu and Cinema Village. Natural or not, this dramatization of the trials and joys of male homosexuality is, like "The Boys in the Band" or "Sticks and Stones," pervasively heartfelt in its special pleading but somewhat less than overwhelming in dramatic impact.In making his feature-film debut, Christopher Larkin, the co-author-director-producer, who reportedly once led a monastic life and was a teacher, appears to have drawn his theme from life in focusing on the affairs of a young, homosexual, local high-school master.Sincerity underlines his romance with an aggressive but restless, handsome executive type. And it is equally obvious when this liaison turns stormy and breaks up and our harried hero enters into another relationship, but this time as a wary lover not entirely committed to his affectionate partner.Unlike the strictly pornographic exercises on view hereabouts, "A Very Natural Thing" is sensitive and realistic in its approach, even though the homosexual bars, the local and Fire Island beach soires and artistic couplings are not in short supply. And its Manhattan, Fire Island and Cape Cod vignettes have been captured in pastel colors that are strikingly lovely and lend a documentary effect.Robert Joel, as the sorely tried teacher who has not yet emerged from the closet for fear that it will affect his job; Curt Gareth, as his eventually disenchanted lover, and Bo White, as the new light of his life are, to borrow from the title, impressively natural in roles that easily could have become caricatures.But aside from several scenes, especially one in which Mr. White awkwardly but poignantly meets with his estranged wife and their little daughter, "A Very Natural Thing" is not especially moving. The succession of ecstasies, tiffs, quarrels and searchings for meanings are, despite the essential honesty, the stuff of standard, not unusual, drama.

title: Stevens Closer to Appellate Nomination
description: The Democratic party moved closer yesterday to getting a balanced statewide ticket when State Supreme Court Justice Bertram Harnett of Nassau County withdrew from the race for a nomination for associate judge of the State Court of Appeals.

title: House Unit Votes New Ban On Chrome From Rhodesia
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (Reuters)  The House Foreign Affairs Committee voted today to reimpose an import embargo on chrome from Rhodesia.

title: The Persistent Mustards
description: The wild mustards come to bloom at the country roadside, in suburban backyards, even in the rubble of the city's vacant lots. Botanically, they are called crucifers because the four petals of their flowers form a perfect cross. Those flowers usually are white or yellow, though the eyecatching Hesperis, often mistaken for wild phlox by those who forget that phlox has five petals, not four, ranges from white through pink and lavender to purple.

title: Gibson Ousts Kerr As Police Director
description: NEWARK, June 27In a surprise move, Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson announced today he was relieving Police Director Edward L. Kerr, the city's first black Police Department head, and replacing him with Lieut. Hubert Williams, who also is black.

title: Market Place: Amex to Seek Foreign Shares
description: The American Stock Exchange, like others involved in the securities industry, wants sorely to bolster business. Its revenues, from commissions on trades and listings primarily, have sagged along with everything else.

title: Atlanta Blacks Stage 3d Protest Seeking Ouster of Police Chief
description: ATLANTA, June 27After a day of tense negotiations, several hundred blacks marched peacefully through the heart of downtown Atlanta late this afternoon, demanding the ouster of a white police chief they contended was a racist.

title: Scoop Goes to Peking
description: WASHINGTON, June 27Senator Henry M. Scoop Jackson of the State of Washington is turning out to be the most vigorous Democratic candidate for the Presidency these days, the challenger of Henry Kissinger, and the darling of the Pentagon, the weapons industry, the proIsrael lobby, and the labor leaders at the A.P.L.C.I.O.

title: STABILIZED RENTS GET NEW CEILINGS
description: The city's Rent Guidelines Board announced new and higher ceilings yesterday on rent increases for lease renewals in the next 12 months in many stabilized apartments here.

title: Ambassadors and Gifts
description: WASHINGTON, June 27The following list, compiled by the staff of the Senate Watergate committee, shows United States Ambassadors appointed to foreign countries by President Nixon who gave money to Republican campaigns, including the President's own reelection effort, either before or after April 7, 1972. After this date, Federal law required that certain sizable campaign contributions he reported to the General Accounting Office. The asterisk denotes individuals no longer serving in the post.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: HOUSE STANDS FIRM ON ANTIBUSING ISSUE
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (UPI)The House voted today for the second time in three weeks to stand firm on strong antibusing provisions written into an education bill it passed previously.

title: U.S., Citing Lack of Progress, Rejects Finale to Europe Talks
description: GENEVA, June 27  The United States declared today that the European security conference had not made enough in its current second progress in its current second phase to justify holding the ceremonial final session next month.

title: Officials Fear New Crisis As Energy Demand Rises
description: WASHINGTON, June 27Along the fabled Las Vegas Strip, the lights burn again at night. In South Dakota, reports Senator James Abourezk after a weekend in his home state, filling stations are open 24 hours a day.

title: REA Seeking Court Stay
description: The REA Express Company said yesterday it had directed its lawyers to file in court as soon as possible a motion for a stay of a Civil Aeronautics Board order terminating its air express status on July 31.

title: NIXON, IN MOSCOW, MET BY BREZHNEV; FIRST TALKS NEED
description: MOSCOW, June 27President Nixon arrived here today to a warm welcome and began his third summit meeting with Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet party chief.

title: Peking Poster Campaign Becomes FreeforAll
description: PEKING, June 27 (Reuters) The wallposter campaign in this Chinese capital moved into its third week today.

title: Israel's Chief of Staff Warns Egypt on Missiles for Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, June 27The Israeli Chief of Staff warned today that Lebanon could become a fullfledged battlefield if Egyptians were allowed to install missile batteries on Lebanese soil.

title: Assailant Kills Jersey Woman After Breaking Down Her Door
description: JERSEY CITY, June 27A quiet 26yearold woman from the suburbs who reportedly told her friends she moved here because she liked the atmosphere of a city, was murdered here last night.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 1.5 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuffs and industrial materials rose to 227.1 from 225.6 last week.

title: PRICES INCREASED ON SOME PRODUCTS
description: Revere Copper and Brass, Inc., raised prices yesterday for specification and commodity, aluminum sheet products. The increases range from 1 cents to 2 cents a pound for certain alloys as well as commodity., class products.

title: DR. KURT SALOMON, RADIATION EXPERT
description: Dr. Kurt Salomon, who retired in 1962 as professor of radiation biology and biophysics at the University of Rochester School of Medicine and Dentistry, died June 17 in Lagos, Nigeria. His age was 76.

title: Fairness for Viet Vets
description: The SenateHouse conference now working on the 1974 G.I. Bill amendments has an opportunity to correct large inequities which afflict veterans of the Vietnam war. The major issue up for resolution is whether the Vietnam veterans' educational benefits will be raised to reasonable parity with those accorded to veterans of World War II a generation ago.

title: New Trial of Egan Is Sought on Counts Jury Left Unsettled
description: United States Attorney Paul J. Curran, announced yesterday that his office would seek retrial of former police Lieut. John J. Egan on conspiracy, extortion and taxevasion charges on which a Federal jury could not agree last week.

title: The Moods in Cambodian Capital: Resigned, Fearful and Angry
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia You cannot always hear the rockets come in. Often you only hear about them in the way you hear about murders in New York

title: Sandman's Son Is Indicted
description: MAYS LANDING, June 27 (AP)Robert S. Sandman, the 19yarold son of Representative Charles W. Sandman Jr., and a companion have been indicted by an Atlantic County grand jury on charges of possession of more than two pounds of marijuana with intent to distribute. The younger Sandman, of Erma Park, and John F. Welke, 20, of North Wildwood were arrested on the Garden State Parkway in Egg Harbor Township last March 21 by a state trooper who reported finding about 1,000 grams of marijuana in the car.

title: Norwalk Woman, 110, Dies
description: NORWALK, Conn., June 27 Carrie Augusta Wood, believed to be the oldest living resident of Connecticut, died this morning at a nursing home. She would have been 111 years old next month.

title: The Pop Life
description: Comebacks are notoriously difficult in the world of pop music. Fans are fickle, and once you're down, you tend to stay down, or at least never quite make it back up to the top. Individuals or groups on the rebound can often make respectable careers for themselves, but rarely enjoy the rush of a real triumph.

title: ANTHONY W. DUFFY
description: Anthony W. Duffy, a commercial photographer and partner in DellDuffy, Inc., New York photography concern, died, apparently of heart attack, in Pennsylvania Station on Thursday morning. He was 63 years old and lived at 3 Shoredale Drive in Manhasset, L.I.

title: 3Time Felon, 57, Sentenced To a 15Year Robbery Term
description: A 57yearold Bronx man who has spent 38 years in prison on three previous convictions for crimes that included manslaughter, robbery and rape received his fourth sentence yesterday, a 15yearstolife term for breaking a woman's jaw in a pursesnatching assault.

title: DR. JULIEN A. RIPLEY
description: Dr. Julien Ashton Ripley, who retired as professor of physical sciences at Stanford University last year, died yesterday in Memorial Hospital. He was 66 years old and lived in Carlisle, Pa.

title: Courageous Outsaiis Intrepid fo r30 Mark
description: NEWPORT, R.I., June 27Courageous, the new yacht hacked by a syndicate from the New York Yacht Club, remained undefeated today in the America's Cup trial races op Rhode Island Sound.

title: Advertising: Malt Duck Strategy
description: Back in 1971 there was considerable talk in brewing circles about the introduction of various brands of flavored malt liquors.

title: Two Leaders in a Jovial Reunion
description: MOSCOW, June 27President Nixon's first summit visit here in 1972 began like a respectful but restrained and tentative testing of the waters of dtente. His second visit today began like a jovial reunion.

title: Welfare Checks Stolen
description: BOSTON, June 27 (AP)Some $250,000 worth of welfare checks have been, stolen from the state offices by individuals posing as eligible recipients, the Bureau of Welfare Auditing reports today. The checks, for persons entitled to General Relief grants, were distributed by offices of the state Division of Employment Security.

title: Envoy's Campaign Pledge Linked to Promotion Offer
description: WASHINGTON, June 27A former United States Ambassator to Jamaica apparently received an express commitment of a more attractive embassy in return for a $100,000 reelection campaign pledge to President Nixon and other Republican candidates, the Senate Watergate committee has been told.

title: House Member Vows to Press Inquiry on Immigration Service
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 Representative Leo J. Ryan, Democrat of California, said today that he was appalled by secret testimony he heard this week regarding the scope of corruption in the Immigration and Naturalization Service and vowed to pursue an investigation of the charges.

title: Appeals Court Race
description: The withdrawal of Supreme Court Justice Bertram Harnett from the Democratic primary for the Court of Appeals is a graceful act that comes at a time when there is already too much namecalling and politicking for New York State offices.

title: Mother, 2 Children Die In Williamsburg Fire
description: A woman and two children died in a twoalarm fire in Brooklyn last night and eight persons were hospitalized for smoke inhalation least two other persons were badly burned, officials said.

title: Dutch World Cup Favorites of Everyone but Dutch
description: GELSENKIRCHEN, West Germany, June 27  Eleven men from the Netherlands captivated a crowd of 55,931 people for 90 minutes last night the way Walt Frazier, Joe Namath, Tom Seaver and Brad Park captivate New York sports fans when they are in good form.

title: Senate Approves House For the Vice President
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (AP)The Senate approved legislation yesterday creating an official, residence for the Vice President.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: STUDY EXAMINES TEEN PREGNANCY
description: Nearly three out of ten teenage American girls who have premarital intercourse become pregnant, with 35 per cent of the pregnant girls marrying before their babies are born, according to a continuing analysis of a nationwide study of adolescent sexuality.

title: Envoy's Campaign Pledge Linked to Promotion Offer
description: WASHINGTON, June 27A former United States Ambassador to Jamaica apparently received an express commitment of a more attractive embassy in return for a $100,000 reelection campaign pledge to President Nixon and other Republican candidates, the Senate Watergate committee has been told.

title: Mets' Records
5 J.D.L. Members Disrupt Moiseyev With Egg Barrage
description: Last night's performance of the Moiseyev Dance Company at the Metropolitan Opera House was interrupted briefly after five members of the Jewish Defense League hurled eggs at the performers and released stink bombs during the fourth number of the evening's program.

title: Prison Officer Holdsi His Wife and Child Captive for 13 Hours
description: A state drugabuse corrections officer held his estranged commonlaw wife and 3yearold daughter hostage for more. than 13 hours yesterday in Brooklyn before releasing them unharmed.

title: ST. CLAIR ASSERTS DEAN'S TESTIMONY BACKS PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 Persident Nixon's defense attorney cited sworn testimony by John W. Dean 3d in attempting today to convince the House Judiciary Committee that the President had committed no wrongdoing that would justify his impeachment.

title: Demo Likes His 81 Shot In Rich Trot
description: WESTBURY, L I., June 27 While trainers prepared their standardbreds for Saturday night's $50,000 American Trotting Championship, the uptotheminute consensus favored Spartan Hanover, last year's winner of Roosevelt's oldest fixture.

title: Networks Shift Fall Plans to Comply With Court
description: Six new situation comedies that had been scheduled for premieres in September have been eliminated by the television networks to comply with a courtordered reduction of their access to the prime viewing hours next fall.

title: Cards Trounce Mets 61
description: The St. Louis Cardinals, berthed on top of the National League's Eastern Division by 001 as they started a fourgame series last night with the Mets, commenced play as if not only their slim lead but also their very existence were at stake.

title: New Archbishop Has Liberal Activist Credentials
description: Newark's, new Archbishop is liberal activist who is backing the farmworkers' boycott of grapes and lettuce, who opposed the war in Vietnam and who developed strong ties to black Catholics years before the urban ministry became fashionable.

title: Barker Wins Net Final
description: Robert Barker of Sands Point, I,.I., defeated Al Doyle of New York City, 62, 46, 64, yesterday in the final of the Eastern men's senior claycourt in tournament at the New York Tennis Club in the Bronx. Barker is 44 years old and Doyle 57.

title: Dining: They Use Personal Touch, but Don't Strangle You With
description: The best thing about The Lair, which goes in for Frenchish cuisine at 1315 Second Avenue, is that the staff members really seem to be engrossed in the job of running a good restaurant and making you happy without trying to buddy you up. It's a smallish place, divided between pubbish in general dcor and elegantish in appointments. In a way, The Lair's attraction is that it doesn't quite seem a professional, commercial restaurant  although to call it amateurish would be an in justice.

title: Dutch World Cup Favorites of Everyone but Dutch
description: GELSENKIRCHEN, West Germany, June 27  Eleven men from the Netherlands captivated a crowd of 55,931 people for 90 minutes last night the way Walt Frazier, Joe Namath, Tom Seaver and Brad Park captivate New York sports fans when they are in good form.

title: S.E.C. Warns Against GetRichQuick Ploys
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 The Securities and Exchange Commission warned the public today against promoters of getrichquick schemes that promise spectacular returns but often are only variations of socalled Ponzi or pyramid type swindles.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
Aurelio Is Linked to a Bank Inquiry
description: Investigators looking into the Century National Bank and Trust Company have been told that Richard Aurelio, a Deputy Mayor in the Lindsay administration, was instrumental in seeing that interestfree city deposits remained in the bank, according to sources close to the inquiry.

title: Impeachment Panel Member In Maryland Governor's Race
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., June 27 (AP)Representative Lawrence J. Hogan, citing striking similarities between abuses of power on the national level and in Maryland, will seek the Republican nomination for Governor.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Officials Fear New Crisis As Energy Demand Rises
description: WASHINGTON, June 27Along the fabled Las Vegas Strip, the lights burn again at night. In South Dakota, reports Senator James Abourezk after a weekend in his home state, filling stations are open 24 hours a day.

title: Pirates, Union Agree
description: PITTSBURGH, June 27 (UPI)The Pittsburgh Pirates and Baseball Employes Union, Local 508, reached agreement today permitting ushers to distribute AllStar ballots to fans beginning tomorrow night at Three Rivers Stadium. The ushers had refused to distribute ballots to fans, contending their contract did not require them to distribute anything. The All?? Game will be played here July 23.

title: France and Iran Sign $4Billion Accord; Shah Will Receive 5 Nuclear Reactors
description: PARIS, June 27France and Iran signed a massive 10year development agreement today, including provision for the sale to Iran of five 1,000megawatt nuclear reactors worth $1.1billion.

title: Future of West Side Road Stirs A Hot Debate at State Hearing
description: An array of politicians, planners, environmentalists and members of civic groups yesterday assailed the concept of the super road as the best replacement for the dilapidated, twisting West Side Highway.

title: People and Business
description: Joe B. Cordell, a 46yearold financial man, was picked yesterday to be president and chief operating officer of the Jim Walter Corporation of Tampa, Fla.

title: 3 Share Golf Lead With 70's
description: CHICAGO, June 27 (UPI) Two seasoned golfers, Bob Goalby and Frank Beard, and a rookie on the pro tour, Gary McCord, cut a stroke off par today, at Butler National Golf Club to share the first round lead of the Western open with 70's.

title: The Summit Meeting: Support for Nixon...
description: WASHINGTONIn my threehour talk in Moscow with Leonid 1. Brezhnev, the Soviet party lender, on June 4, he underlined the importance of the agreements reached with President Nixon in 1972 and 1973 and spoke with confidence that further significant steps would result from his upcoming meeting with the President. His overriding concern was the control of the nuclear aims race. He spoke net only of the limitation but the mutual reduction of capability.

title: Enter the High Court
description: WASHINGTON, June 27Watergate, Watergate everywhere: John Ehrlichman on trial in Federal court; the House Judiciary Committee getting down to the tough stages of impeachment; the Senate Watergate committee about to issue its report; the Senate Judiciary Committee raking over the coals of the early Watergate investigation. And waiting in the wings, for what could be the most important entrance of all, the Supreme Court.

title: After 2 Years of Watergate Disclosures, Many Newspaper Readers Are Found Bored With the Subject
description: Nearly two years after the original Watergate disclosures which much of the American press thought marked its finest hourmany readers are becoming bored with the subject and angry with the press for having raised the subject in the first place.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, June 27The price of gold toppled to a fourmonth low today before a rally trimmed some of the losses.

title: The Other Perry Logs Victory No. 200
description: The other pitching Perry from Cleveland, Jim, the brother of the famed Gaylord, won his 200th major league game last night when the Indians edged the Boston Red Sox, 21, in Municipal Stadium.

title: Gillette President, Year in Post, Resigns
description: Edward Gelsthorpe, who only recently celebrated his first anniversary as president of the Gillette Company, the razor blade giant, announced his resignation yesterday. There were reports that he would join the United Brands Company, the world's largest producer and marketer of bananas.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The police in Burlington have reported suspicious circumstances in the disappearance of a 14yearold girl missing since Monday when she left for a babysitting job. The girl, Margaret Fox, had placed an ad in a newspaper seeking such jobs. Her parents said she had received calls from a person identifying himself as John Marshall, asking her to babysit Friday and then postpoining the job until Monday.

title: At First Catholic Pentecostal School, The Stress Is on Spontaneous Devotion
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I.For a Roman Catholic parochial school, the scene was unusual: children in jeans and Tshirts singing and clapping, some shaking tambourines on the auditorium stage, led by a cheerful nun in slacks.

title: F.T.C. Sets Guides on Ads for Children
description: The Federal Trade Commission issued a proposed set of guidelines yesterday barring the mention of premium offers, contests or sweepstakes in television advertising directed primarily toward children.

title: Issues in Moscow Talks
description: The principal subjects for discussion in Moscow between President Nixon and Soviet officials fall, according to American officials, into these categories:

title: REGENTS DISCUS TV IN CLASSROOMS
description: ALBANY, June 27The education bureaucracy cannot be reduced by any means known to man, William Jovanovich, member of the State Board of Regents since April 1, said today.

title: Chris Evert, Borg Gain at Wimbledon
description: WIMBLEDON, England, June 27Chris Evert is still in Wimbledon.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: F.T.C. ACTS TO CUT OILDIRECTOR TIES
description: WASHINGTON, June 27The Federal Trade Commission began action today to break up interlocking directorates involving a dozen oil and gas concerns, complaining that seven of their directors are on the boards of competing companies.

title: House Unit Votes Relief For Livestock Producers
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (AP) The House Agriculture Committee approved by a 27to2 vote today an emergency $2billion creditrelief measure for livestock producers, including sheep and goat raisers and corporate livestock operations.

title: Two Youths, 16, Arrested In Woman's Slaying Here
description: Two 16yearold suspects were arrested yesterday in the slaying of 78yearold Mrs. Clara Sokolsky, whose body was found in her ransacked apartment at Broadway and 140th Street seven weeks ago.

title: Moscow Denounces Three Journalists In British Agency
description: LONDON, June 27Soviet authorities have denounced three correspondents of Reuters, the British news agency, for their reporting on the Soviet Union.

title: Notes on People
description: Abba Eban, the former Foreign Minister of Israel, has accepted the invitation of Columbia University to lecture there this fall as a visiting professor.

title: Hospital Arbitrators Hoping to Finish Contract Today
description: Basil A. Paterson, chairman of the hospital arbitration panel, said yesterday that the board hoped to complete today its proposals for a new contract between the city's 42 voluntary hospitals and nursing homes and District 1199 of the National Union of Hospital and Health Care Employes.

title: PULP DUMPING DUTY TO BE REEXAMINED
description: WASHINGTON, June 27The Treasury, in an unusual action, asked the Tariff Commission today to take a second look at whether a domestic industry is being injured by imports of a product at dumping prices.The product in question is northern bleached hardwood kraft pulp from Canada, on which special dumping duties have been imposed since January, 1973. In its action today, the Treasury reaffirmed its original finding that the product was being sold in the United States market at lower prices than in Canadathat it is still being dumped'but the Treasury asked the tariff commission to reexamine its earlier finding of injury.

title: WILLIAM R. SHERWOOD
description: William R. Sherwood, a retired lawyer here, died Wednesday at his home on Revolutionary Road, Scarborough, N. Y. He was 71 years old.

title: Long LatinAmerican Tradition of Asylum Being Eroded in Reaction to Military Regimes
description: BUENOS AIRES, June 21 Political refugees are having trouble finding havens in Latin America that afford them the economic stability and security to remake their lives and carry on their struggles against authoritarian military regimes at home.

title: MERGER PLANNED BY TWO INSURERS
description: A plan to merge the Commonwealth Land Title Insurande Company of Philadelphia intq the Reliance Financial Services Corporation was announced jointly by the two companies yesterday.

title: SoninLaw Accused of $300,000 Fraud
description: NEWARK, June 27  A 7yearold widow filed suit against her soninlaw and two corporations in Federal District Court today for allegedly attempting to defraud her of $300,000 in cash and securities. She asked for $800,000 in compensatory and punitive damages.

title: TRUST SUIT NAMES CONTINENTAL CAN
description: WASHINGTON, June 27 (AP)  The Justice Department accused the nation's largest container manufacturer, the Continental Can Company Inc., with violating antitrust laws through reciprocal purchasing arrangements with certain customers.

title: Boating Outlook
description: The National Weather Service issued this forecast at 6:45 P.M. yesterday for New York Harbor, Long Island Sound, Long Island south shore and nearby coastal area:

title: ... And a Russian's Reflections on Dtente
description: If I had to describe in a single word the changes now taking place in U.S, foreign policy, in the role Americans play in the world, I could probably find no better term than accommodationaccommodation to the new realities of the international situation, to the changing foreign and domestic conditions in which U.S. policy is being conceived and shaped. Or, to put it differently, I might say that U.S. policy is being brought in line to a greater degree than formerly with America's resources, capabilities, potential, and national interests.

title: CITICORP INCREASING SIZE OF NOTE OFFER
description: Substantial interest by investors in Citicorp's recently announced offering of 15year floatingrate notes has led the banking concern to increase the size of the financing to $850million from the $250million issue originally planned.

title: U.S. Will Leave Two Bases In Thailand by End of Year
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, June 28 (Reuters)The United States will withdraw from two of its six remaining air bases in Thailand by the end of the year, it was officially announced today.

title: Junius Abramson, Lawyer And RealEstate Operator
description: Junius P. Abramson, a lawyer and realestate operator specializing in large midtown Manhattan properties, died yesterday at the Kings Brook Medical Center in Brooklyn, apparently of a heart attack. He was 69 years old and lived at 65 Oriental Boulevard, Brooklyn.

title: Millions for Museums
description: The State Council on the Arts announced grants of $5.6million to 21 museums and other institutions in New York City. As a result, the Metropolitan Museum of Art will rescind a cut in its hours. Details on Rage 26.

title: Soldiers and Guerrillas Fraternize Near Bissau
description: BISSORA, Portuguese Guinea, June 25Rebel and Government soldiers fraternize openly in this district capital 55 miles north of Bissau by one of the few asphalt roads in Portuguese Guinea.

title: National City Bank Lifts Its Base Lending Rate
description: The First National City Bank raised its base lending rate yesterday a quarter point to 11 per cent, thus completing the move by all the naticn's major commercial banks to that level.

title: Common Cause Suit on Campaign Funds Dismissed
description: WASHINGTON, June 28The Common Cause lawsuit that forced disclosure of more than $20million in secret contributions to President Nixon's 1972 campaign was dismissed today in United States District Court.

title: WHEAT FUTURES DECLINE AGAIN
description: With the prospect for more sunny weather over the Midwest for the next few days, wheat futures once again dropped the daily limit of 20 cents a bushel yesterday.

title: Sentence Delayed For Trot Figure
description: Forrest berry Jr who was convicted in Brooklyn Federal Court on May 31 on both counts of a sportsbriberyconspiracy charge, yesterday had his sentencing postponed until next Friday.

title: Market Place: Damon Outlook Stirs a Runout
description: Judging from the indications, this is still a market that is not the least bit forgiving of bad news.

title: Corporate Profits Show a Slight Rise For First Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, June 28Corporate profits rose slightly in the first quarter even after adjusting for the inventory profits resulting from inflation, revised Commerce Department figures disclosed today.

title: Portuguese Guinea Front: Recent Foes Clasp Hands
description: TEIXEIRA PINTO, Portuguese Guinea, June 27Gingerly, the heavily armed soldiers of the liberation movement stepped out of the forest into the cleared strip along the road leading north from this district town.

title: No Standout Apparent in Rich Trot
